loans.name: Suyono

texts.en:
Suyono is a 35-year-old entrepreneur; he is an immigrant from Solo, Central Java – one of the provinces in Indonesia. Suyono has a food stall business that sells meatballs, chicken soup called “soto” and “gado-gado” (a kind of salad eaten with peanut sauce). This business was inherited from his father. It has been running for 11 years. Suyono is married to Desi and blessed with a daughter: Putri, who is 8 years old and in the second grade of elementary school.

The challenge for Suyono in running the food stall business is the increasing price of meat in the market. With the capital that he currently has, the quantity of meat that he is able to buy is lower. In order to generate more income, Suyono is thinking to improve his business by selling fruit ice, but unfortunately Suyono does not have enough capital to do so. 

He learned that TLM would like to help entrepreneurs like him.  He is applying for a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to purchase a refrigerator to store the fruit, a blender and some wood to create a small table. Suyono hopes TLM will approve his loan application to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to store fruit, a blender and some wood to build a small table

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S., age 44, resides in Takeo Province in Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian Temples. S. sells cow ties and fish grillers, earning an income of 3.30 USD per day. His wife is an assistant at a local hospital, earning an income of 1.60 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 90 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase more cow ties to resell. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more cow ties to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bales of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Las Amistosas 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “LAS AMISTOSAS 1” y se ubica en el Estado de México. Se distingue por su gente trabajadora, por su agricultura y ganadería. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicita un prestamo para mejorar sus negocios. Araceli es la presidenta del grupo. Inició su negocio hace un año, la cual es una imprenta en la cuál realiza estampados en playeras y logotipos en vasos para cualquier evento social, requiere el prestamo para comprar más material de trabajo. Ella tiene 27 años, estudió hasta sexto de primaria, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negtocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Ella vive en unión libre y tiene una pequeña hija de 5 años. Con las ganancias que obtenga ahorrara una parte para la educación de su hijas ya que tienen el sueño de verla graduada algun día y teniendo todas las aportunidades que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Amistosas 1' (The Friendly Women) and is located in the State of Mexico which is noted for its hard-working people, its agriculture and its livestock raising.  The group has nine members and this is the third time that they are requesting a loan to improve their businesses.

Araceli is the group's president.  She started her printing business a year ago.  She prints designs on t-shirts and logos on glasses for any social event.  She needs this loan to buy more work materials.  Araceli is 27 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is a person who has a great desire to improve herself and own a successful business in order to provide her family with the best.  She lives with her partner and has a 5 year-old daughter.  Araceli will save some of the profits she makes for her daughter's education since her dream is to see her graduate some day and to have all the opportunities that she herself could not have.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for her printing business

loans.name: Donis Luis

texts.es:
Donis, de 30 años de edad, es originario de Quezalguaque un pueblo localizado en León, es padre de 2 hijos, el es comerciante, se dedica a vender CD y DVD. Al comienzo el señor Donis trabajaba en el campo, luego trabajo en construcción y desde hace dos años comenzó a trabajar en el sector comercio, vendiendo CD Y DVD de música películas, su esposa lo ayuda a atender el negocio, ellos venden  en el mercado de la estación de buses.

El solicito el préstamo para comprar CD para videos juegos de Play Station 2   y celulares  para vender en su local. Con esta inversión espera atraer mas clientes mejorar sus ventas e ingresos. En el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de videos juegos y vender celulares al por mayor.  Su próxima meta poner una local de venta de pollo.
texts.en:
Donis is 30 years old and originally from Quezalguaque - a village in León.  He has two children and is a salesman.  Donis sells CDs and DVDs.  He used to work in on the land, then he worked in construction.  Two years ago he started working in sales, selling CDs and DVDs.  His wife helps him in the business.  They make their sales in the bus station market.

Donis requested this loan to buy CDs, Play Station 2 games and cell phones to sell in his premises.  With this investment, he hopes to attract more customers and improve his sales and income.  In the future, he would like to own a video game store and sell cell phones wholesale.  His next goal is to set up premises where he will sell chicken.

loans.use: to buy CDs, Play Station 2 games and cell phones

loans.name: Paterna Aclep Group

texts.en:
Paterna is married with 3 children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She has been a farmer for 16 years, and grows corn to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her corn planting. 

Paterna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She is the leader of a 5 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her corn planting.

loans.name: Elizabeth Esther

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth Esther es socia del banco comunal Las tesoritas del Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Hace 2 años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, tiene dos hijos que todavía están a su cargo y a los cuales les paga los estudios, su esposo es maestro constructor.  Tienen que trabajar los dos para poder cubrir todos los gastos del hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 2,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: hará el pago por productos de belleza que sacó a crédito y con la otra parte del dinero cubrirá otro pedido el cual tendré para su stock.
Es poco el tiempo que trabaja con estos productos pero ya tiene un pequeño capital, que lo hará crecer poco a poco, todo lo que tiene hasta ahora es gracias a su esfuerzo y a la oportunidad que Manuela Ramos le dió.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth Esther is a member of the communal bank "Las Tesoritas" in the district of Yarinacocha, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 40, married and has three children.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years and sells beauty products by catalogue.  She has two children still in her care and for whom she covers education expenses.  Her husband is a master builder.  Both of them have to work in order to cover household expenses.

The new loan in the amount of 2,200 PEN will be used to buy beauty products that she ordered on credit.  The other part of the loan will be used to buy inventory.

She hasn't been working long but already has a small amount of capital which she wants to increase little by little.  Everything she currently has is thanks to her efforts and the opportunity given to her by Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Guluskan's Group

texts.en:
Guluskan is the leader of this group. She is 26 and married to a construction worker. She and her husband are raising a boy and a girl. Two years ago Guluskan’s parents presented her with two livestock animals. In two years, she increased the number of livestock to 12 animals. She contributes about 10,000 soms per month to the family budget by reselling livestock after fattening them. 

Guluskan applied for the loan because she needs additional money for purchasing more livestock for breeding. In the future, with money gained from reselling livestock, she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 49 years old and her husband, Pech, is 44 years old. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children. One son and two daughters. Two are in school and the other one stays at home. 

Sarin makes thatch for sale, while her husband is a construction worker. 

She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Daan   Dool Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "DANN DOOLE" est constitué de 5 femmewa. Pour faire face aux difficultés que vivent leurs familles respectives pour la satisfaction de leurs besoins sociaux de base (alimentation, santé, éducation), elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce de savon artisanale et industriel. Elles ont adhéré dans un grand groupe de solidarité, " mbotaay" qui compte  50 femmes et qui les appuient grâce à de petites subventions et de petits crédits revolving.Membres de l'UIMCEC depuis un an, elles sollicitent un prêt de 250 000F pour l'achat  de savon artisanale et de savon industriel. Le chef de groupe est marié et mère de 4 enfants; Son activité lui permet  de nourrir ses enfants et de satisfaire ses petits besoins. Elle ambitionne de louer une cantine au marché pour être plus proche de la clientèle.
texts.en:
The "DANN DOOLE" group is made up of five women. To deal with the problems their respective families face and cover their living expenses (food, health-related expenses, education) they work selling condiments, soap, and cooked food. They joined a larger solidarity group called "Mbotaay" which numbers 50 women and which helps them out with small grants and small revolving credits. 

Members of UIMCEC for one year now, they are requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy 5 cases of locally produced soap, and five cases of industrial soap. 

The leader of the group is married and the mother of four children. She has a little restaurant which permits her to feed her children and cover her minor expenses. Her ambition is to rent a shop in the market so as to be near her clientele.

loans.use: To buy locally made and industrial soap

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Vilma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: Massiel quien tiene  27 años es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, pertenece al alcom Las Estrellitas D. Carabayllo y tiene el cargo D. Tesorera, se dedica hace dos años a la venta D. prendas D. vestir a pedido, y D. ese modo ayuda a su pareja con los gastos D. la casa. Su meta es poder ser una gran empresaria en este rubro y tener su propio puesto mas adelante.
texts.en:
Massiel is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. She is part of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas D. Carabayllo” (The Little Stars of Carabayllo), where she serves as the treasurer. Massiel has been selling clothes by request for two years. Working in this manner enables her to help her partner with the household expenses.

Her goals are to be a great businesswoman in her field and to have her own vending post in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Chea, a 45-year-old industrious woman and the mother of four children, sells dried fish and vegetable in a local market. 

All of Chea’s children are unemployed but two are married and live in separate homes. 

Everyday Chea gets up early and goes to the market, until the evening.  Chea typically earns an average of $3 per day.  She also depends on her husband's income from a motor service company.  

Recently, Chea ran out of goods to sell and is now seeking a loan to purchase additional dry fish to sell.  With the rest of funds, Chea will buy chickens and ducks.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry fish.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 45-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. He describes himself as a visionary. 

He operates a farming business where he sells farm produce, such as cabbages and kale. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. His business is located near a technical institute in Kakamega. 

He describes his biggest business challenges to be seasonality and a poor road network. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy a van for transporting his farm produce to Kakamega town.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kururama Group

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman aged 60 years with three children, all of whom are married. She lives with her husband and two dependants in their house in Gweru.

Janet is cross-border trader who goes to South Africa and Botswana twice a month, where she sells seat covers and bedspreads. She has had this business since 1975. The business is affected by high tarriffs, import duty, and transport costs. With the amount of US$400 she applied for, Janet will buy material to make seat covers and bedspreads for sale. 

With the loan of US$400 she has applied for, Janet intends to diversify her business into poultry, where she looks foward to buying about 1000 chicks. This will enable her to pay school fees for her two grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy material for making seat covers and bedspreads

loans.name: Erica

texts.en: Erica is single. She has been educated through junior high school. Erica operates a mini-provisions shop and sells food and plastic bowls at Ayensudu near Elmina, which she has done for just a year. Erica sees to the well-being of her home. Erica will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Erica plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Edgardo has a pigpen and sells mature pigs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Edgardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edgardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his  pigs.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
La Sra. Paola pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson  II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene 01 hijo en edad escolar.

Desde pequeña ayudaba a su mamá con su negocio de venta de ropa, es así que fue creciendo, cuando formó su hogar se vió en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio para generar sus ingresos y de esta manera contribuir con la economía de su hogar, y fue así, que con la ayuda del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y con un capital de S/. 500.00, logró hacer realidad este negocio, que poco a poco lo a ido implementando. 
Actualmente está acondicionado en su casa un ambiente para exhibir sus productos pues tiene una vitrina, lo que le permitirá captar a nuevos clientes, además siempre está en la búsqueda de novedades para dar más  opciones a sus clientes.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 comprará ropa para niños y adultos, y zapatos para implementar su negocio, algunos de ellos son pedidos de sus clientes.
Paola es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio más grande que le permita generar más ganancias.  Está muy contenta con el apoyo que le birnda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of the 'Alisson II' community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in Lamas province, in San Martín department.  She is 27 years old, married, and has one school-age child.

Since she was a young girl, Paola helped her mom with her clothing business.  This is how she grew up.  When she formed her own home, she saw the need to start her own business in order to make income and thereby contribute towards her household finances.  With the help of Manuela Ramos and capital of 500 soles, she managed to start her own business and gradually fit it out.

Paola is currently setting up a space in her home in which to display her products in a display cabinet.  This will allow her to attract new customers.  She is always in search of new products so that she can provide her customers with more options.

With this new loan for 1,300 soles, Paola will buy children's and adults' clothes and shoes in order to stock her business.  Some of them are to fill orders that her customers have made.

Paola is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to have a larger business which will allow her to make more profits.  She is very happy with the support that she receives from Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Неъмат проживает в районе Яван. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более пяти лет занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров и теленка.
texts.en: Nemat lives in the Yavan region. He is 34 years old. He is married with three children. He has a secondary education. For more than five years he has  been breeding cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy two cows and a calf.

loans.use: buy two cows and a calf.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is fifty years old and married with four children. 

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  Rosalina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Rosalina has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Karimatou

texts.fr:
Karimatou est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur de taxi moto. Elle a 1 enfant.
Karimatou travaille comme tresseuse depuis 2003. Elle tresse essentiellement les femmes et vend des mèches, des tissages et des oreillers dans son salon de coiffure. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Karimatou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des tissages et des oreillers. Elle veut réinvestir une partie des bénéfices dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Karimatou voudrait ouvrir un atelier plus grand. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Karimatou is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a mototaxi driver. She has one child.
Karimatou has been working as a hair braider since 2003. She braids mostly women's hair, sells extensions, weaves, and cushions in her salon. She buys her supplies at the big market in Lomé. She works alone. For the moment, her business is ok.
Karimatou is applying for this first loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions, weaves, and cushions. She wants to reinvest part of the profits into her business.
In the coming years, Karimatou would like to open a bigger salon. With the profits, she intends on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Boresh Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her mid 50s, is married with seven children and three of them are still going to school. She has had a charcoal business for 15 years now.  She works from six in the morning through six in the evening daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. Zena will share this loan with her loan group, Boresh, which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Zena is requesting her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzani to buy more sacks of charcoal.  She used her previous loans to increase her charcoal stock, sell vitumbua (sweet fried rice cakes), and provide for her household expenses. She has successfully repaid all of her loans.  Zena's dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is one of those young smallholder farmers who are determined and are not limited by their age. He is an ever smiling youthful 22-year-old farmer from Endebes, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Paul is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his parents and siblings as a primary source of income. The living conditions in the Endebes, Kitale area are very tough and one needs to have tough skin in order to survive. Paul has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. 

Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Paul started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 3 years. Paul's sources of income are from producing vegetables, maize, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, which is a problem for Paul. The Endebes area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. 

Paul with great humility is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Paul is very determined to succeed, and because he is much disciplined with finances, he plans to accumulate profits to provide a secure future for himself and for his parents and siblings. Paul's dream is to provide a secure future for his siblings. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream.

Paul promises to make his payments punctually and is thankful to all those who will support him in acquiring the motorbike, all he can tell them is "Thank You".

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, for the speedy transportation of his farm produce to market.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Mrs. Demetrio is a very friendly and hard-working person; he has 3 children who every day fills him of love and inspiration to work and continue to covering all the expenses family. He has 2 years with his business and it began with the snack sales like potatoes, shells (another kin-d of snack in Mexico), pop corns and sodas. HIs business is near of a school, so that every day he has more clients. His family helps in the business, so that also it has become another way to be close to the family. This business has allowed to Don Demetrio to cover all the home expenses, for that reason he wants to grow his business buying video games in his snack to have bigger incomes.

He needs a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise and put video games in his snack, because this next Christmas season Don Demetrio has his bigger incomes from all the year, for that he wants to increase the capacity of his products to sell and a term of 3 to 6 months, he plans to return the loan

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don Demetrio es una persona muy amigable y trabajadora, tiene 3 hijos quienes todos los días lo llenan de amor e inspiración para continuar trabajando y seguir cubriendo los gastos de su familia. Tiene 2 años con su negocio e inició con la venta de botanas como papitas, conchitas, burritos y refrescos; su negocio se encuentra cerca de una escuela, por lo que cada día tiene mas clientes. Su familia ayuda en el negocio, por lo que también este se ha convertido en otro modo para convivir. Este negocio le ha permitido a Don Demetrio cubrir con los gastos de su hogar, por lo que quiere impulsar su negocio comprendo video juegos en su “Snack” para tener mayores ingresos.

El necesita un préstamo de $ 250 USD para comprar mercancía y para poner video juegos en su negocio, debido a que esta próxima temporada navideña Don Demetrio tiene sus mayores ingresos de todo el año, por lo que desea aumentar la capacidad de sus productos para vender y en un término de 3 a 6 meses, el planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and put video games

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en: Zabibu is married and has four children. She lives in the Vingunguti area in Dar es Salaam. Zabibu is self-employed and owns a shop near her residence. She is a housewife and only has a primary education. She couldn’t get move ahead with her education because her parents could not afford school expenses. After getting married, she decided to start a business. With the help of her husband, she managed to open a shop. The shop sells different consumable items but mainly food items, which have high turnover. The shop provides her with the opportunity to raise her children well. She would like to expand her business by adding additional stock to the shop. She does all this so she can meet the costs of educating her children and help her husband in raising the family. To expand her business she needs USD 550.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu M., a 31 year old mother of four children is a very dynamic woman. Musu and her husband learned soap making skills in one of the local skills training centers. 
She manages a soap production business with eight employees and her husband assists with selling the product in the remote villages of Sierra Leone. The soap is made out of palm oil, caustic soda and some colors. Musu can produce more than 2,000 pieces of soap a week and distributes them to retailers in various villages. It takes a week to complete the selling and then her husband collects the cash for another round of production. This means Musu waits for more than a week before she can produce more soap. Musu will use the loan funds for more raw materials to ensure flow of production without waiting for sales to be completed.

loans.use: Musu would like to purchase raw materials to make soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla is married. Her husband is employed and they have two small children, a 3-year old and a 6-month old. She started her business three years ago when her husband was unemployed and they couldn't cover household expenses. Her sister-in-law, a street vendor, offered to make Perla her assistant, and once Perla learned the basics of street vending, she struck out on her own. Now she is also a street vendor, selling clothes and footwear, and she's been doing very well now that she has a list of regular customers. She's a hard-working woman and she wants to keep on growing with her customers and her business.

Perla is asking for a US$325 loan to be able to buy seasonal merchandise for her business and, in that way, continue to grow it. That will provide her with a way to improve her children's quality of life and to look ahead to future expenses that will grow as her children get older. She offers to repay the loan in 5 months. She's very grateful for the help that you're giving her to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Perla es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado y tienen dos hijos pequeños de 3 años uno y el otro de 6 meses, ella inicio con su negocio hace tres años atrás cuando su esposo quedo desempleado y no podían cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue así como ella decidió ayudar a su esposo y su cuñada la invito a vender con ella como su ayudante y luego ella aprendió y se independizo y ahora ella vende ropa y calzado y le ha ido bien ya que ahora tiene una cartera de clientes fijos y ella desea seguir creciendo con sus clientes y su negocio ya que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Perla esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para poder comprar mercadería de temporada para su negocio y así poder continuar con el mismo y crecer para ofrecerle una mejor calida de vida a sus niños y poder enfrentar los gastos futuros que se incrementan cuando los niños crecen, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella te agradece mucho en el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y como emprendedora.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru:
When Muyassar got her first loan from MicroInvest, she was not sure that the loan would help her to work profitably. But by gradually increasing the amount of her loan, she was able to increase her inventory.

Muyassar is 51 years old, her husband works, her son is earning money in Russia and her daughter in law helps her in her business. She sells children’s clothing and footwear. Muyassar purchases her products at wholesale markets once a week. She plans on using her new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Когда сестра Муяссар свой первый займ в Микроинвест она не очень верила что с его помощью можно плодотворно работать. Но постепенно увеличивая сумму займа она добилась увеличения своего товарооборота. Муяссар 51 год, ее муж работает, сын на заработках в России, а невестка помогает по бизнесу. Ассортимент ее товаров составляет детские одежда и обувь. Товар приобретает на оптовых рынках раз в неделю. Муяссар и дальше собирается получать займы в Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.en: Shahzoda I. has been in business for seven years selling clothing and shoes in a bazaar.  She started with very little capital and a very small business.  Now her business is expanding.  Mrs. I. requests a loan of $1,100 to buy new goods for the winter season.  She has three children who help her in the bazaar after school.  In the future Mrs. I. wishes to open her own shop.

loans.use: For buying stock of winter clothes and shoes

loans.name: Dorah's Group

texts.en: Dorah is married with 6 children. She runs a pigery business. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Kikwisa M., age 26, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 4). She has a clothes and cosmetics business, which she started 2 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 12 noon and from 4pm to 6pm daily ,making a monthly profit of about $52.

In the past Kikwisa, took out 1 previous loan with Tujijenge to increase on her business. She now hopes for a new loan to increase on the same business. She will share this loan with her sub group members who have businesses dealing in selling clothes, charcoal and foods.

In the picture Kikwisa is 1st fron left

loans.use: to increase on business

loans.name: Mukuba North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane Kyeyune. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Jane is 32 years old and is married with a husband who does charcoal sales for work. She has 2 children aged 10 and 15, and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Rukia K., Fatuma N., Madina N., and Amina K.. Fatuma N. has a business selling potatoes and wants to purchase in bulk. Madina N. is currently operating a business selling scrap and wants a loan to increase inventory. Madina N. operates a business selling rice and wants to boost business. Amina K. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop

loans.name: Rosa Olimpia

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Olimpia B. is a 43-year-old from Bluefields, married to Rogelio Sequeira. They have 3 young children. Mrs. B. is the proprietor of a general store. Her customers live in the neighborhood and prefer her store because of the wide selection of products available there. Currently, Mrs. B. needs to buy 200 Kg of rice at $90, 100 Kg of sugar at $36, 100 Kg of beans at $50, 1 barrel of oil at $41 and 3 boxes of laundry detergent at $18 a box. With this loan, she will be able to increase stock in order to satisfy customer demand.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rosa Olimpia Benítez es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 43 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Rogelio Sequeira ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. Benítez es propietaria de una pulpería, sus clientes son los habitantes del barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos , en estos momentos la Sra. Benítez necesita comprar 2 quintales de arroz a $45.00 dólares el quintal , 1 quintal de azúcar a $36.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de frijoles a $50.00 dólares el quintal , 1 bidón de aceite a $ 41.00 dólares el bidón y 3 cajas de jabón de lavar ropa a $ 18.00 dólares cada caja con esta inversión podrá aumentar la cantidad de productos para satisfacer la necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: To by rice, sugar, beans, oil and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Doña Agripina is a courageous and enthusiastic lady who harvests excellent crops year after year thanks to her hard work in the field together with her loyal companion. Together they have created a beautiful family with decent children, and now both are working to support themselves. They still work their land growing potatoes, corn, and broad beans. The crop is sold in the city of Lima and also at the local market. The earnings have sustained her home for the past 4 years and she has been able to improve her house and today she needs the loan to adapt a small sales space at home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Agripina es una mujer con mucho coraje y entusiasmo, año tras año ha cosechado excelentes productos gracias a su ardua labor en el campo en compañía de su fiel compañero. Junto a él ha formado una linda familia cuyos hijos son hombres y mujeres de bien y ahora ambos trabajan para poder sostenerse. Aún continúan labrando su tierra y cultiva en ella papa, maíz y habas, su cosecha la oferta en la ciudad de Lima y también en el mercado local de su comunidad. Por 4 años con estas ganancias ha sostenido la economía de su hogar y ha podido mejorar las instalaciones de su casa y hoy necesita un préstamo para concretar el anhelo de establecer un pequeño espacio de ventas en casa.

loans.use: Establish a general store at home.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe En Cristo Group

texts.en:
J. is a single 40-year-old mother of three beautiful children. Her motivation in life is to provide a good life for her children, and to send them all to a good school. With this loan she will begin selling used clothing. She plans on traveling to the bigger city of Santiago to purchase everything and then will sell it in her community for a small profit. She hopes that one day she will have a house of her own, and will be able to live in a safe part of town. Her favorite foods are plantains with meat, and in her free time she likes reading her Bible.

Note: This is a group loan. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Thank you for supporting this group of entrepreneurs, and God Bless!

loans.use: To buy used clothing for retail.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna O. is a lady from the town of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega. It is with much effort that she runs a clothing and shoe sale business in her own home, where she has three display cases to show her products.

She currently needs to obtain merchandise from her providers in order to offer them in her business because she is slowly selling out her inventory. That is why she is looking for Ceprodel’s help in obtaining a credit to purchase said merchandise and in that way continue to support her home that needs that investment.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Reyna O. es una dama originaria del municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de venta de ropa y calzado en su propia casa de habitación donde posee tres vitrinas para mostrar sus productos.

La necesidad que ella hoy en día atraviesa es que debe de adquirir la mercadería de sus proveedores para ofrecerla en su negocio por lo que poco a poco se le ha venido agotando su inventario. Por este motivo ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para adquirir dicha mercadería y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto necesita de inversión.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 36 years old and is married with four children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in spices like pepper and onions by "hawking": she balances her stock on her head and walks to her customers' doors to sell. Her business has enabled her to support two children to finish senior high school; they are now ready to enter university this year (the other two are in junior high school).

She is seeking a loan to buy more bags of pepper and onions to increase her inventory. She hopes to thereby double her savings to take care of her children in school. She belongs to the community group the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another and provide assistance to one another in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of wares

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael E. sells clothes and provisions. She is married with 6 children. Rachael sells her clothes and provisions at home and in the market. She is determined to lift her family above poverty.

Rachael is requesting the loan amount of $450 to buy more provisions and clothes for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy  more clothes and provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Melba Josefa

texts.es: La señora P.  tiene 60 años de edad es madre soltera con un hijo el cual es bachiller , la actividad economica es la venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales la venta de cuajada y otros teniendo treinta y tres años de ejercer esta actividad la cual le ha permitido sacar adalante a su hijo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar su negocio y que fundacion siempre este dispuesto a seguirla apoyando para poder lograr su porososito , el cual es seguir con la actividad ya que es su unica fuente de ingreso , otro sueño de ella es que un dia su hijo le de la alegria de ser abuela .
texts.en:
Penalba is 60 years old and she is a single mother to one son, a high school graduate. She sells soft drinks and fresh squeezed juices and other drinks and she has been doing so for 33 years. Her work has permitted her to support her son and to improve their living conditions. One of her dreams is to expand her business and she wishes that «Fundacion» continue to support her to make her dream a reality. She wishes to continue running her business which is her only source of income. Another one of her dream is that one day her son provide her the joy of becoming a grandmother.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun E. is a villager in Sam Raong village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Choup Soeun, are farmers and they own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice and vegetables. They do not earn enough money for living and they face a problE. with their productivity. Therefore Mrs. Bun E. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in her fields. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 55 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other three children are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in her fields.

loans.name: Vichet

texts.en: Mr. Vichet H. was born in 1978. He lives in Trapaing Lvea village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker who can make a small income to support his family. Since his work place is far from his house and he usually spends a lot of money on transportation, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his saving to buy a motorbike. In addition, he can use the motorbike as a taxi to earn extra income. His wife, Mrs. Sok Sorphone, is a garment factory worker. Mr. Vichet H. is 30 years old and the father of two children one of whom is enrolled in the local school but the other one is too young for school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Phallim

texts.en:
Mrs. Phallim Y. is 33 years old and she now lives in Bantey Thmey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. She now wants to cultivate rice in the dry season; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to cultivate this. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the farm. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan.

Mrs. Phallim Y. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Mach Thorn, is a construction worker. Her husband is also present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the farm.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Mariam M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of thirteen and twenty-seven. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Mariam has been running a tailoring business, She purchases vitambaa (fabric), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and has been making them into clothing, mainly for women, since 2007. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Mariam currently earns about US$ 200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy material for making clothes. In the future, she plans to buy more fabrics for making clothes. Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Haika

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Haika C. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 3 and 9. Haika has been running a business selling phone accessories since 2005.

Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Haika currently earns about $60 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $475 USD in order to increase stock of phone accessories. In the future, she plans to increase phone accessories and varieties of phones in her business. Haika thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase stock of phone accessories and business range

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla lives in Minlasag, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She became a member of Paglaum on September 25, 2007. Hermocilla has been engaged in hog raising, the reason why she requested the PHP 12,000 loan amount.

Now she is inspired and excited for the coming delivery of her hog. There are already target buyers for the upcoming piglets.She’s praying and hoping that the hog is in good condition always so that her project will be successful.

The couple also is industrious. They also have a farm for their own consumption and the rest of the products are sold, too. Most of their farm produce is "kamoteng Kahoy" (Cassava) and other root crops.

Hermocilla hopes that in the future she can build a big pigpen for her hogs and piglets, so that her business grows in number and in size. That can provide them a decent family life.

She is thankful for Paglaum’s programs and services and its continued support, too.

loans.use: to expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar M. hace quinces años que vive por esta zona, el es nacido en Montero de Santa Cruz, ahora vive en este lugar llamado Jardín de las delicias con su esposa la Sra. Lidia Arias Chávez y sus tres hijos, la actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, con la cual mantiene a su familia, generalmente se dedica a la siembra de maní, maíz, y arroz. El cuenta con una parcela en este lugar de 38 hras. De tierra en la que ahora debido a la época quiere sembrar papa. La esposa realiza las labores del hogar ademas colabora con el esposo en las labores agricolas.
texts.en:
Edgar M. was born in Montero de Santa Cruz and for the past fifteen years has lived in a place called Jardín de las Delicias with his wife, Lidia Arias Chavez, and their three children.

He works on his family farm, which cultivates peanuts, corn, and rice. He has a 38 hectare plot of land. According to the season, he now plans to plant potatoes. His wife completes the household chores but also helps her husband with the farm work.

Translated from Spanish by Kerrie Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Solof Group

texts.en: Mrs. E. Betty is 25 years old and married. She has a five-year-old child who is in school. She has a hair-dressing salon for plaiting, treating, retouching, and styling hair. She has had her salon for four years. The major challenge with her business is that when the electricity is off, she cannot serve her customers. She is using this loan to purchase a generator, and a hair drier and hair rollers to improve her business. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and have a good home.

loans.use: Purchase equipment (generator, drier, hair rollers)

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Муж Нигины (на фото)занимается куплей продажей скота, а Нигина помогает ему ухаживать за скотом дома. Оба супруга работают в колхозе. Нигине 33 года, ее мужу тоже, имеют 4 детей. Доход от купли и продажи скота является дополнительным источником дохода. Нигина знает о программе кредитования КИВА и поэтому решила получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nigina and her husband, who is featured on this photo, work on a collective farm. Nigina also helps her husband tend to the cattle. The profit from cattle sales is their additional source of income. Nigina and her husband are 33 years old and have four children. Nigina knows about Kiva and decided to apply for a loan that would allow her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman A. is a 35-year-old trader who sells food products such as butter, beverages, candies, sugar and salt. He started his business five years ago when his profession as a schoolmaster did not bring him enough income to keep the family which consists of a wife and two children.

Telman would like to expand his business and purchase more items to sell. For this purpose he has applied for a $1200 loan.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel P. ya ha sido acreditado de FVP el cual pago puntualmente. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo más moderno y más variedad de productos para vender en el salón de belleza. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esa inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para que su negocio tenga más variedad y mas ingresos para su familia ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus padres que son ya personas de edad mayor.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel P. has already received one loan from FVP and he paid it punctually. Now he is requesting another loan to purchase more modern equipment and a greater variety of products to sell in his beauty salon. At this time, he lacks the funds necessary to make this investment and he doesn't want to leave his business under-capitalized. This is why he seeks your cooperation: so that his business can have more variety and he can earn more income for his family, including his parents who depend on him now that they are elderly.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his beauty salon

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
“If others can, why can’t I?” This is what Cristina A. voiced when she was asked about her principle in life. Cristina is now 46 years old and married to Zenon who is a foreman carpenter in Cabanatuan City. The couple and their children live in a place near the Cagayan River at Barangay Lullutan, Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with three children who are all studying. Crispin, their eldest, is now in college; the same with Melissa who was a college freshman; Angelo, their youngest, is studying in high school.

Cristina runs a variety store in front of their house. She sells various products to generate higher income for her family. She is thankful that, through the business, her family was able to survive the hardships of life. She is very proud that she is able to send her children to school through the business. She even goes to Pangasinan just to purchase fresh and dried fish to have sufficient source of income.

Cristina is hoping that, someday, their way of living will improve through her own sacrifices and patience. But for the meantime, her children’s education is her priority.  She believes that she can also make her business progressive just like others who are striving to succeed. To further develop her business, Cristina is applying for a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional working capital.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn E., 39, owns a small eatery along the side streets of their community. Her store is located very near a local health center, so she caters to most of the centers' clients as well. Her husband, Rolando, 43, helps in their business by selling wood and charcoal for fuel (instead of expensive petrol gas). They also use wood and charcoal for their food business.

They live in Phase 7C, Package 7, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. They have 4 children. 2 are currently enrolled in high school and the other 2 are in grade school. Their earnings go towards the children's education and the rest cover their family's basic daily needs.

Marilyn is on her 4th loan cycle with CCT. Her current loan is PHP 10,000. Part of her loan proceeds was used to purchase new pots and pans for her food business. She is looking into expanding her food business due to the increase in daily human activities in their area.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils and towards children's school fees.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
46-year-old Feliza R. is a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has four children and a supportive husband who helps her manage their 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) farm. Her dream for her children is that all of them will be able to graduate from college so that, when they are older, they will be able to provide their families with a better future.

Feliza would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase herbicides and fertilizers. These two items are very important, especially in ensuring a quality and abundant harvest.

Now, Feliza actively joins in the CEVI cluster meetings where she obtains CEVI's credit services, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Yalu

texts.es:
Yalu es casada y tiene 49 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el pueblo joven Nueva Esperanza, en la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace quince años ella maneja junto a su esposo un pequeño taller donD. confeccionan bolsas y sacos D. polietileno, los cuales son usados para el almacenamiento y transporte D. diversos productos; ellos trabajan en base a pedidos y con este negocio solventan los gastos D. su hogar.

La demanda D. sus bolsas ha venido creciendo y Yalu no se abastece para trabajar y terminar todos los pedidos que le han solicitado, por lo que está solicitando un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles, que utilizará en la ampliación D. su taller con la compra D. otra máquina D. coser semi industrial que pueda agilizar el trabajo y D. esa manera cumplir con lo solicitado por su clientela.

Su mas granD. anhelo es tener un gran taller D. confección D. bolsas D. polietileno, y ser una empresaria que con su negocio brinD. oportunidades D. trabajo a las personas inválidas marginadas.

Yalu es una D. nuestras clientes mas antiguas, se le ha otorgado 12 créditos, los que ha cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yalu is married, 49 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in the new neighborhood of Nueva Esperanza in the city of Chiclayo.

For the last 15 years she has run a small workship with her husband where they manufacture polyethylene bags and sacks which are used for storing and transporting various products. They work based on customers' orders and with the income from this business they are able to pay their household expenses.

The demand for their bags has grown and Yalu does not have enough supplies to work and finish all of the orders they have received, so she is asking for a loan of 2000 soles. She will use the loan to expand her store and buy another semi-industrial sewing machine which will expedite the manufacturing process and allow her to meet the demands of her clients.

Her biggest dream is to have a large workshop for the manufacturing of polyethylene bags and to be an entrepreneur whose business offers employment opportunities to marginalized and disabled people.

Yalu is one of our oldest clients, she has been granted 12 loans so far, all of which she has paid off punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying polyethylene to make bags and sacks

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a member of the KItanzini borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 25 years old woman.she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 7,5, and 2 years.

Tatu started her own clothing business selling kanga and vitenge(fabric)5 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Tatu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Tatu hopes to save more money,pay school fees,get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is a tricycle driver. He is 57 years old, married and has four children who are all married with their own families.

Norberto is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders through its Field Partner Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. This amount will be of great help in the maintenance of his motorcycle. Some of the things that he will buy are a replacement chain and sprocket so as to avoid an accident.

loans.use: To buy parts for his tricycle transport

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia A. H. reside en Mejicanos en El departamento de San Salvador. Dora tiene 43 años de edad se encuentra divorciada y vive solamente con sus tres hijos. Dora tiene su propio negocio donde vende variedad de bebidas y boquitas, el crédito que solicita Dora es para surtir su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta Dora y sus hijos, con este crédito podrá aumentar sus ventas y las sus ganancias.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Juan Hermilo

texts.es: El señor Juan Hermilo vive con su esposa la señora Ana Gabriela y son padres de familia de 2 niños, el labora para una empresa desde hace un año en el área de operador, y por las noches los fines de semana el y su esposa atienden su negocio propio de nombre “Tacos La Avenida” establecido desde hace 2 años, negocio donde venden tacos, hamburguesas, papas con queso etc. Por tal motivo están solicitando este crédito ya que desean invertir en aparatos eléctricos y mercancía para la elaboración de sus comidas, y así brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Hermilio and his wife, Ana Gabriela, are parents of two children. He has worked as an operator for a company for the last year. During the evening hours on weekends he and his wife tend to their own food preparation establishment, known as "Tacos La Avenida", which has been in existence for the past two years and where they sell tacos, hamburgers, potatos with cheese, etc. They are requesting this loan to buy electric appliances and ingredients needed for their food preparation thereby providing better service for their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for the production and sale of prepared meals.

loans.name: Marcelina Katherine

texts.es:
La señora MARCELINA KATHERINE  V. S., tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios superiores de secretariado y técnicos de manualidades en tela y vidrios, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica elaboración de manualidades como: carteras, manteles, vitrales, bolsos, etc. Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar telas, pinturas, cintas, hilos, algodón, etc para elaborar sus manualidades.
Marcelina sueña con aumentar sus ventas para asi obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcelina Katherine V. S. is 33 years old and lives in the District of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” (Successful Businesswomen II). Marcelina completed secretarial school as well as technical training in fabric and glass handicrafts. She has two young children who are financially dependent on her.

Marcelina makes handicrafts such as satchels, tablecloths, stained glass, purses, etc. This will be her first loan of 300 soles, which will be used to buy fabrics, paints, ribbons, yarn, cotton, and other materials for her handmade items. She dreams of increasing her sales so that her earnings will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, paints, ribbons, yarn, cotton, and other materials

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta is a nurse by training. She also has a medicine stall, where she treats and sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She has been selling medicines for a long time. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hard worker and she is determined to excel in her business and family life. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Living Rock Group

texts.en:
Hellen K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Living Rock. She is married with two children between the ages of 7 and 24 years old. Her children's education levels are 5th grade through university student. She also cares for seven siblings. She is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support.

Hellen and her family live around the Ganta Parking Community of Gbarnga City, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells at retail to residents of her community in Gbarnga. Hellen has been running this business for four years, and is hoping to improve her business by establishing a new enterprise in the near future.

The cost of transportation is a difficulty Hellen faces when purchasing goods from the wholesaler, because the higher the price of goods, the lower the profit. She talks to customers in a good manner and always tries to establish a relationship with customers in order to encourage them to always come to patronize her business. 

She needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve her business. Hellen dreams of giving her family the best help to give them a better life.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to improve the business

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Mrs. Isatu K. is a 45 years old and is a married woman with two children: a male and a female. She resides in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She sells building timber and bags of coal in Freetown.

Isatu is a member of LAPOSL group based in Freetown, and she has obtained three previous loans from LAPOSL. With her previous loans, she expanded her business by purchasing more timber and bags of coal. She made an increased profit that allowed her to send her two children to school.

Isatu hopes to expand her business again with this new loan by purchasing more timber and bags of coal.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and bags of coal

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario es un cliente nuevo que vive en la zona Rosales, el cliente llego por consejo de vecinos de la zona, Actualmente el señor Mario vive con su esposa  y dos hijos, la mayor ya se mantiene sola y solo llega a dormir. La señora Benita, esposa de don Mario trabaja como empleada del hogar en obrajes y juntos ayudan con sus gastos al hijo mayor que tiene una beca de estudio en la carrera de medicina en el Paiz de Venezuela.                                                                                                                            La familia aparte del trabajo que tienen tambien tienen un negocio de crianza de perros de raza Labrador y Coquer, este negocio les ayuda a salir de apuros ya que un cachorro esta cotizado entre 300 a 350 dolares.El Sr. Mario solicita este credito porqe necesita comprar una computadora para ayudar a su hijo con sus estudios y estar al tanto de su salud, asi como tambien estar en contacto con clientes que el hijo contacto en el pais vecino.
texts.en:
Mario is a new client who lives in the zone of Rosales. He joined us through a recommendation from his neighbors. Currently, Mario lives with his wife and two children, the oldest of whom takes care of herself and only comes home to sleep. Mario's wife, Benita, works as a housekeeper, and together they help with their son's expenses, who has a scholarship for medical school in the country of Venezuela. Aside from this job, they also have a business in which they raise labradors and cocker spaniels. This business helps them get through hardships, since a puppy costs between 300 and 350 dollars. Mario is requesting this credit because he needs to purchase a computer to help his son with his studies and keep after his health, as well as staying in contact with his son's clients in the neighboring country.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang S. is 36 years old, and is a good mother blessed with five children. Her two grown daughters work in a garment factory while other three go to school. Her husband is a palm climber who taps palm juice and turns it into sugar for sale.
Mang S. stays at home to make Khmer noodles. She also takes the noodles to retail sellers at the market. In order to make her business more successful and earn additional income, Mang S. is requesting a loan to increase the capital of her noodle-producing business. She intends to use the rest of the loan to buy an old motorbike for travel purposes.
Note: Mang S. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: As capital for her noodle-producing business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda E. is currently in the business of selling bread at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread to sell. Linda is 41 years old and is married to a journalist. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bakery. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Tamaraneh Social Club Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tamaraneh Social Club' group. They are small-scale petty businesspeople from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kassim M. J.. The 23-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have 1 infant child. For a year now, Kassim has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice and “benne” (sesame seeds). With his share of this loan, he will buy palm oil, rice and 'benne'. 

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer Abdul Karim Conteh handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice and 'benne'

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
Awa S. is a 34-year-old woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of three children.

Madame S. raises pigs which she sells in the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. The revenues generated by this activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Madame S. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for six years and has always paid back her loans on time. With this loan, she will buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina C. is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Brgy. Tabunan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Segundina owns & operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Segundina has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Segundina joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Segundina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from NWTF. Segundina is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her fifth loan from NWTF.  Segundina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda P., 56, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Rogelio P., they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Yolanda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 24,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries and other products to be incorporated to her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other products to be incorporated to her current product inventory.

loans.name: Ea's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four people who are villagers living in Prey Phdau Cheung village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ea S. is the group leader. She was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a weaver at her house. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ea S. decided to apply for a loan to buy silk. Her husband, Mr. Yon Yoem, is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family.  She has five children. Three of the children are weavers and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca vive en casa del esposo con su hijo en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en un colegio de la ciudad de la Paz como profesora.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar los estudios de su hijo ya que en el colegio donde estudia tiene que pagar por adelantado para que el costo de pensiones le sea más económico.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002 y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and son in her own home, located in the Achachicala zone of La Paz. She works as a teacher in La Paz and is requesting this loan in order to pay for her son’s education, as she must pay in advance in order to keep the cost as low as possible. She has been working with Impro since 2002 and has had a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Jose Abedon

texts.es: El señor José tiene 36 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El señor José tiene una unidad de moto taxi, la cual circula en toda el área urbana desde las seis de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche. El ya tiene 7 años de tener negocio, cabe señalar que el la compro con el objetivo de suplir sus necesidades económicas dado que la situación del país esta difícil y no podía conseguir empleo. Ahora en día, el trabaja como chofer de la moto taxi y puede brindar la manutención a su familia. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar unos repuestos para la unidad, con el objetivo de brindarle mayor presentación a la misma. Sueña que sus hijos pequeños puedan prepararse en la universidad producto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose is 36, is married, and has two small children. Jose has a motocar taxi, which circulates through the urban area from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. He has been running this business for the past 7 years, which he bought in order to be able to take care of his family because the situation in his country is difficult and he couldn't find a job. Now he cdrives the motocar taxi and he can provide for his family. He is requesting this loan to buy some parts for his taxi so as to improve its appearance. He dreams of being able to send his children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy taxi parts.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Gemalyn owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gemalyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years now.

Gemalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Gemalyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mr. Saroem R. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhem Kong, is 29 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have one daughter. The family lives along National Road No. 5, approximately 20 kilometers from the capital city of Cambodia, Phnom Penh. Saroem was not in the photo; instead, his wife is shown.

Saroem has been operating a motorbike-washing business in his village since 2007. His wife assists her husband in the business. He is a fisherman as well.

Saroem is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to build a shelter where he will operate his motorbike washing and cleaning business.

loans.use: To build a place where he can operate his washing and cleaning motorbike business.

loans.name: Nkai

texts.en:
Nkai M. is a 32-year-old gentleman who is married to Silantoi M.. Together they have four school-going children. Nkai has been farming for the last six years. He then sells the produce at a profit.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan; he is planning to spend it to prepare land for planting more potatoes and also to buy some chemicals to spray those he has already planted. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Nkai’s dream is to do large-scale farming and be the best potato farmer in his area. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals

loans.use: To prepare land for planting potatoes and buy chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil and more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel L.
