This is her eighth loan with AFODENIC. The proceeds will be used to purchase building materials to repair the wall in front of her house, providing greater security for her family. Her goals include obtaining additional funds so that her husband can cultivate and improve their land. Eufemia says “thank you” to AFODENIC for the assistance and benefits they have provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Feeling uncomfortable and discontented with the mediocrity of their life, 47-year-old Susana R. decided to venture into hog-raising and utilize their backyard for that business. While her husband continues farming, Susana also grows her small business to contribute in providing for their family's needs, especially for the education of their two children. Aside from this, the couple is looking forward to doing some house renovations in the future.

Initially, Susana joined the Community Economic Venture Inc. (CEVI), a growing micro-finance institution in the Philippines, with a plain hope to borrow Php 9,000 as additional capital. But she was surprised to gain more than that from CEVI. Her membership in this institution enables her to spend more time reading some biblical reflections and to share her learning with other members.

loans.use: additional pigs

loans.name: Adyasuren

texts.en:
Adyasuren Y. is a 47-year-old married man with four children between the ages of 10 and 25. His family lives in Harhorin, Mongolia's ancient capital city. His spouse Amar, 48, is unemployed and therefore stays home. His second child, Batsuh, 24, got just married and started living apart on his own.

Adyasuren is a welder. He makes iron stuff such as stoves, house roofs, and fence doors using thin and thick black iron and thin white iron. Mostly local residents and herders give him orders for stoves, stove tubes, etc. He has been running this business since 1990. For many years, it was the only source of income for his family. Starting this year, his eldest child started working and now helps to increase the family's income. Adyasuren is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Antolin

texts.en:
Antolin L. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 35 years old. Antolin is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Antolin owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motor-cab transport service. Antolin has been engaged in his business for more than three years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (about $187) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Antolin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antolin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase tires and other accessories. Antolin is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Antolin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Abass

texts.fr: abass D. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis juin 2007.il est plombier de fonction mais il eleve parallelement des moutons chez lui qui sont destines a la vente durant la periode de la tabaski.il sollicite un credit de deux cent mille(200 000)frs pour accroitre le nombre deja existant.l'augmentation de ses benefices lui permettra d'accroitre son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Abass D. has been a member of the bank of Yoff since June 2007. He works as a plumber, but at home he also raises sheep destined to be sold during the Tabaski holidays (muslim feast). He’s requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to increase the number he already has. The growth in his profits will enable him to grow his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren T. is a widow who has two children aged 13 and 14. Her family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. Both her children are attending a local elementary school.

Since 2004, Lhamsuren has been running a retail business selling dairy products at a small rental stall in the local food market. As a result of her hard work, her working capital has increased from 100,000 tugrugs to 800,000 tugrugs. Her dairy sales income is the only income of her family.

Lhamsuren is an open minded, loyal, and a locally well-respected person. Her dream, is to have her own workplace. With this loan she will purchase more dairy products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 41 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 6 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Barrio Villa Pilar y estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. cristalería.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar cristalería como jarras D. vidrio, vasos D. champagne, vasos D. gaseosa, tazas, vasos D. vino, etc. Además utensilios D. cocina, su mercadería la compra en Desaguadero y lo lleva directo a Arequipa cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y la forma D. trabajo.

loans.use: Para la compra de jarras de vidrio, vasos de champagne, vasos de gaseosa, tazas, vasos de vino, etc. Además utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 34 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el trabajo de empleada doméstica, ella limpia casa y cocina para otras personas, nuestra socia realiza esta labor desde muy joven, poco a poco ha adquirido mayores beneficios dentro de su labor, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir  en algunos gastos personales.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Carmen. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu San Jeronimo” and a native of Cusco.

Carmen is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She divides her time between her household chores and her job as a domestic employee in which she cleans and cooks for other people. Carmen started working at a young age and gradually acquired more benefits as she gained experience. She is requesting a loan to pay for some personal expenses.

Carmen appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 5 meses de nacido y vive junto a su esposa en casa de su padre ubicada en el sector San Juan de Paredones – Muy Finca, en el distrito de Mochumí, a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Cría cerdos, ovejas y patos los cuales vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Paralelamente también trabaja como obrero agrícola y eventualmente ayuda a su padre en el mantenimiento de sus campos de cultivo. Con estos ingresos trata de mantener y sacar adelante a su joven familia.

Hace dos semanas una de sus cerdas parió 10 cerditos. El planea criarlos y mantenerlos saludables para luego venderlos, pero los recursos que tiene no le abastecen para comprar los alimentos balanceados que ellos requieren. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es poder construir su casa propia, para ello trabaja constantemente. El es muy conocido por los vecinos de la zona que lo consideran una persona honrada y servicial.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years of age and has a 5 month old son. He and his wife live in his father's house, which is located in the San Juan de Paredones – Muy Finca sector, in the Mochumí district, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For four years he has raised small animals such as pigs, sheep and ducks, which he has then sold to businessmen who frequent the area. At the same time he has also worked in agriculture and helped his father maintain his farming land. With this income he has tried to keep his young family going and move them forward. Two weeks ago one of his pigs gave birth to ten piglets. He plans to raise them and keep them healthy so that he can sell them later on, but his earnings aren't enough to provide the balanced diet that they require. For this reason he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 600 nuevos soles. His greatest wish is to be able to build his own house, for which he works constantly. He is very well known by the residents of his neighbourhood who consider him to be an honourable and helpful person.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional food to raise piglets

location.town: Sector Paredones - Muy Finca - Mochumí - Lambayequ

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria Dolores

texts.es: Gloria tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que agradece mucho el apoyo brindado ya que s por medio de los financiamientos que estas personas pueden salir adelante. Su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida, por lo que inicio de la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingreso que para la alimentación diaria de su familia, y a pesar de haber tenido tantos problemas ha tenido mucha fuerza para salir adelante. Por lo que es una mujer muy responsable pues ella se preocupa por recoger las cuotas de su crédito. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos naturales, leña y ciertos utensilios de cocina. El sueño de Gloria es ampliar su negocio para proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que solicitan.
texts.en:
Gloria has had several loans with Fundación León 2000 so she is thankful for the support she receives. Through these loans these people can get ahead. Gloria makes and sells food. Initially, it was to obtain a source of income in order to feed her family daily and in spite of having had many problems, she has had lots of strength to move forward. Since she is a very responsible woman, she is very concerned about collecting her loan payments. She requests this loan in order to buy basic grains, natural soft drinks, firewood and some kitchen utensils. Gloria’s dream is to expand her business in order to provide her clients with what they request.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es: Doña Daisy tiene 45 años de edad, mujer trabajadora y organizadora de su propio negocio, modista desde hace quince años, desde joven estudio costura y luego para modista con apoyo de su esposo, procreo dos hijos uno trabaja y el otro estudia, su esposo es sastre y ambos han logrado alquilar un local para hacer los vestido, faldas, camisa, cobertores y todo lo que el cliente pida, dan al crédito a personas conocidas, pero su mayor anhelo es poder tener su propio taller y no estar pagando ya abecés no se vende lo suficiente. Con este crédito lo que desea comprar es materia prima para trabajar como: telas de colores variadas, botones, Ciper,  hilos, bordados, madeja, entre otros para hacer sus bonitos variada vestidos. Lo que espera poder vender más en esta navidad. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con su financiamiento el cual es de mucho beneficio para crecer en su sastrería con la venta y la atracción de clientes nuevos que espera captar.
texts.en:
Daisy is 45 years old, a hardworking woman who has started her own business. She studied sewing as a young woman and became a seamstress 15 years ago with the help of her husband. Daisy has two children, one of whom works and one of whom is a student. Her husband is a tailor, and both have managed to rent a place where they sew dresses, skirts, shirts, quilts and whatever else customers ask for. They even offer payment plans to well known customers. Daisy and her husband's biggest dream is to have their own workshop and not have to pay rent since sometimes they can't sell enough to cover it. With this loan, they would like to buy raw materials, such as brightly colored fabrics, buttons, zippers, thread, embroidering materials, yarn, etc. to make a variety of pretty dresses, which they hope to sell more of this Christmas. They would like to thank the institution for the support it has provided with this loan, which has benefited their workshop greatly, helping it grow in sales and become a bigger attraction to new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials to make dresses

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has two children who attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Sakina works hard to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Sabina runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She buys her goods from Accra. Sakina has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk so she can increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Janifa

texts.en:
Janifa M. is currently in the business of selling sugar in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar to sell. Janifa is 32-years-old and is married to a businessman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Kalylova Misirat`s Group

texts.en: Misirat is 55 years old and is married with two sons. Her husband is a pensioner and her elder son is currently a guest worker in Russia, usually sending about 250 dollars monthly. Misirat’s family deals in livestock. They have three milk cows, one horse and a few sheep and also produce milk and milk products such as yogurt, sour cream and kefir (a fermented milk drink). For this loan she is planning to buy a milk cow. In the future she hopes to increase the number of her milk cows and produce enough milk to have supply agreements with kindergartens. Mahpuba, 51, is married and has four children: three daughters and one son. Her elder two daughters are working in Russia as salespersons and her husband works in a tobacco plant as crew chief. She is asking for the loan to buy a milk cow. Janysh is the youngest member of this group. He is just 26 years old and is married with one little daughter. His wife is a member of a farming collective. Janysh lives with his parents, but he hopes in near future to buy proper land and build his own house. At present time he takes an active role in family business: livestock raising and reselling. This loan will let them buy a few lambs. Gulayim, 27, is a married young lady. Her husband currently is an assistant to a driver but, starting in early spring, he usually works as a builder. Gulayim’s family has their own land where they cultivate potatoes. This loan will be used to buy one ton of seed potatoes and fertilizer. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 38-year-old father of two children who attend school.  He has been operating an electronic shop for seven years. He was previously operating a shop and a hotel. He also earns income from his motorbike, which he uses for transport.  He has been a member of Faulu Kenya and he wants to take his first loan from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to add more stock of electronics and spare parts.  He hopes to buy a piece of land and build his own home and buy a vehicle in the future.

loans.use: Add stock of electronics.

loans.name: Reinelda

texts.es: Reinelda es soltera y tiene un hijo de 17 años, ambos viven en el lugar donde Reinelda trabaja. Reinelda trabaja como cuidadora de una quinta en el mismo lugar realiza todo tipo de costuras bordados y otros, su amiga que es la codeudora del crédito es portera de un colegio y vende todo tipo de refrigerios y dulces en los recreos, ambas costuran y bordan en el mismo lugar. La competencia es media en su trabajo pero por la antigüedad que tienen y la experiencia ambas son bien cotizadas para sus costuras y bordados. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en la compra de telas  y otros para efectuar las costuras de uniformes y otros. Esta será su cuarta operación juntas con una buena puntualidad de pago.
texts.en:
Reinelda is single and has a 17-year old son. They live in the place where Reinelda works. She is the caretaker at a farm, and also does all kind of sewing and embroidery in this same place. She and her friend are taking out the loan together. Her friend is a caretaker at a school and sells refreshments and candy at recess. They both do sewing and embroidery. There is some competition in this field of work, but because they have been doing it for a long time and have lots of experience, they are sought after for their work. The loan will be used to buy material and other items for making uniforms etc. This will be their fourth venture together, and they have always been punctual with their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Akouto Christine

texts.en:
Akouto Christine G. sells fabrics and firewood for a living. She lives in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo, with her husband and child. 

Mrs. G. supplies her business from the Grand Marché in Lomé, Mali, and northern Togo. She is now facing a lack of stock and is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner WAGES to replenish her supply. She has been running this business for the last five years, and it is with great hope that she will have continued success for the five years to come.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and firewood

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna T., 59, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well for the sake of her child and so that her family can have a better life. She manages her own variety store while renting out some rooms, which enables her to further augment her meager income.

Myrna has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used to buy much needed stock to replenish her product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a good and comfortable living environment for her child.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy much needed stock to replenish her product inventory

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo L. is from the town of Poblacion, Damulog Bukidnon. He is 38 years old. Danilo is single. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for his business comes from selling cellphone accessories and music gadgets to the local community. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Danilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. 

Danilo is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Danilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of relatives and other family members. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Tayagba Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tayagba” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Neneh K. is the leader of this group. The 52-year-old is married to a teacher and they have six children. Neneh has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells sweets, sugar and butter.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sugar and butter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Samphas

texts.en: Mrs. Samphas L. is a villager in Lekh Pir village in Kandal province. She was born in 1987. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Tina Chan, is a security guard. Now, her problem is that she has not constructed her house yet. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Samphas L. is asking for a loan to continue building her new home. She is the mother of a child who is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To continue to build her new home.

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Emmily is a 42-year-old woman who sells fruit and vegetables to local residents, students and travelers in a high traffic area near the town center. The main challenge she faces is competition from other green grocers. She has been in this business for 18 years and has one employee. Emmily is married and has 10 children: six sons and four daughters. She describes herself as visionary, hardworking, and flexible.

Emmily plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to purchase fresh maize to sell to customers. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES. In the future, Emmily hopes to improve her living conditions by expanding her business and eventually owning a big restaurant in Kakamega.

loans.use: To purchase fresh maize

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Саъдулло проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует не большой земельный участок, где сажает дыню и арбуз. В этом ему помогают дети и жена. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Sadullo A., 55, lives in Shakhritus district. He is married and has 5 children. For more than six years, Mr. A. has been growing watermelons and honeydews on a small parcel of land he rents. Mr. A.'s wife and children help him farm the land. This loan Mr. A. will use to purchase mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bendiya 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENDIYA 6 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, en moyenne 2  enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le niébé, le riz, l’arachide et le pois sucré avec KONIBA K..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et recruter de la main d'œuvre  pour entretenir : 1, 7  hectare . 
La production est vendue à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes après la récolte ,au marché de LOULOUNI. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 92 750 FCFA par campagne.
Son  bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The six members of the BENDIYA 6 group are married women with an average age of 25. They each have an average of 2 children and most of them live in polygamous families in Mossibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their second loan with the institution, with the first being duly repaid. The crops they invest in are: niebe beans, rice, peanuts and pois sucre nuts. Koniba K. intends to use her loan to purchase the agricultural products, tools and labour required to cultivate 1.7 hectares. The produce is sold after the harvest to a mixed clientele of men and women at the Loulouni market. She hopes to generate an average profit of 92 750 FCFA each season. The profit will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frais de labour, semences, engrais, herbicides, sarclage et petits matériels agricoles.

loans.name: Tynymkan's Group

texts.en:
Tynymkan M. is the leader of her group. She is 64 and a widow. Tynymkan has been breeding livestock for 15 years, since 1995, and now she has seven sheep, a calf and two cows.  Tynymkan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase feed for the livestock for the winter season. 

Aigul J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 38 and married. She has three daughters and a son who are at school. Two years ago, Aigul’s husband signed a contract with a company to provide transportation services. Aigul hopes to obtain the loan, because after having sold their old truck they don’t have enough money to purchase a new one. 

Kuluya M., 63, is a widow.  Her son works as a taxi driver and Kuluya takes care of his children. With money received from the loan, Kuluya wants to purchase auto parts to repair her son’s vehicle.  In the future, she wants to save some money and invite all the relatives to celebrate her 65th birthday.

Ainagul B., 39, is married. She has three daughters and a son. The son and the first daughter are in school. The other children are preschool age (under 7).  Ainagul is engaged in livestock and her husband makes money by providing welder services. Ainagul started to breed livestock five years ago with an initial investment of 13,000 soms. And now she has 14 farm animals. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two sheep to increase the number of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag S. is 48 years old and lives in the Huvsgul province in western Mongolia. He lives with his wife and two children in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His daughter is currently attending a university in Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar, and his son helps his father with the family business. Ganhuyag's wife is employed at a local school as a teacher. Ganhuyag runs a wooden products manufacturing business in his town. He makes a variety of wooden products such as furniture. He started his business in 2001 and has had moderate success. He must design, produce and paint all of his products by hand because he can't afford the necessary tools and equipment. He has found it difficult to save his business earnings and has put all his money into paying his daughter's tuition fees. He says, "My son will soon be married, so I must support him so that he can live separately from his mother and I." Ganhuyag is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wood and tools to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more wood and tools

loans.name: Reina Mercedes

texts.es: Reina Mercedes tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ella dio inicio por medio de su hermana que le enseño este medio vida pues ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, pues ella ha realizado muchos sacrificios para salir adelante con este negocio, por lo que la mayoría de sus vecinos  y amigos asisten a comprar los diferentes platillos que ofrece. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, bebidas y verduras. Para el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y expandir su negocio
texts.en:
Reina Mercedes, age 31, sells food. She has had this business for over two years. She started through her sister, who taught her this way of earning a living. She has one child under her care. She has made many sacrifices to get ahead in this business. Most of her neighbors and friends come to buy the different dishes that she offers. She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, drinks, and vegetables. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;   ella tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente; y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de libros y paneles electrónicos;  Ella trabaja en el baratillo vendiendo libros de todas las materias, ella también hace pedidos de paneles electrónicos y según a las medidas y otros realiza los trabajos o los envía a elaborarse y para la venta final. La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar los libros y una ves que compre mas mercadería ella los llevara a ofrecer.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) Communal Bank.  The communal bank is located in the San Sebastián district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Juana, age 40, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  She has been selling books and electric panels for six years.  She also takes orders by measurements for electric panels.  Other people do the work, or she sends them out to be made in order to make the final sale.

She is requesting the loan to increase the number of books she has.  Once she has more merchandise, she will take it to sell.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through these means, and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase the number of books she has.  Once she has more merchandise, she will take it to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Rose is 33 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and only one of them goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp. Hanadi's husband, Ahmed, runs an electronics accessories store selling items such as batteries, electric machines cords, etc. Hanadi's husband needs to improve the store, adding shelves and showing windows as well as purchasing more goods to sell and increase his returns.

Hanadi is a housewife and helps her husband by working in the store. The store serves a good number of clients, and selling more goods will be helpful to improve it and have better income.

Hanadi's husband appears here in the picture as Hanadi is not comfortable having her picture online since she comes from a conservative background.

Important information about this loan:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit our FAQs.

loans.use: To purchase electronics to sell in the store

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 8. In 2002, Kadiatu established her assorted drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to help her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more stock of mega cola, coca cola and other drinks. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to educate her children to university level and to use part of her profit to support her husband and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her business

loans.name: Yunieth Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yunieth del Carmen B. L., es una joven de 27 años, madre soltera, habita en el Barrio de San Caralampio, ella es agricultora desde los 15 años la afectación de las plagas le han ocasionado muchos problemas a sus cosechas, fue gracias al apoyo de su papa que logro adquirir sus terrenos de siembras, a futuro espera sembrar nuevas cosechas que se consuman en masa y ayuden a su economía, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes  e insumos vegetativos  que brinden un optimo Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario y pueda construir su vivienda para el mejor desarrollo de su hijo pequeño, este sería su sexto préstamo y nos indica lo mucho que le ha sido de apoyo los otros préstamos y el cambio positivo que ha habido en las vidas de ella y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yunieth del Carmen B. L. is a young, 27 year old single mother living in the San Caralampio neighborhood.  She has been a farmer since she was 15 years old.  Her crops have been adversely affected by insect infestations.

Her father’s help made it possible for her to acquire the fields and in the future she hopes to plant crops that are consumed in mass and that will help her economy.  

For now she is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and farming supplies that will provide the optimum health and sanitation for the crops so that she will be able to build a house so that her young son can develop better.

This would be her 6th loan and she tells us how very helpful the previous loans have been and how much the lives of herself and her son have improved thanks to them.

loans.use: For crop care.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina C. is from Bagakay, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Marina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from these  services. Marina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Marina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Marina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Nora is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 25 years old, while the youngest is only 8. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nora also buys and sells bananas.

Nora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nora is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm supplies and more bananas to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon C. is from the village of Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Corazon is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling clothing, cosmetics and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like blouses and under wears. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like blouses and under wears

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary K. (in the photo) is 26 years old and her husband, Mr. Chea Moch, is 24 years old. They live along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007.  

Nary is a vegetable farmer and her husband is a blacksmith. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 50 años de edad y tiene seis hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. Cirila vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Cirila nos cuenta que desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron la elaboración de panes y el negocio de la venta de panes de “Chuta”.  Ahora Cirila es independiente y se dedica a la preparación de los panes, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio de panes tienen que alquilar los horno por horas para elaborar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Cirila requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 

Cirila pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cirila is 50 years old and has six children, all of whom are independent. She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Cirila says that when she was a young girl, her parents taught her how to bake and now she has a business selling “Chuta” bread. Today she is independent and spends her time making bread. Like most of the residents, Cirila operates her business by renting an oven by the hour so that she can make her products. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Cirila belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other supplies

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating a firewood selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells charcoal, which contributes to her income. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting charcoal in her business. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bundle of firewood for resale. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik M. lives with her family and 2 children in Tolors village of Syunik region. The family is engaged in cattle keeping and land cultivation. With her own, very hard earned money she has been able to purchase a piglet, which is expected to become a mother pig and bear piglets for future sale. The family also has 1 cow and 1 calf. 

Arevik owns some land, but does not have financial resources to cultivate it. She has applied for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. The produce and income from this year’s season will need to cover her family’s expenses for the next year.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.ar: محمود عمره 36 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في دهان السيارات له في العمل 23 سنة يعمل بجد ونشاط وله تاريخ جيد في عمله له زبائن من محيطه جيرانه يريد تأمين حياة أفضل له ولعائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة رأس مال المصلحة ودعم عمله لأن عمله من أولى اهتماماته يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يوصل اولاده الى مراكز جيدة في العلم والتطور من خلال دعم عمله له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من افراد عائلته
texts.en: Mahmoud is 36 years old and married with three children. He works in the refurbishment and repair of cars and has 23 years experience in this. He works hard and with enthusiasm and wants to secure a better life for himself and his family. His business has a good reputation and he has many local customers. With this loan he wants to increase his work capital and support his business as it is one of his priorities. He would like to increase his income and be able to send his children to good schools. He has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua and the full support of his family.

loans.use: to have access to working capital.

loans.name: Jacinta   Atieno

texts.en: Jacinta is 30 years old, married and has three children. For the last three years, she has made a living by selling a type of small fish caught locally that Kenyans call Omena. She earns about KES 6,000 a month. Jacinta learned about KADET LTD through one of our affiliated groups and is applying for her first loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income she earns from this loan to grow her business and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roquella

texts.en:
Roquella A. is from the village of West Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Roquella is married and has 5 grown children. Roquella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Roquella has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roquella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used towards working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Roquella is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages, junk foods & breads. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Roquella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages, junk foods & breads.

loans.name: Manfredy Ernesto

texts.es:
Manfredy, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo y un hijo de 9 años de edad, él se dedica desde pequeño a la agricultura, se creció ayudando a su padre en estas actividades, sembrando maíz y chile, también atiende las labores de la ganadería. 
Actualmente necesita comprar 1,500 plantas de chile, también tratamiento para plagas, esta compra le permitirá tener una nueva producción, con los cuidados necesarios.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para ganar ingresos que ayuden a su familia.
texts.en:
Manfredy lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department.  He’s a farmer.  He has his own house where he lives with his wife and a 9-year-old son.  He’s been farming since he was a little boy.  He grew up helping his father in these chores, planting corn and chilies, and also doing chores related to raising livestock.

He currently needs to buy 1500 chili plants as well as insecticide that will make new production possible, given proper care.  His goal is to work hard to earn income that will help his family.

loans.use: to buy 1500 chili plants and insecticide.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El sr. Samuel nacido en el departamento de Oruro, vive hace 30 años en la comunidad de Basilio a 20 kilómetros de el Torno, su actividad la elaboración de helados conocido en la zona, ya que entrega el producto a las escuelas ya que en época de calor tiene mucha venta, convive con la Sra. Anastasia ella se  dedica a la venta de comida son  personas responsables y  tienen 2 hijos estudiantes viven en casa propia, su deseo del Sr. Samuel es el de ver a su hijos profesionales y también poder tener mayor elaboración de sus productos, con el dinero del crédito comprara  un  frízer para helados está agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarle un apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Samuel was born in Oruro Department; he’s lived in the community of Basilio, 20 kilometers from El Torno, for 30 years.  He works making ice cream.  He is known in the area because he sells his product to schools because during the hot season sales are very high.  

He lives with Anastasia, who sells food.  They are responsible people and they have two children who are students.  They live in a house of their own.

Samuel’s wish is to see his children become professionals and to increase production.  He will use the money he’s requested to buy a freezer for the ice cream.  He is grateful to our entity for having trusted them and provided economic help.

loans.use: to increase capital and buy a freezer for the ice cream.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married with one 10-year-old son. He sells office supplies, birthday cards and souvenirs at the central market in Melitopol city. Victor started this business 16 years ago. His entrepreneurial skills helped him to develop it well. Victor has many repeat customers who keep his sales at a high level.

Victor is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase assorted inventory. Since this business is the only source of income for his family, Victor is hoping to increase his sales and make additional income to be spent on improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials such as sands, woods, cement etc.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is married with 3 children. She is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer, and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Mila has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has a 3-year-old child who is not yet in school.  

For the past 1.5 years, Vestine and her husband have been running a shop where they sell foodstuffs. This new business is doing well and the profits it has generated have provided for their family. This loan will allow them to expand their business as they will use it to purchase more goods such as sugar and rice to sell in their store. With profits from this business, Vestine will accumulate savings and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and rice to sell in her store

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 from NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Sulpicia has been in this business for five years. Sulpicia earns additional income from abaca weaving.

Sulpicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer from Irbid, Jordan is a 33-year-old woman.

Ghadeer is an embroidery expert and she works from home. 

Ghadeer is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business. She is looking to improve her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en: Samiya opened a clothing store in a central location of her town. After gaining experience and proving she could manage her business well and earn extra monthly income, Samiya was ready to expand her enterprise. She now sells gifts, trinkets and cosmetics in addition to children's and adults' clothing. Samiya needed this loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics stock for the holiday season and the beginning of the school year. Samiya is opening a savings account for her children and wants to ensure support for their education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics stock for the holiday season and the new school year.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu nació en la ciudad Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 36 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos.  

Actualmente, Marilu vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es fotografa y tiene un local donde revela sus fotografías, ella también se dedica a la producción de videos.

En esta oportunidad Marilú requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo papel fotografico.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Marilu was born in the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru).  She is 36 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.

Marilu currently lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business activities.  She is a photographer and has premises where she develops photographs.  She also makes videos.

On this occasion, Marilu needs a loan to buy work materials such as photographic paper.

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work such as photographic paper

loans.name: Elizabeth Atieno

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has a son. She describes herself as motivated, loving, and kind. She operates a retail shop where she sells general household goods, such as milk, bread, sugar, cooking oil, paraffin and soap. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located in the local market. 

Elizabeth describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital to purchase stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase stock such as bread, milk, paraffin, salad and detergent. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop to serve traders and shopkeepers within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock, including bread, milk, paraffin, salad and detergent.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is 25 and is married with one child. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years. 

Taleh loves his business and enjoys being involved in it. He buys livestock at the local city markets, brings it home and feeds it for a certain period of time. When the livestock gains weight, he sells it at a good price. Taleh wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions. He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) for the purchase of livestock. His brother actively helps him to run the business. His monthly income is $70 US. 

Taleh plans to use the profits from his business to renovate his house and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Samuel C's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 14,000,000.00 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay their loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and payment to SMT/Kiva lender on the teachers’ behalf.

Samuel is the leader of this group of teachers. The 40-year-old man is married and has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary school. A native of Magburaka town, Samuel has been in the teaching profession for 18 years now. He has requested this loan for two purposes: to buy house-building materials to complete his house-building project and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials to complete his house-building project and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Alodononzo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALODONONZO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alphonsine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Alphonsine est âgée de 60 ans et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Godens. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Alphonsine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Alphonsine assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Alphonsine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits alimentaires (maïs, pain) et de vêtements dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Alphonsine  exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Alphonsine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Alphonsine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Alphonsine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODONONZO , un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Alodononzo group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Alphonsine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé so that they can increase their business volume. Alphonsine is 60 years old and married to an accountant called Godens. The couple has three children, all educated, one of whom remains a dependent. Alphonsine lives with her husband and dependent child. She covers the various family expenses together with her husband. She did not attend school and now has an activity selling various groceries (corn, bread) as well as clothing, in her neighborhood; this allows her to provide for her family's needs, as well as her own, without any difficulty. Alphonsine has been carrying out this business for the past seven years. She gets her supplies in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand, she would like to increase her stock. In order to do this, Alphonsine is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Alodononzo group. The first three loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, bread and clothes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Alicia has a food shop (cafeteria), where she sells and serves snacks and coffee . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional snacks, beverages and coffee to re-sell to her customers.

Alicia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks, beverages and coffee

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children. Her husband is a fishpond owner and a farmer. Her family is living within the local community of San Miguel Ramon. 

Carmen has run her variety store for eight years. She said that a nursing course is too expensive, but through her patience, faith in God and profit in her business, she is able to support her son until he finishes the course. 

She is really proud and thankful because her eldest is already working as a project officer. She is aiming for improvement of her variety store so that she could also send her other two children into higher levels of education just like what she did for her eldest child. 

She has been facing struggles nowadays because of their high household expenses. She would like to increase the income she generates from her business so that she could obtain her dreams in life. 

For this reason, she is asking for additional capital amounting to P10,000, allowing her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, breads, cooking oil, ingredients and sugar to restock her variety store. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted, which will enable her dreams to be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as soft drinks, breads, cooking oil, ingredients and sugar to restock her variety store.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor  Julio Cesar, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Maira del municipio de Mizque, del  departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja en la agricultura, produce: cebolla, papa y tomate; y los comercializa en el mismo lugar.
Es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de sus hermanos menores.
Julio Cesar, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar semillas y agroquimicos, aumentar más superficies de cultivo y aumentar  su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y de sus hermanos.
texts.en: Julio is 38 years old and lives in the community of Maira, in the municipality of Mizque in Cochabamba.   Julio is a farmer. He grows onions, potatoes and tomatoes to sell in his local area.    Julio is well respected in his community for his dedication and work,  and for taking good care of his younger brothers.  He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow more types of produce and increase his production.  With the increased income he hopes to be able to improve the living conditions for himself and his brothers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Mwamimi

texts.en:
Mwamimi is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. 

He has been farming for nine years. He started as a subsistence farmer and later ventured into commercial farming and is very happy about this decision as he is reaping tangible benefits. His major hardships are inadequate capital and price fluctuations however he has a dream of expanding business into new markets. 

The purpose of this loan is to pay workers who are weeding his fields.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his fields.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Memuna.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 16,13 and 9 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lived with her because he is her husband’s nephew.  In 2007, Memuna established her timber business. She began her business because she wants to enhance her independence and that is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more timber for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Memuna plans to own a fleet of vehicles, to build her own a house and to educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy timber for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old married with one child who is 3 years old. His wife works as a businesswoman. 

Joseph has owned a boutique for six years. With the loan, he will add more items in his boutique such as rice, salt, cooking oil and lotions to sell. 

He plans to use the profits from the business to renovate the house and make savings. He would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt, cooking oil and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Olga Natividad

texts.es:
Olga Natividad tiene 41 años es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante  de la VRC TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Olga se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ciclo corto como es la siembra de maíz, además tiene una casa. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de calidad y grandes, abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos, Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar las semillas y otros productos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentar son las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Olga Natividad, 41, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) communal band located in Recinto San Luis de Zapotal belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Olga Natividad farms short cycle corn.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy quality seeds and large amounts of manure, fertilizer, urea and liquids.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy seeds and other products.

The challenges she faces are infestations, crop diseases and weather variations.  Her dream is to buy land and in her free time she enjoys going out on excursions.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and large amounts of manure, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Gloire De Dieu 2 Group

texts.fr: GLOIRE DE DIEU 2 est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Danielle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Danielle n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Danielle ne vit plus avec son mari. Danielle est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Danielle vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Danielle et son mari. Pour cette raison, Danielle vend des volailles et des œufs dans sa région depuis dix ans et des liqueurs de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Danielle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Danielle sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GLOIRE DE DIEU 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des liqueurs.

loans.name: Magheji Baghaya Hanji Group

texts.en:
Annet is a 34-year-old married woman living with her three children in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods in the markets and gets additional income from growing and selling cocoa. 

She is very hardworking, but is challenged by inadequate capital.  Annet hopes of building a permanent house and also of educating her children up to University.  

Annet has requested for a loan to continue increasing her inventory to meet the demand for her food items such as tomatoes, cabbage, rice, and ground nuts, especially if it is season time. 

She is a member of Magheji Baghaya Hanji  group where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods, beans, ground nuts, and rice for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a proud and traditional farming woman. Speaking with her, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful mum, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar along with her two children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now, so she makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. 

Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Susan is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in permanently changing the life of Susan and her family. Kindly help him out!
You can help Susan fulfill her dream and improve her business with a loan that could change her life during the Christmas holidays.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.en:
This group loan will be shared by five women who plan to start a seamstress shop / beauty parlor specializing in the elaborate braided hairstyles that West Africa is famous for. Funds will be used to furnish the facility and purchase an electric hairdryer and miscellaneous equipment. The group, represented by Fatou Kiné N., described their proposal as follows:

“Meckhé is located in the region of Thiès in the Tivaouane department. Established as a commune in 1911, it now has 20,000 inhabitants. With a large population of women, female unemployment remains an urgent problem. This state of affairs exposes girls to such evils as prostitution, premature pregnancies, and a degradation of our values. The purpose of the loan is to combat the loss of education threatening young women by: 1) moving into and equipping a facility that already exists, and 2) providing training [in hairdressing and sewing] to young women. Business activities will include hairdressing and sewing.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet. : Meckhé est situé dans la région de Thiès, département de Tivaouane. Errigé en commune depuis 1911, elle compte à nos jours plus de 20 000 habitants. Avec une forte population de femmes, le chômage des filles reste un problème majeure. Cet état de fait expose ces filles aux maux tels que la prostitution, les grossesses précoces, bref une dégradation des mœurs.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre les méfaits de la déperdition scolaire des jeunes filles.

• -Aménagement et équipement d’un local qui existe déjà

• -Dispensions de formation au profit des filles

Activités : Les activités que se propose le projet sont :

- Coiffure

- Couture »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Furnishing and purchasing equipment for a beauty parlor/seamstress shop

loans.name: Susanti

texts.en: Susanti is a 26 year old mother of two children. The eldest is 4 and the second is a baby of only 4 months. She has had a small store called “Warung” for a long time. She sells household goods like instant noodles, cigarettes, sugar and kerosene. She was funded by her husband’s money but now she requires additional working capital from MBK. She wants to have this loan to buy more goods since her husband, Saipudin, is only an unskilled worker who earns a weekly income of $15.

loans.use: Purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Maria Dilurina

texts.en:
Maria Dilurina is a 35-year-old single mother with five children who depend solely on her; her partner abandoned her and she has not heard from him. She lives in an area where coffee and chili peppers are grown. She buys these from merchants in the inland areas of her territory and then sells them wholesale to businesses in the city of San Cristobal (located two hours from her town). At this time she has no merchandise and would like to use the loan to invest in some. She belongs to the Pantelho 9 group.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DILURINA TIENE 35 AÑOS, MADRE SOLTERA CON CINCO HIJOS QUE DEPENDEN DE ELLA PORQUE SU PAREJA LA ABANDONO Y HASTA AHORA NO HA SABIDO NADA DE EL. LA ZONA EN DONDE ELLA VIVE SE CULTIVA EL CAFE Y EL CHILE (AJI), POR LO TANTO ELLA LO COMPRA A LAS PERSONAS DEL INTERIOR DE SU TERRITORIO Y POSTERIORMENTE LO VA A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL (QUE SE UBICA A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD) AL POR MAYOR A LOS LOCALES COMERCIALES DE LA ZONA. EN ESTE MIOMENTO NO TIENE MERCANCIA Y QUIERE INVERTIR EL CREDITO EN ESO. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE PANTELHO 9.

loans.use: Merchant

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Mr. Gustavo A. is 38 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. He lives with the mother of his children and owns a carpentry and furniture-making business.
