At his carpentry shop, he makes furniture, mostly mesa tablon (traditional tables), armchairs and other chairs that he sells in his shop; he also makes furniture to order for large customers like furniture stores in Paraguay and for export to other countries. He employs 12 full-time workers and his shop is open from 7:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. They have four large vans which are heavily used for customer deliveries and collections. He works in a neighborhood in which the majority of businesses sell traditional furniture but his shop is the largest in the area.

His business has been prospering in the last year now that he is talking with people in Germany who can export his products--tables, chairs and other furniture--to that country. In that way, he is managing to expand his markets abroad with a view to grow his business and get ahead on his own effort. In order to be able to meet demand, he is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of more wood for making furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Gustavo A. tiene 38 años, tiene 4 hijos todos están estudiando en la escuela secundaria. Vive en pareja con la madre de sus hijos y tiene un negocio de carpintería y mueblería.

En su carpintería se dedica a la manufacturación de muebles, mayormente mesa tablón, sillones y sillas las cuales vende en su local, otros los elabora bajo pedido para otros clientes mayoristas como otras mueblerías del país y también realiza para la exportación a otros países. El emplea a 12 personas a tiempo completo y el local trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. Tienen cuatro camionetas grandes que son utilizados frecuentemente como medios para facilitar la entrega y cobro a clientes. Trabaja en una zona en la que la mayoría de los negocios se dedican a la venta de muebles rústicos, pero su local es el más grande de la zona.

Su negocio ha ido prosperando en el último año ya que está contactando con gente en Alemania para poder exportar sus productos entre ellos mesas, sillas, y otros artículos de mueblería a dicho país. De esta forma está logrando expandir su mercado al exterior con miras a expandirse y progresar con su labor. Para poder cubrir su demanda el solicita el crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de más maderas para trabajarlas.

loans.use: Compra de madera y materia prima para completar stock.

loans.name: Silomaga

texts.en: Silomaga T. is a woman of forty-seven who is currently working hard at her plantation.  She’s happy for what she’s capable of doing.  Her husband lends her a hand to clean and sell their goods at the market.  Her business helps their family develop and also helps financially.  Silomaga T. earns an amount of one hundred tala a day.  She produces a variety of goods to sell to meet her customers' needs.  She will use her loan to buy equipment such as bush knives, cloves, seeds, etc. to help their business maintain its good condition.

loans.use: To purchase knives, cloves, and seeds

loans.name: Marta Angelo

texts.pt:
Marta is a single mother of 2. She lives alone with her children. Her husband abandoned her. Martha entered the program in 2005 as a member of a group. Meanwhile the group has disbanded and she has decided to take out a loan on her own. She has many customers. If the business continues to do well, she plans to build a better house. Marta’s children are still too young to attend school. She plans to register them as soon as they are old enough.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta e solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela vive sozinha com os filhos. O marido abandonou-a. Marta entrou para o programa em 2005 como membro de um grupo. Todavia o grupo desfez-se e ela resolveu tomar dinheiro emprestado individualmente.Ela tem muitos clientes. Se o negocio continuar a correr-lhe bem ela pensa construir uma casa melhorada. Os filhos de Marta ainda nao vao a escola porque nao tem idade. Mas logo que estiverem com idade ela os ira matricular.

loans.use: Marta would like to use the money to buy more fish for the business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is a mother of an advanced age, who has given her best years to the cultivation of her land. Thanks to her tireless labor, her children are now receiving advanced studies in the teachers' institute in their city, something that gives her great pride. In spite of that, she knows that to fulfill her role as a mother, she still has an important thing to do. She would like to continue working her land, while acquiring the necessary capital to open a small store in her community. This is something important not only for her, but for them population in the community as well. She hopes to open the store, and to increase her income to invest in the education of her children. You can help Felicia fulfill her role as a mother and one who provides education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Felicia, es una madre de avanzada edad, que ha dedicado a sus terrenos de cultivo sus mejores años; gracias a su incansable labor, hoy sus jóvenes hijos cursan estudios superiores en un instituto pedagógico de su ciudad, motivo que la llena de orgullo y satisfacción, a pesar de saber que para culminar su tarea como madre aún le falta un importante trecho; desea continuar trabajando sus terrenos de cultivo y adquirir el capital necesario para aperturar una pequeña bodega en su comunidad, la cual es muy necesaria tanto para ella como para los pobladores de su comunidad.Ella guarda la esperanza de poder abrir aquella tienda e incrementar sus ingresos para invertirlos en la educación de sus hijos. Contribuya a que Felicia pueda cumplir con su papel de madre y educadora de sus hijos

loans.use:
Purchase of larger quantities of seeds, manure, and fertilizer to open her small store soon. 

Compra de mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para pronto aperturar su pequeña tienda.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị Nhàn is 31 years old. She grew up in a farmer family. She married Mr Nam who is a mechanic. They are happy despite the fact that life is hard, they have no capital. In 1997, Ms Nhàn joined TYM fund and took out a loan of 30 USD to open a clothing store. She is a skillful businesswoman and has a nice personality. The business is profitable. Her store is located on route #2, she has 2 employees working with her, each earns 50 USD a month. She specializes in making linens, her main customers are Hotels & Inns. Her family income is 200 USD a month. This time she's requesting a loan 0f 1200 USD to buy fabrics and tools, getting ready for the upcoming season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Nhàn, 31 tuổi, sinh trưởng trong một gia đình thuần nông không có nghề phụ. Đến tuổi xây dựng gia đình, chị kết hôn với anh Nam công nhân cơ khí Z125. Cuộc sống của 2 vợ chồng trẻ thiếu thốn, vất vả nhưng thật hạnh phúc. Năm 1997, chị Nhàn tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay mức vốn 30USD để mở cửa hàng may mặc. Nhờ bàn tay khéo léo và duyên bán hàng, công việc làm ăn khá thuận lợi, hiện chị đang thuê cửa hàng trên mặt đường quốc lộ 2, thuê 2 công nhân với mức lương 50USD/tháng. Hoạt động kinh doanh chính của chị Nhàn là chuyên may mành rèm ga gối, phục vụ các nhà nghỉ, khách sạn và các hộ gia đình có nhu cầu. Thu nhập của gia đình bình quân 200USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Nhàn có nhu cầu vay 1200 USD để mua vải và khung nhôm, tăng cường phục vụ cho mùa cưới này.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Auxiliadora Benítez García is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 49 years old and is a single mother of 4 children, all of whom are adults now. For 34 years, she has worked as a seamstress with clients in her neighborhood- employees of offices and universities that prefer her services because of the quality of her work. At the moment, she only has 1 sewing machine and her business is not doing well for this reason. She wants to buy 1 more machine that costs 200 dollars, 10 packages of needles that cost 2 dollars per packet, 9 dozen zippers that cost 1 dollar each and 7 unites of thread that costs 3 dollars per unit.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La Sra. Auxiliadora Benítez García es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera de 4 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. Benítez desde hace 34 años trabaja como costurera teniendo como clientes los habitantes de su barrio, empleados de oficinas y universidades que la prefieren por brindar un servicio de calidad en estos momentos solo tiene una maquina que no esta en buen estado por esta razón quiere comprar 1 maquina que le cuesta $ 200.00 dólares, 10 paquetes de agujas a $ 2.00 dólares cada paquete, 9 docenas de zippers a $ 1.00 dólar la docena de zippers y 7 unidades de hilo a $ 3. 00 dólares cada unidad.

loans.use: To buy 2 sewing machines, 10 packages of needles, 9 dozen zippers and 7 units of thread.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Maribel is 27 years old and has three children, who are her reason for living. She is the owner of a motorcycle taxi and her husband is in charge of driving it. Both have proposed to offer security and wellbeing to their beloved children and for this reason are always ready to materialize an opportunity. From one time until now, the vehicle that has granted them self sufficiency is suffering from malfunctions that have effected their income greatly. This is why they are asking for a loan, so they can rent the equipment to fix the motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maribel de 27 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos los mismos que son la razón de su vida, ella es propietaria de un mototaxi y su esposo se encarga de conducirlo; ambos se han propuesto brindarle seguridad y bienestar a sus queridos hijos y por esa razón siempre están prestos a realizar sus actividades.De un tiempo a este, el vehículo que les otorga el sustento diario viene sufriendo desperfectos que han mermado considerablemente sus ganancias, por esta razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir las herramientas para mejorar las condiciones de su mototaxi.

loans.use: Buy parts for repair of a Motorcycle (Mototaxi)

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna S. is a fish seller in Thom Village. She is 43 years old and has four children, two of whom are attending a local school, while the others are already working. Her husband, Ros Chhum, is a fisherman. Mrs. Vanna S. usually helps her husband in fishing and then sells the fish in the village. Additionally, she grows crops on a field. Mrs. S. currently needs a loan to buy more vegetable seeds to cultivate on the field.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetable seeds

loans.name: Mapato Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Alex O. is a young Kenyan father, aged 30 with 6 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Alex started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small posho mill (maize grinder) in the neighborhood. He also stocks maize, which he sells to his customers who want to buy and grind it.

With the little profit that he gets from the business, Alex still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his rent. With the help of his loan, Alex will be able to expand his business by purchasing maize in bulk and to increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk, for his posho mill (maize grinder)

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila is a sweet and charming 53 year old street vendor who has been selling snacks from a small cart that she acquired to transport her products. She began with little merchandise but great enthusiasm of expanding her business and growing her income. Now she sees the importance of strategic location of her business and the necessity of acquiring a greater quantity of merchandise to stock in order to meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teófila, es una dulce y encantadora dama de 53 años de edad, desde hace algunos años viene dedicándose a la venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria en una pequeña carretita que adecuó para el traslado de sus productos, inicio su labor con poca mercadería pero con gran entusiasmo de ampliarlo y mejorar sus ingresos, ahora observando el lugar estratégico de la ubicación de su negocio se ve en la necesidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtirla y así cumplir con cada una de las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Acquire snack products to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., aged 46, is a member of TYM Fund. Since joining TYM, she has been using the loans to invest into her small business in the market. As she and her family live close to the market, it is very convenient for them to run the business there. Her customers are usually those who have been doing the business with her for a long time. In recent years, Mrs. L. has used the loans to purchase more goods for her store, which help appeal to more customers. Her family’s income has been more stable ever since. Her husband is a taxi-driver with an income of 3.000.000 VND per month. Mrs. L. has two children, both of whom are still in school. In the next round of loan, Mrs. L. wishes to borrow 15.000.000 VND ($900) to continue investing into her business. Her family’s monthly income is 5.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thi Lương 46 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán nhỏ tại chợ, thuận lợi cho gia đình chị sống gần chợ nên việc buôn bán của chị đã có nhiều năm, số khách đến mua hàng của chị chủ yếu là khách quen, từ việc buôn bán nhỏ ban đầu, khi có vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư mở rộng thêm nhiều mặt hàng đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, chồng chị làm nghề lái xe tắc xi nên thu nhập hàng tháng ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào buôn bán.

Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Aziza's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Aziza is married with a four year old child. She sells tomatoes and onions. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Aziza now hopes for a loan to buy more tomatoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Martha who sells fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish and tomatoes for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Blanca Del Socorro

texts.es:
Blanca, 45, lives in the Villa Fraternidad neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children, 2 and 4. Her husband works as a bookkepper. Blanca has sold clothing and cosmetics for nine years. She started the business with her savings and help from her husband. She has managed to push forward and hold on to her business even when her customers have failed to pay and left her holding the bag. Nonethess, her products sell because they're attractive and accessible. The loan will be used to buy construction materials to improve the porch on the family house, something that will make the house more comfortable and beautiful. Blanca's short-term hopes are to be able to build a shop for her business and improve the service that she provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Blanca habita en el barrio Villa Fraternidad, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y con dos niños de 2 y 4 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como contador, la Sra. Blanca vende prendas y cosméticos tiene nueve años en las ventas, inició con capital propio con la ayuda de su esposo, ha logrado salir adelante y ha mantenido su pequeño negocio por que algunas veces los clientes le quedan mal y no le pagana. Pero es un producto que se vende ya que son buenos y accesibles. El préstamo será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar el porche de su vivienda y así ir invirtiendo en su vivienda para tener una casa más cómoda y bonita. Sus planes a corto plazo son poder construir un local para ahí tener su negocio y poder mejorar el servicio que ofrece

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve the porch on the family house.

loans.name: Fiatamalii

texts.en: Fiatamalii L., 53, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the taro, taamu, banana and yam farming businesses. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD). SPBD loans are Fiatamalii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband also does the plantation.

loans.use: To upgrade the business and help repair the house, and for kids' school fees

loans.name: Mrs. Som Yaem Group Loan

texts.en:
Four members in Tumnob Leu village in Kampong Cham province form this loan group. Mrs. Som Y. is a group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Mel Mil, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar or wine. However, he can no longer do this business because he does not have enough equipment, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy palm juice equipment in order to restart her husband's business. Mrs. Som Y. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school.

The husband of one other group member, Mrs. Yem S. A., is standing in for her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy palm juice equipment to restart a business

loans.name: Rann Pom's Group

texts.en:
This a group loan for four borrowers. Mrs. Rann P. is 62 years old who makes a living selling used clothing in the local market and has two children, both of whom are students. She is married to Mr. Choeun Noun, 70, who helps his wife in her business. Rann needs to expand her business so she seeks a loan of $250 to buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

The other three members are:

Mrs. Srors N., 30, is selling fishes for income and she requests $250 to purchase fish for sale. Mrs. Leak S., 38, is a fish seller who seeks a loan of $250 to buy fish for sale. Mrs. Ra R. is 38 years old and makes a living selling fruits in the market. She is applying for $200 to purchase deferent kinds of fruit for sale.

The borrowers live in Slorkram Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon L. lives in Preak Ta Oung Ti Pie village in Kandal province. She is a housewife who takes care of her children in the house. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Chantha, is a farmer. He earns little rice revenue, which means he cannot provide a good life for his household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samon L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse with a cart to transport soil to sell.

Mrs. Samon L. is 46 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, while another is employed in a garment factory. Two children are laborers, while another one is enrolled in the local school. The remaining child is too young to work or study because that child is two years old. Her husband is also present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a horse with a cart to transport soil to sell.

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Vida Luz R. M. tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones el mayor tiene 13 años y cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo menor tiene 1 año de edad y no estudia, ha pasado por momentos muy duros y en medio de estos su propósito es ampliar su negocio para ayudar a sus hijos, mantener el hogar y prepararlos para la vida proveyéndoles estudio, vivienda y alimentación el deseo de Doña Vida es ganar mas dinero a través de este negocio con el objetivo de ampliar sus horizontes sus sueños es establecer un restaurante dividido en secciones donde hayan video juegos, una pista de baile y pueda ofrecer su deliciosa comida a sus clientes entre otras cosas, también le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa, bolsos, perfumes, joyas y zapatos pues todos estos han sido sueños que desde joven no ha podido realizar debido a su pobreza.

Actualmente Doña Vida Luz se dedica al negocio de video juegos, es decir que jóvenes, niños y algunos adultos llegan a jugar nintendo a su casa y por este servicio ellos le pagan. Su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, ubicado en el Reparto Modesto Palma, detrás del Instituto Nacional Autónomo Víctor Manuel Soto en la primera calle. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 1 año, además Doña Vida trabaja en la elaboración de sopas y venta de comidas sólidas los fines de semana como: Sopas de res con punche, sopa de queso, sopa de mariscos, gallo pinto, carne a la plancha, carne asada, bistec encebollado y muchas otras comidas que son muy típicas aquí en Nicaragua. Este trabajo le permite estar al tanto de su hogar y poder tomar el control sobre sus niños. Es por esto que Doña Vida ha solicitado un financiamiento que le permita invertir y aumentar su capital de trabajo, de esta manera la señora podrá seguir en este negocio y sobrevivir junto a su familia, quienes siempre se esfuerzan por llevar una mejor vida económica.
texts.en:
Vida Luz R. M. is 31 years old, single, and has two sons: her older son is 13 and in his second year of high school and her younger son is 1 and does not go to school. She has gone through some hard times and in the midst of these has decided to expand her business to help her children, to maintain her house and to prepare her sons for life by giving them an education, a home, and food. Vida's wants to make more money with her business so she can expand her horizons. She dreams of starting a restaurant, divided in sections where there would be video games, a dance floor and she would serve delicious food to her customers. She would also like to open a clothing store, selling purses, jewelry and shoes. She has held onto these dreams since she was young but because of her poverty she has not been able to make her dreams a reality. Vida Luz's current business is video games: young people, children and some adults come to her home to play Nintendo, which they pay her for. Her business is in her home, in the Modesto Palma division. She has had this business for one year. Vida also prepares soups and sells food on weekends, such as beef soup with crabs, cheese soup, seafood soup, rice with beans (gallo pinto), fried beef with mixed peppers (carne a la plancha), roast beef, steak with onions and many other typical Nicaraguan foods. This business allows her to be at home to supervise her children. This is why Vida has asked for a loan to invest and increase her working capital so that she can continue with her business and survive with her family who are always making efforts to improve their financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda C. is a 35-year-old mother and seaweed farmer. She cultures “Gusu” a type of seaweed that is very popular in the province. Factories that make slippers, plastics, medicines, and other cosmetic products use this type of seaweed. Hilda's husband, Ricardo C., is also a seaweed farmer. Seaweed is the main source of their livelihood. They plant and harvest the seaweed and earn enough for their daily living expenses. Together, they work hard for the future of their children.

Hilda is asking for a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase more seaweed for their farm, which she believes will produce a bigger harvest and generate more income for the family.

CEVI helps Hilda grow her business. By providing credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, CEVI helps more and more clients sustain their business.

loans.use: Purchase seaweed seedlings for farming

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is thirty-nine years old and married with three children. She sells clothes and gift items. She would like a loan to purchase a wider variety of clothes and gift items to sell. Shola thanks Kiva in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and gift items to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa G. is 33 years old and married with three children, a boy and two girls. Two of her children are in primary school and the other is still too young to attend school. Her husband is a commercial driver and Yaa works to help supplement the family's income. They live in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Yaa sells smoked fish, which she buys from Yeji in the northern part of the country. She sells in the local market square and in nearby areas. Yaa has been in business for 2 years and would like a loan to buy more goods for resale. Yaa's hope is to give her children all the financial support they need to succeed academically.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and other goods for resale in the market.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: Tawa M. is 42 years old and married with 7 children. She has a grinding machine that she uses to grind foodstuffs like corn, beans, pepper etc. She needs a loan  of 100,000 NGN (700 USD) to purchase another grinding machine to enable her meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” says Nilda, a simple store owner in her village. According to Nilda, her business will pave the way to a progressive life if she can manage it well. To improve her business, she wants to request a loan of PHP 17,000.00 that will serve as her business capital.

She is 46 years old and married to Isidoro, a farmer in their village. According to Nilda, their sacrifices are for the future of their three children: Naydarie, 22 years old and a college graduate; Nolie, 21 years old and a criminology student; and Naiza, 11 years old and presently in grade school. She believes that the improvement of her business depends on hard work and perseverance. She dreams of having a comfortable house and also having a permanent stall in their public market.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both sons. According to her, one is in the senior high school while the other is in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Veronica is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital and sells in the local market on a tabletop. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Muhamadrasul

texts.ru: Мухамадрасулу 50 лет. У него есть жена и 3-е детей. Два сына и одна дочь. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Единственная дочь помогает по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Мухамадрасул пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он недавно кредитуется в нашей организации, и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en:
Muhamadrasul is fifty years old. He has a wife and three children, two sons and one daughter. His older sons have left for Russia to work. While working there, they send money to their parents. The parents then save the money for their sons' marriage. Their only daughter helps at home. His wife works spinning yarn. She goes and sells it at the market. Muhamadrasul grazes cattle in the mountains and comes home very late. He has recently taken out loans through our organization, and is a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (1220060274) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has three school-aged children.

B. owns and operates a business running a food stall, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,200,000 VND a month.

In 2006, B. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

B. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with one child. She sells agriculture produce at two markets in Nikopol city and at several food markets in the greater area.
Katerina has been in this business for 5 years. She grew up in a village and is used to growing and selling vegetables and other produce. She offers good quality at reasonable prices and thus has many loyal customers. A few months ago she purchased a car to help her in sales. Katerina would like to borrow $1900 to increase the assortment. She enjoys being in this business for it enables her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Amsatou

texts.fr: D. est une jeune femme  très motivée qui s’est lancée en 2004 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, très tôt elle a maîtrisé tout les contours de ce commerce et a pu gagner la confiance de beaucoup de clients. Sa clientèle croît, elle veut aussi agrandir son stock pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement, elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 3 cartons de tomates concentrées, 3 cartons de savons, 2 bidons d’huile, 7 pagnes  et 2 sacs d’haricots.
texts.en:
D. is a very motivated woman who, in 2004, started selling food staples. Early on, she got to know the ins and outs of this business, and managed to earn the trust of many customers. Her clientele is growing, and she thus wants to increase her stock to adequately meet demand. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 3 boxes of tomato concentrate, 3 boxes of soaps, 2 cans of oil, 7 pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 2 sacks of beans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 3 boxes of tomato concentrate, 3 boxes of soaps, 2 cans of oil, 7 pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 2 sacks of beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Frenk Ernesto

texts.pt:
( nao foi possivel a foto no local do negocio devido a natureza do trabalho do frenk)
Frenk Ernesto D. nasceu no município da vila de namaacha na fronteira da suazilandia, está divorciado da sua mulher e é pai de quatro filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 2 aos 10 anos. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe uma sexta básica de 500.00MT mensalmente e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT.

Frenk emigra para África do Sul quando tinha 21 anos de idade à procura de emprego após a morte do seu pai. Começa a trabalhar como mecânico durante 7 anos e faz a 5ª classe, interrompe quando teve que regressar a Moçambique para cuidar da sua mãe. Anos depois começa a trabalhar como segurança, mas devido ao baixo salário abandona o emprego e trabalha como camioneiro (transporte de carros da áfrica do sul a suazilândia) ganhando mensalmente 2.000.00MT e tem feito quatro viagens ao mês. Faz venda de roupa diversa, por encomenda, aproveitando a facilidade de transporte, tendo mensalmente um lucro de 4.000.00MT.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Frenk na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. Os primeiros dois créditos de 5.000.00MT todos foram usados para iniciar o negócio de venda de roupas. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma capoeira com objectivo de iniciar outra actividade alternativa (avicultura).
texts.en:
(It wasn’t possible to take a photo of the business because of the nature of Frenk’s work) Frenk Ernesto D. was born in the municipality of Villa de Namaacha in the frontier with Suazilandia, he is divorced and has 4 children who are between 2 and 10 years old. He is also responsible for his mother and sends her a monthly allowance of 500MT and is able to save 1,000MT. Frenk went to South Africa when he was 21 years old and obtained a job after the death of his father. He worked for 7 years as a mechanic and finished 5th grade, which he had to interrupt when he came back to Mozambique to take care of his mother. Years later he started working as a security officer, but because of the low salary he left the job and currently works as a truck driver (he transports vehicles from South Africa to Suazilandia) he earns 2,000MT monthly and travels 4 times a month. He sells diverse clothing under request, taking advantage of the travels, obtaining 4,000MT monthly. This is Frenk’s third loan with Hluvuku and first one with Kiva. The first ones were for 5,000MT and were used to start his business selling clothes. He is confident he will pay before the due date and request a new loan to build a small farm to start another activity option (agriculture).

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 24-year-old married man with two children, one of whom is in school. He works very hard and saves for the future. He enjoys selling and is motivated to work hard because he dreams of a better future for his children.

Patrick owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed milk powder, etc. However, he is constrained in making meaningful progress by low capital. He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to make increased profits. Patrick believes that, with his good customer relations, the loan will enable him to realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Bellavista, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de cereales.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá aumentar su capital comprando lanas de diferentes colores y bayeta, para la elaboración de artesanías en bordados, y cereales como quinua, trigo, cebada, etc. Para comercializarlos en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los eventos donde participan todas las mujeres.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 30, married, and has two children. She lives in the Bellavista neighborhood. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost four years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of selling grains. She currently needs a new loan for 300 PEN, which will allow her to buy different colors of wool and cloth to make embroidered handicrafts. She will also buy grains like quinoa, wheat, and barley, etc. She will sell them at the weekly fairs. Her biggest desire is to keep working to educate her children. She likes the meetings and the events in which all of the women participate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of wool and cloth; also buy various grains

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo M. is from the village of Danao. He is 54 years old. Rodulfo is married. To make a living, Rodulfo owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rodulfo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rodulfo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodulfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

Rodulfo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rodulfo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ana Yolanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Paz se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ésta es una ciudad muy rica por su cultura y tradiciones como los días de los santos inocentes, el pase del niño viajero, entre otras, costumbres que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Sus integrantes  son un grupo de personas que se unieron para buscar mejoras sociales y económicas logrando consolidar una gran amistad, respeto  y ayuda mutua para salir adelante con sus familias.

La señora Ana O. es una de las socias más  alegres del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la urbe de la ciudad en  el sector Quinta Chica, ella tiene 46 años de edad  es madre soltera de tres  hijos de 25, 24, 19 años, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente con los gastos de  la casa, su segunda hija es casada y su último hijo estudia  en la Universidad del Azuay,  la educación les da su papá que reconoció solo al primero y tercer hijo. La casa en la que habitan es propia gracias al esfuerzo de su juventud.

Ana trabaja recorriendo el mercado de la Feria Libre en  la ciudad de Cuenca, vende  frutas, verduras,  pescados, etc.  según la temporada, esta actividad la viene realizando desde  hace siete años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero hay que salir adelante, también teje chompas las cuales les vende a sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad.

Ana  formó parte del banco comunal durante dos años y se retiró, luego regresó y este es su tercer ciclo  trabajando nuevamente con su banco y asegura que los créditos obtenidos han invertido en su negocio y el nuevo préstamo que la institución le entregue va a comprar frutas y verduras variadas para a bastecer mejor su negocio y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank, La Paz, is in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is a city rich in culture and traditions, such as The Holy Saints and the celebration of Christ’s birth (a large Christmas pageant in Ecuador) among others. These are celebrations that attract national and international tourism. Her companions are a group of people who are trying to improve their social and economic situations and have formed a strong friendship with respect and mutual aid which helps their families get ahead.. Mrs. Ana O. is one of the most cheerful members of the communal bank La Paz. She lives in Quinta Chica, an area of the city. She is 46, the single mother of 3: 25, 24 and 19. Her oldest son works and helps her with the household expenses. The second is a married daughter, and her last is a son, a student at the University of Azuay. Their father only educated the oldest and youngest. The house that they live in belongs to her, thanks to her hard work. Ana goes around the Central Market of Cuenca selling fruit, vegetables, fish, etc. depending on the season. She has been doing this for the past seven years and she says that she has good days and bad days, but you have to keep going to get ahead. She also knits sweaters which she sells to her friends and neighbors in the area. Ana was a member of the communal bank for two years, then she left. She then returned and this is her third cycle working again with the bank. She assures us that the profits that she has earned she has invested in her business. With the new loan that the institution has offered her, she will buy different fruit and vegetables to better supply her business and to attract more customers

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted fruit and vegetables to better supply her business

loans.name: Utkirjon

texts.en:
B. Utkirjon always feels an immense satisfaction when people enjoy his delicious fruits and vegetables, since he puts an enormous amount of effort in each of his plantations. He possesses beautiful land which he cultivates for fruits and vegetables with his family, who are the reason for all the work he does. He is proud of his farm because it has allowed him to feed and educate his children. Utkirjon is aware of the needs of his family and for this reason he wants to open a grocery store in his house to cover part of the family’s daily expenses. In order to achieve this goal, he will use his loan to increase production of wheat and potatoes in season and to improve the crop quality.

Let's support Utkirjon’s intention to progress.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Daissy Ivonne

texts.es:
La Señora Daissy Ivonne M. A., ella tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, es el primer créditos que Trabajado con CEPRODEL, este lo ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, zinc, cemento,piedras,etc. para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación en la  vivienda en la que habita, esto es para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Daissy Ivonne Martinez A. is married and has three children, two that are in school. This is the first loan that she has taken with CEPRODEL. She has invested what CEPRODEL has lent her in improving the condition of her home. The loan that she asked for is to buy construction materials such as: iron, zinc, cement, stones, etc to build a bedroom in the family’s house. This will improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena F. de 46 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Masahuat, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y también vive junto a sus dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, así mismo posee una pupusería la cual esta ubicada a las afueras de su casa. Cada día maría Elena abre su tienda y saca la cocina frente a su hogar para disponerse a hacer pupusas, las cuales las vende cada tarde y que vende mucho ya que ella es reconocida por ser una persona muy responsable la cual se esfuerza por hacer un excelente trabajo, ya que su mayor deseo es poder brindar ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos. María junto a su esposo sueñan con poder brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos pagando los estudios de ellos. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través de cual pueda surtir la tienda y comprar materia prima para hacer más pupusas.
texts.en:
María Elena F. is 46 years old and lives in San Pedro Masahuat, in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who is a businessman, and her two children, who are students. She owns a store from which she sells basic household items. She also owns a "pupuseria" (a stall from which she sells "pupusas" - tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, pork, etc.) which is located right outside her home. Every day, María Elena opens her store, takes the grill out on the street, and gets ready to make "pupusas" which she sells every afternoon. She sells lots of them because she is well recognized as being a responsible and hardworking person and for doing an excellent job. Her biggest dream is to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and their children's studies. María and her husband dream of giving their kids a bright future by paying for their education. This is why she is requesting this loan - so that she can re-stock her store and buy ingredients to make more "pupusas."

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make food; restocking her store

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Jairo Uriel

texts.es:
El señor Jairo C. se dedica a la venta de granos de trigo en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur habiéndose dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 25 años pero actualmente no cuenta con dichos granos de trigo porque requiere hacer una inversión en esta actividad por medio de la recolecta de la cosecha del trigo.
Es importante destacar que él es casado y con cuatro hijos a los que debe de mantener y llevar el sustento a su hogar para que estos se desarrollen y puedan continuar estudiando ya que todos están en edades escolares. Con el crédito logrará mejorar las condiciones del almacenamiento del grano del trigo y así esperar para venderlo por lo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así llevar a cabo dicha actividad.
texts.en:
Jairo C. sells wheat grains around the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. He's being doing this job for 25 years, but right now he doesn’t have any grains because he wants to make an investment in this activity through the wheat harvesting process. It is important to mention that he’s married and has four children that he has to support and also cover household expenses, so they can continue to study good living conditions. With this loan, he will be able to make improvements in his wheat grain storage facility, so he can wait to sell his products. He hopes to do that with his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in wheat harvesting

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a business man. He is 40 years old and married with three children. He deals in auto spare parts and is located in Luwero town. He has been in his business for over ten years. Because he doesn't have much capital, he will use the loan to purchase and stock more auto spare parts for sale. He wishes to open up more branches of his business if all goes on well.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more auto spare parts for sale

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She loves her children so much that she works at sales for long hours to meet their basic needs. She sells drinks and pepper soup in her restaurant. Her customers patronize her pub more in the evenings when they have left work.

Toyin loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to sell her drinks at wholesale prices in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and soup ingredients to make more pepper soup to sell. She is grateful in anticipation to Kiva lenders and promises to use her money positively.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and soup ingredients

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor B. es soltero es  y  se dedica a la profesión de mecánico además es propietario de un taller mecánico  que el mismo instaló en su casa.
El cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en la  profesión y cuenta con una clientela que confiá en sus servicios ya que es una persona que demuestra siempre responsabilidad en todo momento.
Este crédito fue para compra de una camioneta que utilizará  para su  traslado hasta donde sus clientes precisen. Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada por la Fundación.
texts.en:
Mr. B. is single. He is a mechanic, and he has his own mechanic’s shop. He set up the mechanic’s shop at his house. He has been in the profession for ten years. He has customers who trust in his services because he is a person who always demonstrates responsibility. This loan was to buy a van, which he will use to drive where his customers need him. He is very grateful for the help given by the Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Jaqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jaqueline tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijos menores de 10 y 8 años, viven en casa familiar hace mas de 40 años atrás. Hace más de 7 años que Jaqueline tiene su punto de llamadas y vende cosméticos de diferentes marcas y  hace 4 años que tiene el vehículo del que percibe renta diaria. En el sector del servicio de llamadas existe bastante competencia pero el negocio de Jaqueline está bien ubicado en el mercado central en una calle que tiene bastante afluencia de gente, lo que también le favorece en la venta de sus cosméticos, en cuanto al trasporte de taxi es un medio bastante competitivo pero de gran demanda también por ser el medio de transporte mas rápido.
El destino del crédito fue para la compra de mercadería en cosméticos y accesorios propios de las fiestas de carnaval que la señora necesitaba surtirse. Jaqueline tiene crédito con nosotros y en otra entidad financiera, en ambas instituciones cumple con sus pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 43 years old and single. She has two young children who are 10 and 8 years old. She has lived in her family's house for more than 40 years. For the past seven years, Jacqueline has worked running her own telephone center and selling cosmetics of various brands. For four years, she has driven a taxi so she can receive a daily income. There is a lot of competition in the telephone sector business, but Jaqueline's business is well-located in a central market on a street that has a large influx of people. This location also benefits her cosmetics sales. As for her taxi, it is a very competitive business, but she remains in high demand for being a more rapid means of transportation. The loan was used to buy more merchandise in the form of cosmetics and accessories for carnaval parties, which Jaqueline needed to provide for herself. She has a loan with us and another financial institution. For both organizations, she has made her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics and accessories merchandise

loans.name: Azees

texts.en:
K. sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers who are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

K. is 35 years old and is married with three children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home.

K. loves her business because of the profit she makes. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more slippers and clothes to sell

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim N. lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province and was born in 1968. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to grow rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Yan Yun, is a fisherman and as a side business owns a thrashing machine to earn some extra money to support the family. 

They have a problem because her husband’s thrashing machine is too old to use. Thus, Mrs. Nim N. decided to seek a loan to buy a new thrashing machine. 

She is the mother of three children all of whom are attending the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new thrashing machine

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos en su haber. Reside en la Comunidad de Palestina Alta, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia. Para Cirilo en esta vida nada es imposible, a pesar de que estuvo económicamente mal, sacó a relucir su fuerza para salir adelante. Él siempre estuvo metido en su trabajo, según manifiesta “siempre hay algo que hacer” y eso lo convierte en una persona perseverante y digna de imitar. Aparte de tener su cultivo de cacao y café, también trabaja para otras personas como obrero de chacra, realizándolo cuando está desocupado de su trabajo, de esa manera logra tener un ingreso adicional para su familia. Generalmente labora de manera independiente desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Normalmente su producción los vende en su misma comunidad a precio de mercado, lo cual mejora su economía. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar la siembra de cacao y café, para ello necesita proveerse de plantaciones, eso ayudará aumentar su producción y sus ganancias, con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente conforme con su grupo comunal, por el buen camino que están llevando. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para darle un mejor tratamiento a sus tierras, aplicando abono, así logrará una producción de mayor escala.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 45 years old, is married, and has three children at home. He lives in the community of Palestina Alta, located in the beautiful jungle of Cuzco where they have their own home. For Cirilo, nothing in this life is impossible, his strength has raised him up to get ahead. He is always involved in his work, always proving that “there is always something to do.” This has turned him into a perseverant person worthy of admiration. Apart from growing cacao and coffee, he also works for other people doing farm work, earning money when he is not busy with his work. In this way he is able to have additional income for his family. Generally he works on his own from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening but at times his family helps him. Normally he sells his products in his community at market prices to help its economy. His main hope is to increase his cacao and coffee plantings. For this he needs to equip himself with more fields. This will help increase his production and his earnings, with the goal of improving his quality of life. This is his third loan with MFP which he is committed to pay on time and also wants to comply with his community bank because of the good path it is putting him on. With the loan he is requesting, he will use it to give better treatment to his lands better, to apply fertilizer, and in this way he will be able to produce on a large scale.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to cultivate coffee and cacao

loans.name: Justina Maria

texts.es:
Justina de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años. Para tener ingresos ella tuvo que remodelar su casa y vender víveres a sus vecinos, poco a poco fue incrementando su pequeña tienda, pero cuando sus hijos demandaban mas gastos, ella empezó a hacer panes y venderlos en una pequeña vitrina en su tienda. 

Poco a poco fue teniendo mas ingresos con los panes, ahora ella trabaja sola produciendo y vendiendo panes, desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h30pm todos los días. 

Quiere que su negocio tenga mas variedad por eso quiere comprar harina, arroz, y levadura para su panadería. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Justina is 39 years old she lives in an urban area in Orquídeas de Guayaquil. She is a single mother and has two children of 10 and 8 years of age. To have some income she had to remodel her home and sell supplies to her neighbors, little by little her little store grew but when her children required more expenses she began to make bread and sold them in a small display cabinet in her store.

Little by Little she earned more income with her breads and now she works alone making and selling the bread from 6 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. everyday.

She wants her business to have more variety of products and wants to buy flour, rice and yeast for her bakery. In the future she wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, rice and yeast.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phally S. is a group leader who has been selected by five people located in Khpob Veaeng village in Kandal province. All of the members of this group loan will use portion of the loan for different purposes with the goal of improving their businesses. Mrs. Phally S. was born 1962. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Lor, is a construction worker. Now she has a problem in that her house is broken. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Phally S. is applying for a loan to fix her house. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To fix her house.

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah G. is from the village of Kinura in the municipality of Kalilangan in Bukidnon Province. She is 30 years old. Farrah is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Farrah owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks, halo-halo or flavored crushed ice mixed with different kinds of colorful nata and gulaman, and other delicacies in the local community. Farrah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Farrah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Farrah is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Farrah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Naitoe Enole

texts.en:
Naitoe Enole N. is 47 years old. She is married to Nepatao N. and she is a mother of three school-going children. She is a farmer and she has been doing this as a main source of income for the last ten years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program done by KADET staffs in her area of residence. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend fifty thousand to prepare the land and plant wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will be doing commercial farming. Naitoe believes she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land and plant wheat

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia Del Carmen tiene 55 años, de sus 4 hijos solamente 1 está a su cargo y cursa el primer año de secundaria. Su actividad económica es la venta de calzado. Ella tiene más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue como una alternativa de fuente de ingresos para su familia, esta no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia en financiamiento, pues siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su condición de vida. Este crédito será invertido para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, zapatos para vestir entre otros.
texts.en:
Antonia Del Carmen, 55, only has one of her four children, who is in first year of secondary school, still under her care. She is a footwear merchant. She has been in this line of work for over 11 years. It is a way for her to have an alternative source of income for her family. This isn’t her first experience with financing because she is always seeking out ways to improve her living conditions. She will use this loan to buy sandals, slippers, athletic shoes, dress shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted footwear.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda H. is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Ilagan. She is 49 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $300 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase baby livestock. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has two children aged 10 and 6. For a living, she sells children’s wear and has been in this business for ten years. She also does outside catering to earn more income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Esther has learnt new ways of doing business. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes which she will use to buy T-shirts and tops and to meet transportation expenses.

Esther hopes to buy a plot of land in the future. She describes herself as a hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts and tops and to meet transportation expenses

loans.name: Darling Yanet

texts.es: La señora Darling Yanet es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene un negocio de pulpería,  por lo que tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio debido a la necesidad de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado proporcionarles estudios, alimentos y vestimenta. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Desea ampliar su inventario aun más para ofrecerles a sus clientes una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Darling Yanet is a hard working woman. She owns a general store and has been in this line of business for over 6 years. She started it so as to provide her family with the income they need. She has 3 young children under her charge, and with great effort she has managed to provide them with schooling, food and clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, juices, bread, detergents and staple grains. She wants to increase her stock in order to be able to offer her customers with a larger assortment of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leoncio De Maria

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene su pequeño negocio la venta de truchas como: pulseras, chapas, gel de cabello entre otros el cual vende día a día ambulante, logrando a si el alimento diario para su familia. Su esposa y dos hijos. 
Cuando inicio lo hizo con el apoyo de sus padres, luego opta por el financiamiento ya que no contaba con mucho capital y deseaba invertir más en el negocio. En donde Afodenic es la puerta para mejorar, también ha logrado mejorar el techo y una división en su pequeña casa. Con este préstamo quiere comenzar a levantar una pared de concreto ya que tiene pegado su casa al muro de su vecino lo que comprara materiales de construcción y comenzar a hacer las mejoras para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio has a small business selling assorted items such as watches, lapel buttons, and hair gel, among others, which he sells every day as a mobile vendor. In this way, he is able to feed his family every day, which consists of his wife and two children. 

When he began, he did so with the support of his parents. Later, he decided to take out financing, because he did not have much capital, and he wanted to invest more in his business. With AFODENIC serving as a gateway for improvement, he has also been able to improve his roof and a wall within his little house. With this loan, he would like to start constructing a concrete wall, since his house is up against his neighbor's wall. He will buy construction materials and begin to make these improvements for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: Buying construction materials to begin building a concrete wall in order to improve his home

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit K. is married and lives with her son’s family with two schoolchildren. Although Anahit’s husband is a university professor, the family’s main income comes from Anahit’s business. The family helps Anahit to run the household and look after the children. Anahit has been managing the trade business since 1995. She sells quality men’s clothing and currently needs to renew the stock and expand the business.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing inventory and expanding the business

loans.name: Yahia

texts.en:
Yahia is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. Married and a father of two daughters and one son, Yahia is a Palestinian NationA. Authority employee. Yahia started a private business, a poultry farm, to increase the family's income.

Yahia came to FATEN to take a loan and purchase feed and chicks to raise and sell. Yahia could in two years build a good database of individuals and shops to sell his chicken. The farm is helping Yahia taking care of his big family.

Yahia appears in the picture here in his farm in Jabalia refugee camp.

loans.use: To purchase feed and chicks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Vendeuse de la quincaillerie de 41 ans. Le premier prêt lui a été très  bénéfique et lui à permis d’améliorer ses conditions de vente et de gestion.
Femme de caractère, elle contrôle son activité chaque jour à l’aide de son journal de caisse.
Le prochain prêt, va lui permettre  d’augmenter  le stock de sa marchandise et d’améliorer ses services au près de sa clientèle.
Elle envoie acheter  sa marchandise a Kinshasa, Cotonou et au Nigeria afin de générer des bénéfices considérables.
Pour sa famille, elle se bat pour que les études de ses enfants aillent vers  de l’avant.
texts.en:
This woman is 41 years old, and she sells hardware supplies. The first loan she received was very helpful as it allowed her to improve her terms of sale and management methods.

A woman of character, she monitors her business on a daily basis using her cash book. 

The next loan will allow her to increase her stocks and improve customer service.

She sends for supplies in Kinshasa, Cotonou and in Nigeria, to generate substantial profits.

She strives to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase electric wiring, light bulbs, outlets, circuit breakers, woodworking tools, etc.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is water. 

She has operated a beauty salon for over two years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Noor faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, she is able to get many customers visiting her beauty salon and hence earn more profit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase hair oil and cosmetics for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair oil and cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Yean L. has been spending her life cultivating crops. She is now married and has four children, three of whom are married and one is single. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Currently, Yean L. lacks money to help her son pay for his driving license fee. That is the reason why Yean L. would like a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for driving license fee for son

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He is 46 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the town of Surallah. Antonio wants to provide all that his family needs. He wants his family to be happy and healthy.

Antonio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use additional income to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mathias

texts.fr: Mathias M. est cultivateur et aide mécanicien, et il est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est né a Rwanda, il est marié, et il a 50 ans.  Il a 12 enfants entre 1 an et 21 ans, et 8 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’une vache.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance d’affaire est d’acheter des autres vaches pour avoir une ferme.  Ses ambitions pour sa famille est de construire une maison d’habitation pour la famille.
texts.en: Mathias M. is a farmer and assistant mechanic. He has been a client of the microfinance institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. since 2007. He was born in Rwanda, is married and is 50 years old. He has 12 children aged between 1 and 21, and 8 of his children attend school. He will use his loan to buy a cow. His strategy for the growth of his business consists in buying more cows and finally owning a farm. His ambition is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda S. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Luzviminda owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay R. is a 48-year-old resident of the province Kompong Tom. She was married but divorced her husband when her children were young. She has five children; four of them still live with her. The other one is married and lives away from the family home. To help support the family, three of her children are employed at different jobs. Svay R. plants rice and some vegetables to earn a living. 

Svay R.’s child is getting married soon but her current savings are insufficient to pay for the wedding ceremony preparations. To deal with this obstacle, Svay R. would like a loan from Kiva to add to her personal savings for her child's wedding. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy a few piglets to feed.

loans.use: To pay for her child's wedding ceremony and to buy a few piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena L. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old and is single. To make a living, Azucena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, milk, choco powder, snack foods and beverages in the local community. Azucena has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Azucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Azucena is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mirzomaruf

texts.en:
Mirzomaruf is married with three children. He owns a shoe business where he repairs and also makes shoes. Mirzomaruf began his business just repairing shoes. Later he began to take orders to make individual shoes as well. Making shoes has become quite a profitable part of his business. 

Mirzomaruf has been in this business for 25 years and has gained a rich experience in making good quality shoes. He is a hardworking and responsible person and has a good reputation among his clients. He has many repeat clients who use his services. Mirzomaruf would like to borrow 3000 USD to purchase materials for his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
