Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase input materials for his business repairing and making shoes.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a forty-five-year-old married woman living in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda. She is married to a lecturer and thier dream is to set up an income generating activity for the family. 

She has been in the handcraft business for six years, first as an employee and later starting her own business. She faces the challenge of seasonal changes. Her dream is to own an art gallery and export to other East African countries. Gertrude needs the loan to buy raw materials for making crafts.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making crafts

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 61 years old and married with one child.  Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, candies and other instant foods. 

In the future, Lucia would like to repair and renovate her house to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es una padre de familia de 60 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con todos los servicio básicos, ubicada en el caserío Amaru Inca Valle de los Incas que se encuentra a 15 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estos lugares desarrollan la actividad agícola, ganadera y artesana.

José es agricultor desde hace  varios años, cuenta con varias hectáreas de terreno en los cuales cultiva y vende  limón, este producto que cultiva es muy rentables, ya que no necesita mucho tiempo para cosechar,  pero gracias a los ingresos que obtiene al vender su producto  puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y familia.

Por eso José ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras de cultivo y su producto, para que su negocio siga creciendo e incrmentando sus ganacias.

José es un hombre responsable y empeñoso,  que se dedica solo ha trabajar para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
José is a 60-year-old father. He lives with his wife and children and they receive all basic services. Their home is located in the village of Amaru Inca Valle de Los Incas, which is 15 minutes away from the District of Tambogrande and approximately 40 minutes away from the Department of Piura. All of the residents in this area have developed businesses in the agriculture, livestock, and handicraft trades.

José has been a farmer for many years. He has several hectares of land on which he cultivates lemons for sale. This product is very profitable and does not require much time to harvest. Thanks to the income he earns from selling this crop, he is able to cover the expenses of his home and his family.

José decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. He will use the money as seed capital for purchasing fertilizers to improve the quality of his land and his product. This will help his business continue to grow and generate income.

José is a hardworking and enterprising man. His sole purpose is to work toward improving the quality of life of his family so that his children can succeed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Segundo Faustino

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 21  años de edad, él es casado sin  carga familiar directa, Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, cuenta con servicio de agua solamente, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.

Segundo se gana la vida desde hace 3 años criando y vendiendo animales menores, el suele criar aves de corral y ganado caprino(cabritos), los cuales ubica en corrales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, segundo alimenta a sus animales con granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Segundo  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de alimentos para aves.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Segundo cuenta con muy buenas referencias de su persona, pues en su comunidad la conocen como un joven trabajador y responsable.




.
texts.en:
Segundo tiene 21  años de edad, él es casado sin  carga familiar directa, Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, cuenta con servicio de agua solamente, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.

Segundo se gana la vida desde hace 3 años criando y vendiendo animales menores, el suele criar aves de corral y ganado caprino(cabritos), los cuales ubica en corrales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, segundo alimenta a sus animales con granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Segundo  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de alimentos para aves.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Segundo cuenta con muy buenas referencias de su persona, pues en su comunidad la conocen como un joven trabajador y responsable.




.

loans.use: Compra de alimentos para aves.

loans.name: Shirley Leticia

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Shirley, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es ebanista.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos realiza trabajos de bordados, nos cuenta que estos trabajos los hace a base de pedidos ya que una señora de la ciudad de Chone cada quince días llega a hasta su casa a comprarle lo que ella ha elaborado hasta la fecha y dejar mas modelos y encargos para la próxima quincena.  Con este crédito ella quiere empezar con la cría de animales de granja, quiere comenzar cerdos para lo cual esta construyendo un pequeño corral.
  
Este crédito es para comprar cerdos pequeños, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen crecimiento. Está en el banco comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como a todas sus compañeras para sacar adelante sus sueños de ser microempresarias.

Su sueño es tener su propia microempresa.
texts.en:
In a place with the name of Pachinche in the city of Portoviejo’s Colon Parish, a place known for its hard working people dedicated to farming and raising livestock, the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Shirley, 37, in this place.  She’s in a relationship and has three children who are 15, 12 and 9 years old.  The two oldest are in secondary school and the youngest goes to elementary school.  Her husband’s a cabinet maker.

She is a housewife.  In order to earn her own income she does embroidery.  She does these items based on orders that a woman from the city of Chone places with her and comes by her house every two weeks to buy what she’s made to date and to leave behind other designs and orders for the next two weeks.  She wants to use this loan to start raising farm animals.  She wants to start with pigs and has built a small corral for this purpose.

The loan is to buy piglets, feed and medicine so that they will develop properly.  She’s been in the communal bank since its inception and she’s the bank Treasurer.  She likes it because of the help both she and her fellow members get to make their dreams of becoming micro businesswomen a reality.  Her dream is to own a micro business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and medicine.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
This is Andrea, 56, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Felipe, a cook in a food stall, and is the mother of five children. Four of her children are already working, while the youngest is in high school. By the grace of God, Andrea has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents; Andrea herself has been an undergraduate, and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Andrea maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Aside from direct selling, she sells breakfast every morning. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 510 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Andrea fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for orders and products that she is selling.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 29 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age dependents.

Aileen owns and operates a motorcycle taxi service to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of business for three years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle to be used in her service.

Aileen has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Aileen hopes to purchase more motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a 57-year-old villager who lives in Talas town. She is a very energetic and optimistic woman who is the main caretaker for her two grandchildren.  She is married with three adult children. The youngest child lives with her and helps in her business. To make a living, Subira is occupied with cattle breeding. In the beginning, she started with an initial capital of 12.000 KGS, which was used to purchase six sheep. Today, she manages to earn about 6.000 KGS a month selling meat products and is still looking forward to developing her farm in the near future. For this reason, Subira has requested a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy 10 sheep. That allows her further development of her household and business. In the future, Subira plans to help her son build a house.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and nine. She also takes care of four other children. Albertine earns a living by selling goods such as tomatoes, cooking oil, and other items. This is her fourth successful year in business. Albertine’s business is well-organized and she currently employs one person to help her. She operates her business from six in the morning through three in the afternoon every day except Saturday. 

Albertine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy additional goods to sell. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. Albertine plans to use the profit generated with her loan to save for her family, pay school fees for her children, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as tomatoes and cooking oil, to sell

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en:
Uyen is a 38-year-old married womA. with 2 daughters. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Uyen and her husband have run a food stall in front of their house for the past three years. They sell steamed rice pancakes and pork pies.

She would like a loA. to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances and good quality ingredients. She hopes that this will enable her to increase turnover, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture, cooking appliances and goods for her food stall.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia tiene 32 años. Tiene 3 hijos y están bajo cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio al no tener suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia y como madre responsable decide establecer este negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella tiene más de cinco créditos con Fundación ha sido una excelente cliente y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado pagar en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, vestidos trajes y faldas.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 32 years old. She has three children that are under her care. She sells clothes for a living. She has been doing this for the past six years. She started this business because she was not earning a sufficient amount of income to support her family. As a responsible mother she decided to start a business in order to provide for her children’s needs. She has had more than five loans with the foundation and is an excellent customer. With the success of her business she has been able to pay her payments on time. She is asking for this loan in order to have working capital so that she can buy pants, shirts, underwear, dresses, suites and skirts.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.name: Melizza Mariott

texts.es:
Melizza nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 23 años de edad.   

Actualmente, Melizza vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en una institución particular en el nivel inicial, ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. Ya son tres años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Melizza requiere el préstamo para hacer una maestría. Su sueño de Melizza es abrir su propio jardín. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Melizza was born in the city of Cusco. She is 23 years old.

Melizza currently lives in the city where she was born, which is also where she engages in her business activities. She is a teacher and works at a private school at the preschool level. Her work schedule is from 8am to 2pm, Monday through Friday. Melizza has been teaching for three years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can pursue a Master’s degree. Her dream is to open her own kindergarten.

The Communal Bank “Comuzone I” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu

loans.use: to pursue a Master's degree.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol with her family. She has had a fish selling business for five years. Anabella buys directly from fishermen in her town. She also buys and resells other seafood like squid and shrimp.

Anabella has requested this loan to buy a weighing scale, fish and squid to sell. She hopes for this loan to help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale, fish and squid to sell

loans.name: Halima Abdalla

texts.en:
Halima is a 47-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 13 to 21 years. She describes herself to be ambitious, patient and joyous. 

She operates a utensils business in which she sells cups, plates, jugs and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of cups, plates, jugs and other plastic utensils. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide her children with a good education to the university level.

loans.use: to add stock of plates, jugs, cups, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She is 51 years old, married to Peter and they have one school-going child.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Esther hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. Besides operating the business, he also practices farming in the area. He is 35 years old and married to Serah; they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods, such as wheat flour, soft drinks and sweets, to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Reuben hopes to expand his retail shop to a wholesale one and get more income.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, soft drinks and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Uruila's Group

texts.en:
Uruila is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a son and a daughter. The daughter studies at school and the son helps his dad. He drives the tractor too.  

Uruila is a retiree. She is applying for the loan because they need funds to purchase a wheel for the tractor. This tractor is the main source of income for the family. In the future, Uruila wishes to repair the house and to celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel for their tractor.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan, a single mother of two, started her garment-retailing business in 2009 by renting a counter in market, selling very fashionable products. Her eldest child is employed, while the younger one is a college student. A sharp and hardworking woman, Jargalsaihan says, "Now that my daughter is a college student, she needs my support very much. I have to do everything I can in order to support her."

Her son is planning to operate a wool-selling business. Jargalsaihan is therefore requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy an electric saw for his new business.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 66 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en casa propia AHH San Martin - II Etapa Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la región Piura, ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de departamento de Lambayeque. Andrés vive en la parte rural de este distrito pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

Andrés se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor, el cual engorda para venderlos después en el mercado local a los comerciantes que visitan la zona, además se dedica a la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola en el caserío 23-5 Malingas en donde puede realizar sus labores de ganadería y agricultura.  Con los ingresos que percibe solventa sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Andrés desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y con esto llegar a un buen desarrollo en menos tiempo.  Asimismo desea comprar fertilizantes para el cuidado de sus sembríos.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.

Andrés es una persona trabajadora y responsable, en la zona sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Andrés is 66 years old, and lives with his partner and his family in his own house, in the second phase of AHH San Martin, of the district of Tambogrande, belonging to Piura, and located some 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. Andrés lives in a rural area of this district but he has electrical service. 

Andrés breeds young livestock, and he fattens them in order to sell later in the local market to the tradespeople that visit the area. He also works in agriculture, for which he has 1 hectare of farming land in the 23-5 sector of the village of Malingas where currently he works raising livestock and farming. With this income he is able to pay his personal and household expenses. 

Andrés wants to buy balanced animal feed for his livestock so they grow faster. He also wants to buy fertilizer for the care of his crops. This is why he thought that to achieve his goal he would ask for a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Andrés is a hardworking and responsible worker. In his neighborhood his neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and they consider him to be calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and balanced livestock feed

loans.name: Aguadencia

texts.en:
Aguadencia is 61 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Aguadencia has a bamboo furniture business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase bamboo materials for her bamboo furniture business. 

Aguadencia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy bamboo for furniture-making business

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia se sigue dedicando al trbajo en una botica,ella vende medicinas y trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este trbajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su botica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas para su botica. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member's name is Yenny. She is 25 years old and single. She works in a pharmacy selling medicine. She works from 8 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With this job, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her pharmacy. She is asking for the loan to buy medicine for her pharmacy. 

Yenny is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Landrada

texts.en: Landrada is 31 years old. She is married with five children between 2 and 8; two of them attend school. She sells different products and she has been running this business for the period of 10 years. With the loan, she will add more new items such as sugar, rice and biscuits to sell. She expects to use the profits to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 42 years old, married to Penninah, and they are blessed with three children. He has been selling cereals for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Martin will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for his stock. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans for his stock

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le l’arachide  avec RAMATA , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de FIGURA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Bidossessi Agossoukou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI AGOSSOUKOU est composé de cinq personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bertille Yolande est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Bertille Yolande est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin.  Bertille Yolande est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Barnabé. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison  Bertille Yolande vend depuis vingt-ans des boissons. Bertille Yolande s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bertille Yolande ensemble avec les membres du groupe AGOSSOUKOU AGOUSSOUKOU, sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Leaders meet Stanley, he was born and raised in Laikipia County then later relocated to Nairobi- Mukuru slums after the 2007-2008 post-election violence. He is a third born out of four children. He grew up with a single mother after he lost his father through a road accident. He was lucky to get sponsors who supported his mother in paying his high school fees. 
After completing high school, although he performed well and managed to get a C+, he was forced by circumstances to work as laborer at a construction site which paid him three hundred and fifty shillings (350) per day which at least helped him support his mother who is a house wife and his siblings put food on the table and cater for the basic needs. His self-esteem was low but securing a job at DDD revived him as he could count on a stable income and at least have hope of ever advancing his dream career as a Teacher dealing with children with special needs in his community.
Stanley is supposed to join Kenyatta University next year- 2016 January as stated in DDD’s policy but cannot do so without your assistance in terms of funds for school fees. He will sincerely appreciate if Kiva Leaders would help him fulfill his dreams as a Teacher and as a way of showing gratitude he is planning to see the needy children in his community through school after he acquires his University degree and gets employed hopefully by the government. Stanley likes to Socialize, Read inspirational novels and Swimming.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR UNIVERSITY TUITION FEES

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray has a number of businesses. He has a vegetable garden where he grows pumpkins, tomatoes, peas and cucumbers. He has a flower decoration business which he sells to church groups and local people. He has also recently started a BBQ fast food business, also from the outside of his house. In fact all these businesses run from the front of his house at Nonoa. 

Ray is one of the few males in the SPBD program. He is the chief of his village lending group in Nonoa, one of 180 in SPBD. The Nonoa center is one of SPBD\'s most reliable and in December Ray was awarded  one of the seven prizes for best chief at the Annual Prizegiving function. He was also engaged by SPBD to decorate the hall for the function, and is pictured here in SPBDs office with some of the flower arrangements ready for the function.

loans.use: Fertiliser, seeds, pots, BBQ meat, timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a spinner to expand her wool spinning business

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs Hoa is 68 years old. Her husband died long time ago. She has a son who is 42 years old, he has 3 children. Mrs. Hoa’s son is very poor so Mrs Hoa must support her son. Mrs. Hoa sells food for breakfast in the morning at her house. She borrowed a loan with no interest from the project, which has been important for them, as it increased their income by about $1.25/person/month. Average income is $8.5/person/month. Mrs Hoa has repaid a loan of $50, and now she asks to borrow a loan of $75 again.

loans.use: sells food for breakfast

loans.name: Reinaldo Javier

texts.es:
Mr. B. is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and their two daughters, who study at a public school in the city. Mr. B. works as a street vendor selling cassava (a root that is very popular in Paraguay, it is a little like a potato), vegetables, and charcoal. He walks through the streets offering his products from a cart pulled by a horse. He has a garden at his house where he grows the vegetables he sells. He plants them depending on the season, both for his family’s consumption and for sale. He wakes up every morning at 6:00 AM to begin work in his garden, and then he goes to work selling the charcoal and other products. His wife helps him sell the charcoal.

A few days ago, his horse, which was very important to his work, died. Because of this, Reinaldo is requesting a loan of $450.00, which he will use to buy a younger horse so that he can return to selling his products with greater ease.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor B. tiene 39 años, vive en pareja y tiene dos hijas que estudian en una escuela pública de la ciudad El Señor trabaja como vendedor ambulante de mandioca (yuka, una raíz muy consumida en el Paraguay parecida a la papa), verduras y carbón. El recorre las calles ofreciendo sus productos en un carrito estirado por un caballo. Actualmente, en su domicilio tiene una huerta donde produce sus hortalizas para luego venderlas, planta productos dependiendo la estación para su consumo y para la venta. Se despierta así cada mañana a las 6 de la mañana para empezar a trabajar en su chacra y después se dedica a la venta del carbón y demás productos. Cuenta también con la ayuda de su señora que lo ayuda a repartir el carbón. Hace unos días murió el caballo que era su herramienta principal de trabajo, debido a esto, Reinaldo solicita un crédito de $ 450 que los invertirá en la compra de un nuevo caballo más joven, así podrá volver a salir a repartir sus productos con mayor facilidad.

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Chung P. Y. is a young talented woman of twenty-eight years of age. She is married with two children.  In the early days of their marriage, Chung and her husband worked in order to gain money.  She will use her loan to buy the equipment for doing the job, and she is so grateful for her husband for helping her do it.  She believes that they will succeed because they are both working together, and their expenses are low as their baby is just three years old.  Chung appreciates the help from S.P.B.D for lending her the money so that she is now able to make her business possible.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equipment

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria has been a widow for a long time and charged herself with the duty of caring for her children. When her husband disappeared she was left with only one form of income, a pension from the minister of education. This money was not sufficient since her children study in a modest school in the city center. Therefore Maria began to sell different market goods such as clothing which she brought from the capital city. This business has yielded good result and she will continue selling. Thanks to her efforts and skillful management of the funds that her work generates Maria was able to save up and purchase a motorcycle taxi which her son drives. Despite the good care that her son has taken with the motorcycle since she purchased it, the motorcycle has reached the end of its life and they need to purchase a new one. Maria also desires to change the accessories so that she can continue working and fulfill her plans to purchase another motorcycle taxi.

Maria needs a sum of $500 in order to move her plans forward. This amount will permit her to continue to receive income and save for the well planned investment.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

María se quedó viuda hace mucho tiempo, haciéndose cargo D. sus cinco hijos con el único ingreso, la pensión que recibía del ministerio D. educación a raíz D. la desaparición D. su esposo, este dinero no le era suficiente para mantener suficientemente bien a sus hijos que están estudiando en un modesto centro educativo D. su pequeña ciudad, así que decidió empezar a vender mercadería D. diverso uso en especial ropa que traía D. la capital, esta incursión le dió buenos resultados y no deja D. trabajar vendiendo, gracias al esfuerzo y al buen manejo D. las utilidades que genera su labor ha podido ahorrar llegando a obtener un mototaxi que es manejado por su hijo mayor.El buen cuidado que le da su querido socio a la unidad móvil desD. que la obtuvieron se encuentra en la urgente necesidad D. comprar un motor nuevo ya que el anterior ya cumplió su ciclo D. vida, también desea cambiar los accesorios para seguir trabajando ya que está dentro D. sus planes comprar otro mototaxi en un tiempo determinado.La suma que necesita para poder llevar adelante sus proyectos es D. 500 dólares, cifra que le permitirá seguir percibiendo ingresos y ahorrar con la buena y acertada inversión que va a realizar.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle and parts

loans.name: Leni

texts.en: Leni is a 25 year old married woman. Together with her husband, Sadi, she has been producing and selling candied fruits. She usually earns US$10 per day.  In certain seasons, she also sells fresh fruits. Her husband, Sadi, also sells fruit at the market.  She is requesting a US $100 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali H.  is a 47-year-old farmer who raises and sells sheep in a small village in Saatli. He lives with his family in small IDP camp, under difficult conditions. He has been breeding and selling sheep for 9 years. He is very successful in his business, but beginning last year prices for fodder tripled and have remained at that level. To counteract this rise in costs, he would like to expand his business and his herd. He applied for a loan of $1100. The estimated price for one sheep is $60-70 and with the rest of loan he will purchase fodder.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder to expand his livestock business

loans.name: Nuryati

texts.en: Nuryati is 41, married to D. and has 3 children. For a living she rents her small pool at her house and earns $5 a day. She also sells snacks and instant beverages and earns $1 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz Verónica is 28 years old and she has a 3 year old daughter named Luz Nayeli. She is makes a living by selling shoes that she knits with little stones and sequins on them. She has done this for a while now. She went to school to learn how to do this creative art. She took classes in the city of Trujillo and now in the city of Ucayali she is showing off what she learned. The best way for her to sell her items it to make them once a client has placed an order. She is requesting a loan because she wants to be able to buy more of the items that she needs to be able to make her beautiful shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Liz Verónica de 28 años de edad, tiene una hijita de nombre Luz Nayeli de 03 añitos de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos tejidos (bordados en lentejuelas y piedras), desde hace tiempo. Estudió este arte tan bonito en la ciudad de Trujillo, y ahora en la región Ucayali está demostrando lo que realmente aprendió, sólo trabaja a través de los pedidos de sus clientes, porque nos comenta que es la manera más fácil de vender. Su solicitud atiende a la necesidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para seguir confeccionando sus bellos zapatos.

loans.use: Buy the basic materials to make her beautiful shoes.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Mrs. Chem S. is 28 years old, has two young children and makes her living farming a variety of vegetables in Kompong Chnang province. She makes only $1.50 a day. Her husband, Von Somban, is 34 and works both as a fisherman and rice farmer, bringing in another $1.50 daily. Ms. Chem wants to use her loan to buy a motor-taxi for her husband so he can move into a higher-earning occupation. His higher earning power will help him better support his wife and two children. (Mr. Von Somban is pictured with the motorbike he would like to purchase)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
In the Panamericana Sur road, divison of Santa Lucia she has a small sweets and soda stand. Doña Elizabeth, who began this business three years ago, thanks her sister for all her guidance.

Elizabeth begins her job at 8:00am every morning and ends at 6:00pm. Thanks to the benefits he gets from this job she is able to help offer financial help to her elderly family members and younger siblings. She helps them with home expenses. At this moment she wishes to receive a credit in order to increase quantity of her products and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

En la carretera Panamericana Sur, precisamente en el desvió Santa Lucia, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas Doña Elizabeth, quien emprendió este negocio hace 3 años, gracias a la iniciativa de su hermana mayor.Elizabeth empieza su trabajo a las 8 de la mañana para culminar a las 6 de la tarde, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene con este negocio apoya a sus ancianos padres y menores hermanos con los gastos de su hogar, en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos a fin de incrementar sus ganacias.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de dulces.

loans.name: Savey Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people in Preak Thom Village, Cambodia, comprise one village bank. Mrs. Savey C. is the village bank president. She sells shells in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Oeurk, is a motorbike-taxi driver. Mrs. Savey C. has seven children, six of whom attend a local school; the other is too young to work or study.

Previously, Mrs. Savey C. obtained a loan to buy a motorbike to start Mr. Sam Ol Oeurk’s motor-taxi business. The business now faces a small problem, because the motorbike needs to be repaired, but they do not have enough money to fix it. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Savey C., decided to take a loan to repair the motorbike. With the rest of money, she will buy more shells to re-sell them.

loans.use: To repair their motorbike and buy more shells to resell

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa Fedow, 36, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the clothing business. She sells to the general public and villages 5 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Epenesa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be use to pay for the kids' education. Her husband helps with the business.

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric, paints and brushes.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng K., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sreang Sreng, 29, who live in a small village across the MeK. River about eighteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, have been married for five years and have one daughter.
 
Mrs. Sokheng has been selling fruit since she was young. She buys the fruit from Dem Kor Martke (a fruit market in Phnom Penh) for resale at her shop in Olimpic Market in Phnom Penh City. Mr. Sreang has been a wooden house builder for three years. 

From July until December, Cambodians have a lot of ceremonies according to Buddhism. Fruit selling is a very good business in this season because people will use fruit for praying and to give to the monks at the pagoda. 

Therefore, Sokheng is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more fruit for resale at her shop.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling fruit.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in the second section of the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works in construction and she has is responsible for a 5 year old granddaughter. She has worked as a cook in a private school for 21 years, providing delicious dishes. When she started at the school she was a helper, now she is in charge of the kitchen. She is asking for a loan to build a wall on the front of her home, so she needs to buy stone, cement, sand and steel. In the future she would like to add her own dining room and be able to sell her delicious dishes and also be able to teach her granddaughter to cook all the dishes she prepares, and that some day she can take over the business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maria tiene 54 años de edad, habita en la II etapa del barrio de Hialeah de Managua, su esposo trabaja en construcción y tiene una nieta a su cargo que tiene 5 cinco años de edad, ella se desempeña como cocinera de un colegio privado y tiene ya veinte años laborando y dando sus servicios con sus ricos platillos, cuando entró al colegio era ayudante ahora es la responsables de la cocina. La solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en la parte frontal de su vivienda, para eso necesita comprar piedra, cemento, arena y hierro. A largo plazo le gustaría poner su propio comedor y a si poder vender sus ricos platillo y también poder enseñar a su nieta los diversos platillo que ella prepara, y que algún día ella pueda seguir el negocio

loans.use: Construct  a wall in the front part of her home.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora T., 45, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala (~175 USD).  SPBD loans are Nora's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband is a fisherman who also sell fish to earn money.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo A. est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant.  Pour gagner de l’argent il opère une boutique des pièces détachées à deux roues à Kpalimé au Togo. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter le stock de sa petite boutique pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients.  Spécifiquement, il veut acheter les pièces moto généralement importées du Nigeria pour revendre.  Avec l’amélioration de son activité, il peut mieux subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.
texts.en:
Kodzo A. is 28 years old, married, and the father of one child. To earn money, he has a shop selling spare parts for motorbikes in Kpalimé, Togo. With this loan, his second with FECECAV, he wishes to increase the inventory of his small shop to meet customer demands. Specifically, he wants to buy engine parts generally imported from Nigeria in order to resell them. With the improvement of his business, he can better support his child and thus help his community to develop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
B. Olim is 30-year-old married man with two children. Olim is a hard-working man who was taught farming by his father. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business about nine years ago. 

Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and is proud to say that the business has been running well. However, he now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, Olim is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 Somoni to purchase four cattle for an estimated cost 300 USD each. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand and grow the business

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Phum Por village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables to earn a living. In the plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase bean seed to grow in the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase bean seeds for growing. Mrs. Kan P. is a 53-year-old widow with two children who are farmers who help on their mother's plantation.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase bean seed for growing.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: This is a small group with four members, and S. is the leader. S. is 25 years old and sells groceries out of her house in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She's married to Bo, 33, who is a motorcycle taxi driver in the town. Her business is going well because the location is in a crowded area. She has two children, both of whom are small. To expand her business, S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lemar

texts.en:
Lemar K. he is an educated man with many years of experience. He has been working in the plant propagation business for many years. He has good consistent customers. Lemar's business was quite small when he received his first loan. With the money, he increased his stock, then he improved his business and had even more success.

Lemar has requested a second-cycle loan, 50000 (AFN), with a term of 27 months to enlarge his business and involve one of his sons. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all of his family. He is sure that he can further enhance his business with more success and he is very happy about this process of getting a loan in Afghanistan for poor people having financially problems. Lemar thanks all lenders, KIVA and AFSG, in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is 37 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria.She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, pues el afán de mantener a su familia lo impulsó a brindar a sus seres queridos una casa propia donde vivir. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de comida, pues la cocina es una de las habilidades más resaltantes de su persona, ya que fue muy exigente con la comida que degustaba y con el tiempo se animó a especializarse como cocinero, y al descubrir sus dones en la cocina abrió un restaurante de mariscos en las playas del sur de su ciudad. A este lugar, los turistas suelen visitar para pasar un fin de semana junto al mar, siendo los clientes más frecuentes en el restaurante de don Julio. Pero como atiende solo los fines de semanas instaló en su casa un pequeño restaurante que atiende su esposa y él cocina durante la semana. Pero sin duda, lo que desea es adquirir un local más amplio para que su restaurante en la playa sea uno de los más acogedores para los extranjeros, quienes son sus clientes más frecuentes y a quienes desea brindar una mejor atención. Juan está en su cuarto préstamo con MFP y espera seguir trabajando junto al grupo de personas que le enseñaron cómo trabajar en equipo. Invertirá los 2500 soles que solicita, en la compra de utensilios, mesas y demás muebles que puedan dar mejor apariencia a su restaurante.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man, and his eagerness to take care of his family motivated him to provide his loved ones with their own house to live in. For 20 years he has been selling food, since cooking is one of his most outstanding skills. He has always been very demanding about the quality of food, and with time he decided to specialize in becoming a chef. Once he discovered his gifts in the kitchen, he opened a seafood restaurant in the southern beaches of his city. In this place, tourists spend weekends at the sea, and are don Juan's most frequent customers. But since he only works there on weekends, he put a little restaurant in his house which his wife takes care of, and he cooks there during the week. Without a doubt, though, what he would like to do is get a bigger location so his restaurant becomes one of the most welcoming to foreigners, who are his most frequent customers and for whom he wants to provide the best service.

This will be Juán's fourth loan with MFP and he hopes to continue working together with the group that has taught him how to work as part of a team. He will invest the 2500 soles that he is asking for in the purchase of utensils, tables, and other furniture which will improve the appearance of his restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils and furniture for his restaurant

loans.name: Masseye

texts.fr: Monsieur Masseye G. est un commerçant de pièces détachées qui habite au quartier Cité Lamy à Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Avant, il était mécanicien, mais avec l’aide des fonds provenant d’une tontine, il a acheté des pièces détachées pour les revendre a la gare routière de Thiès.  Il sollicite son premier crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva pour renforcer son activité.  Monsieur G. est célibataire et avec les revenus de son entreprise il se soutient.
texts.en:
Mr. Masseye G. is a merchant of spare parts who lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. In the past, he was a mechanic, but with the help of funds from a tontine (a community revolving savings and loan group), he bought spare parts in order to resell them at the Thiès bus station. He's requesting his first loan from IMCEC and Kiva to bolster his business. Mr. G. is unmarried and, with the revenues from his enterprise, he supports himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: May

texts.en: Managing a mini-eatery is the chosen business of May T., a young businesswoman of 24.  She is married to Dennis and he is engaged in street food vending in their village.  They are working hard to earn a bigger income for the needs of their children and their family.  Her request of a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 will really assist them financially in improving their business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Leslie Yamileth

texts.es: La Sra. Leslie F. tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive en el barrio San Jose que esta ubicado a 3 minutos de la playa cedeño. ella vive en union libre con el Sr. Haylon Nuñez con han procreado 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta en edad escolar y el otro esta pequeño y ella tiene que cuidarlo, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi ella no descuida a sus hijos y esta trabajando todo el dia, el negocio que tiene es una sala con varias consolas de juegos (maquinas de entretenimiento) en estos momentos ella necesita comprar dos televisores y reparar dos consolas de juegos por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito, este negocio deja buenas ganancias ya que muchos niños y jovenes pasan jugando durante sus horas libres. casi siempre esta lleno de personas que estan jugando.
texts.en:
Leslie F. is 30 years old and she lives in the San Jose region, located 3 minutes from the Cedeño beach. She lives with her common law husband Haylon Nuñez, and they have 2 children together, one is old enough to attend school, but the other is still a baby and she needs to take care of him. Her business is run from her house. It is convenient because she can attend to her children and work all day. Her business is a living room set up with various games (entertainment systems). She is currently seeing a need to purchase two television sets and repair two gaming consoles, which is the reason why she is requesting this loan. Her business brings her a good income, especially because many children and youth spend their free time playing in her living room. Her business is almost always filled to capacity with people playing.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two television sets and to repair two gaming consoles.

loans.name: Ma. Bona

texts.en: "I started selling food in 2006. I only had Php 6,000 capital back then and that is what I used to continue doing business. My business is located in Bilang-bilangan, an island in Trinidad, Bohol. My income from my business is what I use to pay our daily expenses at home," says Ma. Bona B., a 38-year old mother of two children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 16,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for her food business. In doing so, Ma. Bona thinks that she will be able to improve their livelihood. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married to Alfredo, who is a ferry boat operator in their village. They are blessed to have three children, all of whom are married: Rogelio (39 years old); Reviline (36 years old); and Romana (35 years old). Rosalinda and Alfredo reside in the village of Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela. Their home is simple and is close to the market, but they need to cross the Cagayan River to get there.

Rosalinda helps her husband with their ferry boat transport business. Specifically, they transport passengers to and from their village to the town proper of Ilagan, Isabela. The business has become the couple's sole source of income to pay for their daily living needs. She is now seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175) because their boat requires some maintenance work. Rosalinda hopes to sustain their business operation so that they can continue to cover their daily expenses. She explains that, even if they are a poor family, they can still live a normal life. She mentions that there is a saying on this point: “poverty is not a hindrance to success.”

loans.use: To maintain their ferry boat

loans.name: Babaseyid

texts.en:
Babaseyid S. is a young man of 55. Little by little, he reaches his goals through perseverance and dedication. Thanks to his personal strength and desire to provide a better future for his family, he has progressed from being a salesman to being his own boss. Approximately 15 years ago, Babaseyid rented a place which had deteriorated badly, with terrible conditions, and it was there he started his business. Since then, he has expanded his grocery and now it is one of the best known groceries in his community. 

Babaseyid is now requesting a loan of $2,000 USD to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his store. Babaseyid is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will be key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Akossivi

texts.fr: Cette femme a embrassé un commerce qui lui réussit bien, elle exerce dans la vente des articles de mercerie, après étude d’autres besoins de sa clientèle, elle a associé à la vente des articles de mercerie le commerce de produits de beauté. Son stock d’article de mercerie a baissé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et agrandir en même temps le stock de produits de beauté. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES.
texts.en:
This woman started a business that works well for her, namely selling sewing supplies. After surveying the needs of her clientele, she also started selling cosmetics. Her stock of sewing supplies has dropped, and she wants to resupply and, at the same time, increase her stock of cosmetics. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Albertina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Albertina vende emoliente (bebida caliente elaborada con hierbas y semillas de lino) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de las Américas, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches. Albertina tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Albertina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos para su tienda.
Albertina sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Albertina is 31, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Albertina is a street vendor who sells “emoliente” (a warm drink made with herbs and flax seeds) at the Américas market. She sells every evening. Albertina plans to set up a grocery store in her house. Albertina needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy products for her store. Albertina dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Omoruyi

texts.en:
Omoruyi is married with six children and she is 40 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells local pots. She has been in this business for a long time.

Omoruyi hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more local pots to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local pots to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. runs a food stall selling a variety of food products in her community. She is married and has one small child. She is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga. Maria has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 500 talas a month.

Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a loan of 1000 talas which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. This will be Maria's first loan from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es: Flavio G. C. de 41 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos aun menores de edad. Flavio y su esposa trabajan juntos en su pequeño negocio, una tienda con productos de consumo diario, la cual se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, los ingresos generados por el negocio son excelentes pero Flavio y su esposa se lamentan de falta de productos que carece su negocio y que muchos clientes buscan, ellos desean de un crédito que les permita surtir su negocio con otros productos como granos básicos y variedad de bebidas , para poder  aprovechar al máximo la demanda de sus clientes, Flavio es una persona muy responsable con sus créditos otorgados, actualmente no posee ningún crédito activo.
texts.en:
Flavio G. C. is 41-years-old and lives in the department of La Libertad along with his wife and their two young children. Flavio and his wife have a small business together, a convenience store which is located in their home. Their business brings in a high income, but his wife regrets that their business lacks products that many customers want. They want a loan so they can supply their business with other products such as basic grains and a variety of drinks to be able to get the most from their customer demand. Flavio is a very responsible person with his loans and none of them are currently outstanding.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supply business with products such as grains and drinks

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung L., 34, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling porridge at a nearby local market in the town, earning approximately US $1.66 per day. The family is also assisted mainly by her husband who is currently involved in a business of repairing electronic appliances such as televisions and radios. He is able to earn an income of US $2.83 per day as a primary source of income for his family and to support the three children’s studies.

Mrs. L. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase spare parts for televisions and other electronic devices to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy television and electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 34 years old and married with 5 children. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells for long hours to enable her meet the basic needs of her family members. She sells ice cream at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her sales and she hopes to make more profits. She loves this business because it is highly competitive. She has been in this business for five years. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream

loans.name: Doris Francisca

texts.es:
la señora Doris Francisca Figuerioa tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose Enrique Castillo, el es mesero profesional, dependen de ellos un hijo que esta estudiando para embarcarse.
 
Doris se dedica a la venta de golosinas por las tardes en su propio local y para esta navidad les va a dar una sorpresa a sus clientes ya que tiene pensado hacer otro tipo de comidas, sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares que viven en esta zona.
Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 08 años.
 
Doris esta solicitando un creedito para hacer algunos arreglos y detalles que le hacen falta
al nuevo local ademas para la compra de frescos, maseca, leña, verduras y carnes.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris Francisca F. is 51 years old and married to Sr. Jose Enrique Castillo, who is a professional waiter. They have a dependent child who is attending school.

Doris sells sweets in the afternoons out of her own shop. For the Christmas season, she plans to surprise her customers by offering other types of food. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and relatives who live in the area. She has been in this business for eight years.

Doris is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, cornmeal, firewood, vegetables, and meats. These items are needed to prepare the new dishes she plans to offer in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikret A. is a 52-year-old married man with an adorable daughter. After finding it very difficult to get a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business selling home products eight years ago. Fikret began by selling a small selection of basic products, and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. Fikret is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor De Maria tiene 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa hace mas de 4 años que ella recorre los diferentes lugares a ofrecer sus productos. Ella inicio esta actividad cuando anteriormente se dedicaba a impartir clases como maestra en un colegio público y su salario era my bajo esto no lograba cubrir los gastos de su familia, por lo que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y son menores de edad, por lo que al inicio no tenía mucha experiencia pero compro lo que sus clientes más le solicitaban como trajes para niños, vestidos, pantalones entre otras cosas así fue que poco a poco ella fue progresando con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarles una  muy buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor De Maria is 32 years of age. She has been dedicated to the sale of clothes for more than 4 years. She travels through different places to offer her products. When she began this activity she was giving classes as a teacher in a state school and her salary was very low and failed to cover the expenses of their family. She has 2 children in her care and they are under age. At first she did not have a lot of experience, but she purchased what her clients most requested, such as outfits for children, dresses, and pants, among other things. In this way she was able to progress with her business little by little. The financing that she requests is for the purchase of merchandise. Her wish is to provide a very good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is 52 years old and married with six children between 18 and 31 years old. Two of her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she is staying with six people. Hajara takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying cattle in the village of Ngoma in Luwero district. She buys cattle and sells them to butchers in Kawempe and Kalerwe areas in Kampala district.  She also sells some cattle to meat packers. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of two customers a day and sells to all categories of people at wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality, which makes her business difficult. Hajara has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for eight years. She has had 17 loans, working with the same group mates. Hajara joined MCDT because it was near her home and it worked with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more cattle. She hopes to see her business grower bigger and to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en:
Nneka is 32 years old. She is married and has 5 children. They are doing well in their various schools. She and her husband hope to educate their children at the university level.

She sells frozen food and foodstuffs like rice, tomato paste, oil, etc., to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She finds this business interesting due to the interaction with her customers. She has been in the business for some years and hopes to expand her business in the future.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52 year old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Ali has owned a grocery store since 1999. He sells all types of canned food, beverages, candies, chips and more. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase stock. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. He is a welcoming person and he has a good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he didn’t have a lot of merchandise. Ali decided to run his business because he wanted to have  independent work. He, therefore, came up with the idea of opening his grocery store. In the future he plans to keep expanding his business by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Yadira Esmeralda

texts.es: El cliente es de oficio contador, como no le trabaja a una empresa en particular, brinda sus servicios profesionales de contabilidad, obteniendo sus ingresos por servicios prestados. Tiene a su cargo tres hijos, que están estudiando, el préstamo lo necesita para realizarle una mejora a la casa. Con los prestamos anteriores a logrado estabilizarse económicamente.
texts.en:
Yadira is an accountant by profession, but she does not work for any particular company. She provides professional bookkeeping services in order to generate an income. Yadira has three dependent children who are in school.

This loan is needed to make an improvement to her home. With her previous loans, she has been able to achieve financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to make home improvements

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1953 à Avrankou dans le département de l'Ouémé, M. Célestine vit depuis 31 ans environs à Fidjrossè Kpota à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Célestine est mariée à ASSE Innocent et est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mais un seul des enfants est à sa charge. Célestine vit ensemble avec son mari à Fidjrossè Kpota. Célestine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses charges, Célestine mène comme activité la vente de poissons et de crevettes fumés à son domicile. Célestine prépare et vend également de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base de maïs). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis trente ans et a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Célestine a bien remboursé les trois crédits. La clientèle de Célestine s'accroît au jour le jour et elle n'arrive plus à faire face à toutes leurs demandes. Célestine sollicite pour ce faire, un quatrième prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1953 in Avrankou, in the department of Ouémé, Célestine M. has lived in Fidjrossè Kpota in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, for about 31 years. Célestine is married to Innocent Asse and is the mother of five children who have all been educated. Only one, however, is in her care. Célestine lives with her husband in Fidjrossè Kpota. She did not attend school. To meet her responsibilities, Célestine sells smoked fish and shrimp from her home. Célestine also prepares and sells akassa (a porridge made from cornmeal, a local staple). She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. She has done this kind of work for 30 years and has already received three loans through ALIDé. Célestine repaid all three loans. Her clients are growing in number by the day and she is no longer able to meet their demands. Célestine is requesting a fourth loan in order to build up her business and better meet the demands of her clients.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and sacks of corn for the preparation of akassa

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. produces palm oil locally for sale at Jukwa.To prepare her palm oil, she gets palm nuts from farmers on the farm. She washes them, boils them for a while until they become soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruits into a big mortar and gently pounds with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and the chaff removed. (The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires).The juice is boiled again and as it boils the fresh oil will be seen floating on the surface of the pot; it is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. Fresh oil from palm fruits is traditionally used in eating roasted yam or plantain in Africa – especially on the farms after a hard day's work.

Efua has received junior high education. She is a widow and has four children. Efua has been selling palm oil for some time now. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to make palm oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save up for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to make palm oil for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F. is a trader as well as a member of staff at First International Bank (FIB) in Bo. She lives at Fenton Road and has a shop at Labour Road. Her sister normally helps her at the shop when she is at work. Ama takes care of her mother and four sisters.
