Ama has some entrepreneurial and financial skills in business. She intends to add more stock to her food shop from the loan she is seeking. In this way, she hopes to attract more customers as well as keeping the old ones. She also hopes to buy a commercial motorbike to increase her revenue base.

loans.use: To buy food products for her store

loans.name: Denny Ademir

texts.es: Denny Ademir C. M. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, la capital del país. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y tres hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, el mayor educación básica y los dos menores asisten a parvularia.  Denny posee una barbería, en la cual se encarga de cortar el cabello, cortar la barba y hacer otros tipos de trabajos, todos relacionados con el cuidado personal de las personas. Posee 13 años de experiencia laboral en ese rubro, contando con una gran cantidad de clientes, los cuales lo conocen desde hace muchos años atrás, ya sean familiares o vecinos, los cuales tienen muy buen concepto de él por ser muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo, el cual siempre esta renovando sus conocimientos para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Denny es el único que posee trabajo en su hogar, por lo que su familia depende por completo de él. Es esta una de las mayores razones por las cuales solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tijeras nuevas, maquinas para cortar el cabello, y así mismo tratamientos para el cuidado del cabello, de esta manera Denny espera mejorar sus ventas y así percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Denny Ademir C. M., 34, lives in San Salvador department, the country’s capital, with his life partner and their three minor children who are students. The oldest is in elementary school and the two little ones are in preschool. Denny has a barber shop where he cuts hair, trims beards and does other jobs that are related to personal care. He has been in this line of work for 13 years and has many regular customers that have known him for many years. Whether they are relatives or neighbors, he is held in high esteem because he is very responsible and dedicated to his work; he is constantly updating his skills in order to provide better service to his customers. Denny is the only employed person in his household so the family is completely dependent on him. This is one of the main reasons why he’s asking for funding to buy new scissors and hair clippers as well as hair treatment supplies. Denny hopes that this will help him to improve his sales and thus earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scissors and hair products to stock his barber shop.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Jenny Elizabeth tiene 39 años. La actividad económica es la repostería y el alquiler de sillas. Hace más 13 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la única actividad que tiene también es la venta de mercadería en general, pues siempre está buscando la manera de llevar ingresos a su vivienda, pues como toda madre responsable tiene que hacerse cargo de la manutención de sus hijos.  El dinero solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima necesaria. El sueño de Jenny es seguir aumentando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jenny Elizabeth is 39 years old. Her economic activity is a pastry shop and she also rents chairs. For more than 13 years she has worked on her business and it is not her only business since she also sells general merchandize and is always looking for a way to increase the income for her home as any responsible mother does when taking care of her children. The money needed will be used as work capital to buy the necessary raw materials. Jenny’s dream is to keep increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem V., 27, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. V. is employed to grow plants for an income of USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz B., 62, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Iniego B., a vendor, they are blessed with a child in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own meat shop for the past few years now.

Paz has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her meat business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more meat to be incorporated into her current product inventory. She will be buying pork, poultry and beef.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and have more patrons.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more pork, poultry, and beef for her product inventory.

loans.name: Limber

texts.es:
Limber Díaz Rodríguez es una persona muy joven, él vive solo en la  comunidad de buena vista provincia mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Limber con  19 años de edad desde muy pequeño fue abandonado por sus padres y empezó a trabajar en construcción con los vecinos del lugar. Ahí fue aprendiendo el oficio de la construcción (albañil) en el tiempo que creció.

Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con el  crédito que está solicitando el desea tener su propia casita en el mismo pueblo  y para empezar quiere comprarse un lote para luego construir ahí su propia casa en el pueblo y tener una mejor calidad de vida,  porque en el pueblo donde vive hay mucho trabajo y quiere seguir trabajando junto a la gente que lo vio crecer.
texts.en:
Limber Díaz Rodríguez is a very young person. He lives alone in the community of Buena Vista, Mizque province, department of Cochabamba. Limber, is 19 and was abandoned by his parents when he was very small. He started to work in construction with the area residents. There he learned construction skills (bricklaying) while he was growing up. With his hard work and with the loan that he is asking for he wants to have his own little house in the same town. To start he wants to buy a lot to later build his own house there and have a better quality of life, because in the town he lives in there is a lot of work and he wants to keep working with the people who watched him grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a lot of land to build a home

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna es una joven de 26 años, vive en compañía de sus padres en casa de ellos. Hace dos años empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, forjando su propio restaurante, en donde su madre la apoya en la atención. De esta manera y todos los días se dedica a preparar comida, al gusto y preferencia del cliente. En las mañanas se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para prepara el almuerzo, una vez terminada sus ventas, limpia los platos y demás trastos para tener todo listo para mañana. Manifiesta que aunque el trabajo sea agotador, lo considera una distracción, poro tanto su anhelo es mejorar el aspecto de su establecimiento. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería, como gaseosas, asimismo comprar sillas.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a young woman of 26. She lives with her parents in their house. Two years ago, she began to work independently, opening her own restaurant, where her mother helps her serve customers. Thus, every day she works preparing food to suit her customers' tastes and preferences. During the mornings, she stocks up on the necessary ingredients to prepare lunch. Once her sales have finished, she washes the dishes and other items so that everything will be ready for the next day. She reports that although her work is tiring, she finds it enjoyable. Her desire for the future is to improve the appearance of her establishment. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support, since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. She is grateful to all of the people who will make this loan possible. It will be very useful to her in further developing her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying supplies, such as soft drinks, and she will also buy chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soft drinks and chairs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa M. is from the village of Bantay, Solana, Cagayan. She is 46 years old. Marissa is widowed and has one infant children. To make a living, Marissa raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marissa is just starting her business.

Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. is a 30-year-old married woman living in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh City.  Heng uses a piece of farmland she inherited many years ago from her grandparents to grow a variety of crops, receiving help in the planting from her husband.  She will use half of the loan she is requesting to grow crops, and the rest will be put towards buying a used pumping machine for her field.

loans.use: To grow crops.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto de 44 años de edad es casado,  tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, su esposa  se encarga de los quehaceres de hogar y del cuido de sus hijos. labora como docente de educaciòn profesional desde hace 14 años en el CETA INATEC de Nueva Guinea ubicado en la colonia Yolaina. 

Esta solicitando su 9no credito con el cual pretende construir una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones como todo cuidadano lo sueña, don Luis se siente agradecido por los creditos que ha obtenido por la institucion ya que ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida en su hogar, su mayor sueño es poco a poco mejorando su vivienda y tener estabilidad laboral para cumplir con sueño.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 44, is married and has two children who are students. His wife is a housewife and cares for the children. He has worked as a teacher for 14 years at the National Technical Institute in Nueva Guinea located in the Yolaina neighborhood. He is asking for his 9th loan which he intends to use to build a room with the best conditions like every citizen dreams of. Luis is grateful for the loans that he has gotten through the Institution that have improved the living conditions of his home. His greatest wish is to gradually improve his home and have employment stability to reach his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Humberto Andres

texts.es: Humberto tiene 47 años, está casado ambos tienen 2 hijos que viven en su hogar. Todos los días desde muy temprano se levanta para realizar su trabajo que es el destace de cerdo. Hace 9 años tiene este negocio por lo que ha sido muy importante ya que ha sido con este negocio tan humilde que él ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Realizar este trabajo es lo que le agrada es por ello que quiere realizar este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria como es cerdos, pues es su producto principal para su negocio. El sueña con que su hija logre finalizar sus estudios universitarios y que se haga cargo del negocio para que pueda mantener en el futuro.
texts.en: Humberto is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children who live at home with him. Early morning everyday he wakes up and cuts pork. For the past years this job has been very important since with such a humble job he was able to support his family. To be able to work is what appeals to him which is why he wants to receive the loan to buy the necessary materials such as pigs, since they are the main product for his business. He dreams for his daughter to graduate from her  university and be able to take over the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen K. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. Mrs. Phen K. is now married and has five school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops.

 Mrs. Phen K. planted rice and vegetable crops three months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and insecticides for her crops.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N.  lives in Ntinda the neighbourhood of Kampala city.   She is a single mother of four children  and only one of her children is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members ( 3 grand childrten ).  Mary has a business of  frying samosas and chapats.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.    

Mary   sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.   Mary has requested for a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of cooking oil and baking flour.     She also generates additional income through renting rooms. 

The main business challenges for Mary include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also start buying raw materials in bulk.   

Mary lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
M. has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a butcher by profession and runs a butcher shop in the market. From his shop, he sells chicken meat to his clients and earns money. With the loan, he will buy chickens so he can sell more fresh, quality meat. He will also buy a sharp knife for the butchering. M. is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
M.'s husband has worked as a butcher for over 15 years and is the only breadwinner in the family. M. is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and that her family will be better off financially. 

M. has given birth to 2 sons. Her elder son is in the first grade, while the younger is only 4 years old and has not start attending school yet. She is the resident of an area called 34-WB, which is located in a small city called Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living there since her marriage. She prefers to stay at home, manages the household chores  and takes care of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens for a butcher shop

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo Q. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 60 years old. Cirilo is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Cirilo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Cirilo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cirilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Cirilo is requesting a new loan of 29000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Cirilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is a 37-year-old married woman living in Baalbeck with her husband and four children. Rabia has been the owner of a baby clothes shop since 2003. This shop was a challenge for her because, like many men in this region, her husband was refusing the idea of letting his wife start a business of her own. Rabia is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her baby collection for the holiday season. Rabia is proud of what she has achieved and willing to expand her business and prove herself even more to her husband and relatives.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Alma is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 23 years old while the youngest is only four. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. One of Alma's dreams is to see all her children finish college and have bright futures.

Alma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alma is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina V. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Gina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Boldoo

texts.en:
Boldoo, 38, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land they have owned for the past 10 years. His wife works as a distributor for a popular cosmetic company and his three children all attend a local school. 

Boldoo began a car repair business in 2000 and a welding business in 2008. He makes stoves for houses and gers on order. Now he has an inventory of 600,000 MNT that he uses to make the stoves. As a long time business owner, he has many regular customers. In the summer, he goes to the countryside and offers his service to the those people who live far from the city center.  

Boldoo is a hardworking and active person who says, "I am planning to have my own workshop in the future where I can operate my business consistently".  He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more materials for his stove making business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for stove making business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying meat, cold drinks, clothes, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jay Anthony

texts.en:
Jay Anthony M. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old. Jay Anthony is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Jay Anthony owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Jay Anthony has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jay Anthony joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay Anthony has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide service. Jay Anthony is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jay Anthony from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the transport service.

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Madame  Sali Koné est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame  à Koutiala Darsalam II.   
Pour des raisons sociales, Madame Sali n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui justifie son intégration dans le commerce qu’elle a appris auprès de sa mère depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle s’est intéressée  à la vente d’articles divers  depuis 11 ans. 
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Madame Sali a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour atteindre ses objectifs.  Après  2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement elle est à son  deuxième prêt individuel, le premier a été bien remboursé. 
Elle compte améliorer ses stocks de  marchandises et ses ventes, avec ce prêt, en achetant une importante quantité de chaussures, de tissus ; de tasses,  etc.  
Elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte, au comptant et à crédit.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Ms. Sali Koné is 39 years old, married and a mother of 5 children.  She lives in a polygamous family in Koutiala Darsalam II.

Social factors prevented Ms. Sali from being able to go to school, which led to her becoming part of the business she learned from her mother at a young age.  Eleven years ago, after running several businesses unsuccessfully, she became interested in the sale of a range of various items.

Aiming to grow her business and meet her customers’ demand, Ms. Sali decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help her meet her goals.  She is currently on her second individual loan, having participated in two group loans, both fully reimbursed, and a first individual loan, also reimbursed.

She plans on using this loan to increase her inventory and sales, by buying a bulk quantity of shoes, fabric, cups, etc.

She buys supplies at Cotonou and sells them in the town of Koutiala to a diverse clientele, for cash or on credit.  She is aiming for monthly profits of 120,000 CFA francs, which she will use to reimburse her loan and contribute to her family’s daily needs, with the rest going towards continuing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items for inventory

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia R. C., de 54 años de edad, habita en casa propia con sus tres hijos, uno de los cuales se encuentra estudiando y los otros dos trabajan y ya empiezan a colaborar con los gastos de la casa. Lidia es una mujer trabajadora que durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado con mucha fuerza para sacar adelante a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en mercado mas grande de Mayoreo en El Salvador: La Tiendona, ubicado en el Municipio de San Salvador, capital del país y del Departamento del mismo nombre. Este negocio ha sido y sigue siendo su única fuente de ingresos por lo que desea seguir manteniéndolo activo, para poder brindar  el estudio a su  hijo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia. Con una visión emprendedora como toda mujer ha decidido dar un paso más en el mundo de los negocios. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder ampliar su negocio y poder tener acceso a mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras(Bananas, manzanas, piñas, rábanos, zanahorias, cebollas, remolachas y lechugas), para ofrecer a sus clientes que siempre le están demandando cada vez más,  ya que ella se preocupa por  mantener calidad, frescura y bue precio en los productos que ofrece. Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.
texts.en:
Lidia R. C., 54, lives in her own house with her three children.  One of them is in school and the other two work and have started to contribute to household expenses.  Lidia is a hard working woman who has worked very hard for a long time to support her family.  She sells fruit and vegetables in El Salvador’s largest wholesale market: La Tiendona, located in San Salvador, the nation’s capital, and in the Department of the same name.  This business has been and continues to be her only source of income so she wants to keep it operational to provide her son with schooling and improve the entire family’s living conditions.

With an enterprising vision like most women she has decided to take another step in the world of business and has decided to take out a loan with INTEGRAL to expand her business and have access to a greater variety of fruit and vegetables (bananas, apples, pineapples, radishes, carrots, onions, beets and lettuce) to offer her customers who always demand more each time since she always strives to have quality, freshness and good prices in the products she stocks.  She hopes this will lead to improved quality of life for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, pineapples, carrots, onions, beets and lettuce.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She and her husband till their land to plant rice crops. Nilda also grows pigs and goats. Nilda fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Nilda has requested a loan to purchase six piglets, feeds and farm fertilizers.

Nilda is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 25 years old.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets, feeds and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Teresa Ysmenia

texts.es:
Teresa es una señora de 52  años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Illimo en Lambayeque. Illimo es una comunidad rural pequeña, cuya actividad principal es la ganadería y agricultura.

Teresa es una mujer trabajadora, que quiere superarse, es por eso que realiza dos labores. La primera es la venta de animales. Teresa se dedica a criar aves de corral (pavos y gallinas) las cuales luego comercializa en el distrito de Túcume, que queda a 20 minutos de Illimo. La segunda labor que Teresa realiza es la venta de comestibles en una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio. Teresa cuenta con bastante clientela debido a que es la única bodega en la zona.

Teresa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que repartirá entre sus dos labores. Ella desea comprar animales y surtir su tienda comprando nuevas marcas de los productos que vende.

Teresa se dedica desde hace 5 años a estas actividades y desea expandir ambos negocios, para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 52 year old woman. She lives with her husband in ahouse located in the district of Illimo in Lambayeque. Illimo is a small rural community whose main activity is cattle raising and farming.  

Teresa is a hard working woman who wants to get ahead, and that is why she does two jobs. The first is selling animals. Teresa raises penned birds (turkeys and chickens), which she sells in the district of  Túcume, which is 20 minutes from Illimo. Teresa's second job is selling groceries frm a small store located in her house. She has a lot od customers, since she is the only store in the area.  

Teresa is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which she will divide between the two jobs. She wants to buy animals and supply her store, buying new brands of the products she sells.  

Teresa has been doing these activities for 5 years and wants to expand both businesses in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and supply her store.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia es propietaria D. L. tienda "Supertienda L. reforma" en el barrio L. Pradera, que desD. hace 3 años funciona en un  local  alquilado; elL.  vive con su esposo  y una D. sus hijas , pues su hija  mayor está casada e independiente.  Su actividad comercial L. inicio viviendo en Bogotá donD.  montó una refresquería en compañía D. su esposo, pero decidió radicarse en su tierra,  BarranquilL.,  para emprender desD. allí una nueva microempresa con los ahorros que trajo; así fue como  adquirió todos sus enseres para iniciar su tienda y L. adecuó con L.  infraestructura necesaria para este tipo D. negocio; elL. maneja un buen nivel D. ventas y un surtido con variedad y calidad. Su esposo además es comerciante independiente D. mercancías variadas, las cuales distribuye entre clientes fijos y ocasionales. Este es su primer financiamiento con L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías como papelería, cosméticos, accesorios y en general artículos D. miscelánea,  preparándose para estar surtida con motivo D. L. celebración del día del padre, época en L. cual sus ventas se incrementan, porque sus clientes reconocen que en el negocio D. Claudia encuentran lo que necesitan y a un buen precio. Su sueño es fortalecer el bienestar D. su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades D. 6 y 19 años, con los que sueña apoyarlos en L. construcción D. un futuro exitoso y esto es justamente L. motivación D. su trabajo en compañia D. su esposo..
texts.en:
Claudia owns the store, “Supertienda L. Reforma” in the L. Pradera neighborhood.  It’s been operating for the last three years in a leased locale.  She lives with her husband and one of her daughters because her eldest daughter is married and independent.

She started her commercial activity while still living in Bogotá where she set up a snack bar with her husband but she decided to move back to her native city, BarranquilL., to start a new enterprise there with the savings she brought.  This is how she acquired all the fixtures to open her store and she equipped it with the necessary infrastructure for this type of business.  Her sales are good and she stocks a wiD. variety of quality items.  Her husband too is an independent merchant of miscellaneous merchandise that he sells to both regular and occasional customers.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy merchandise like: stationery items, cosmetics, accessories and in general, miscellaneous articles to be stocked and ready for Father’s Day which is a time when sales increase because customers recognize that they will find what they need at good prices in Claudia’s store.

Her dream is to strengthen the wellbeing of her family which is composed of her husband and two children who are 6 and 19 years of age.  She dreams with helping them to build a successful future and this is precisely the motivation behind her work in partnership with her husband.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alislam

texts.en:
Alislam is 47 years old.  He lives in Absheron region with his family.  He is married and has 2 children. 

For the last five years, Alislam has been working in animal farming.  He raises cattle.  Now he needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy more cows to improve his business.  He also makes cheese to sell.  He learned this business from his father who also worked in animal farming.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Chrisphine

texts.en:
Chrisphine is 39 years old. He is married and is blessed with 10 children between 2 and 16 years old. He has been selling small fish (omena) for 18 years. He supplements his earnings from his rental houses. In the next five years, he wants to be a wholesaler and supplier of fish in his local community, and he hopes and dreams that he will be able to open up several outlets and own several big shops. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for boosting his business financially and for the managerial advices that has enabled him to run his business effectively and efficiently.

He wants 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy small fish (omena).

loans.use: to buy small fish.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego is married and has 6 children. He is 42 years old and lives in Aloran. Diego has operated a general store for 8 years. He sells a variety of products and earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Diego has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for his general store. Diego has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Join Hands Group

texts.en:
We are pleased to introduce to you the “Join Hands” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Bintu. She is 46 years old and was born in Kailahun, but currently resides in Kenema. She lives with her husband, a trader, and 4 children, 3 of whom attend primary and secondary schools. Bintu has been in business for 20 years. She sells palm oil, the country’s most favorite cooking oil. With her share of the loan, Bintu is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira, 40, is the leader of this group. In Toktogul, a small northern town in Kyrgyzstan, Gulmira worked for almost 20 years as a medical worker saving human lives. But now she is an experienced doctor and a mother of six children. The 40-year-old widow speaks in a cheerful voice of how delighted she was to try out a sphere other than medicine. Six years ago, when she found herself to be the only breadwinner in the family, Gulmira started a new business: breeding cattle. She went to a local cattle yard and bought a young calf for 6,000 soms. After a while, the cattle grew and she resold it at a higher price. Soon the business turned out to be quite profitable, so that Gulmira received 4,000 soms of profit while still working in a hospital. The purpose of Gulmira’s loan is to purchase more cattle to resell.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia a sus 41 años sigue trabajando de manera dura. Ella comparte su vida a lado de sus 5 hijos. Desde su niñez aprendió a tejer diversos puntos a mano, actividad que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Por otro lado también se dedica al bordado, por lo que elabora dos chompas por semana. Sin embargo, la cantidad de pedidos que tiene son de comerciantes mayoristas, por ello necesita producir más de lo que normalmente elabora. Ante esto debe contratar 4 señoras, quienes la ayudaran a terminar la cantidad de prendas de necesita. Por otro lado posee una tienda de abarrotes, en donde también ofrece el servicio de llamadas locales e internacionales. Delia disfruta de lo que hace porque le agrada y porque además es una actividad rentable. Su deseo es producir más chompas pero para ello requiere un crecimiento de capital para comprar más  cantidad de lana. En su quinta solicitud de crédito que tiene con MFP, tiene una grata experiencia de trabajo con su banco comunal porque cada uno de sus integrantes son personas responsables en sus pagos que han demostrado ser confiables y por esta razón seguirá solicitando créditos para el crecimiento de su negocio. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales para estar  bien abastecida, como lana e hilos de diversos colores y calidades.
texts.en: Delia, 41, is still working hard.  She shares her life with her 5 children.  She learned to knit when she was just a girl and she now operates a business making and selling knitted pieces, a business that's become her main source of income.  She also does embroidery work, embroidering and selling two sweaters per week.  The orders she has now are from retailers so she needs to produce more than she normally does.  She has to hire 4 women who will help her finish the extra pieces.  Delia also operates a grocery business where, among other things, she sells local and international phone services.  She likes the businesses because the work is pleasant and they generate a good income.  Her goal is to make more sweaters but she needs more working capital for the extra wool she needs.  This is her fifth MFP loan.  She likes her community bank because all of the members have confidence in her and, as a consequence, she can continue to borrow the money she needs to expand her business.  She will use this loan to buy materials--wool and threads of various quality and colors--to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Señor Rodolfo es de Ciudad del Este, está casado con la Señora Ramona hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos menores los cuales van a la escuela. 
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados, además de los ahorros que tienen. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, que día a día concurren hasta su negocio, esto le genera muy buenos ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en su local. El trabajo que realiza es por darle a su familia lo mejor, para que sus hijos no tengan privaciones.
En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, jabones, y otros. El ya tuvo otros créditos con Fundación Paraguaya y los cumplió en forma excelente. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que se le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo and his wife, Sra. Ramona, have lived in Ciudad del Este for several years.  They have 4 young children, all in school.  
Rodolfo and Ramona operate a general store in a room of their house, in a neighborhood with a lot of foot traffic.  The started the business with their own money, saved from jobs that they had before.  Rodolfo says that they have a lot of customers who come to the store day in and day out.  He's pleased with the progress of the business and wants to grow it.  He works to support his family and provide them with a better life.  He doesn't want his children to go without anything that they might need.  
Rodolfo will use the loan to buy merchandise for the business: sugar, rice, soap, etc.  He has borrowed from Fundacion Paraguaya twice before and has an excellent payment record.  He is grateful for this loan because it will help his business a lot.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Elba Lucila

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elba, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y la menor de  9 años, dos de sus hijos viven con ella y estudian en  colegio y  escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga y su esposo tienen un taller de artesanía, allí ellos fabrican  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elaboran  en barro o en cerámica, trabajan todos los días por que la demanda de sus productos es muy grande, ellos entregan sus productos semiterminados y con lindos acabados a comerciantes de su localidad y también entregan a comerciantes que llegan de otras ciudades hasta su taller. Nos cuenta que esta es una labor muy bonita porque sus obras son muy apreciadas en muchos lugares del país y fuera de él. Llevan más de 10 años dedicadas a esta labor y les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arcilla, esmaltes, pinceles, moldes y otros materiales para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el Banco. 

Sus metas son seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro de la Mujer Communal Bank meets every fifteen days at La Pila, in the canton of Montecristi.  This place is well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture.  Here, a huge variety of craftwork made by local residents following traditional customs can be found.

It was here that we met Elba.  She is 43 years old, married, and has four children with her husband, three who are adults, with the youngest being 9 years old.  Two of her children live with her and attend school.  Her husband is an artisan.

Our friend and her husband have a craftwork studio where they make all kinds of figures out of clay or ceramic.  They work every day because their products are in very high demand.  They turn over their products partially finished and with beautiful finishes to local merchants as well as to merchants who come to their studio from other cities.  They tell us that theirs is a wonderful kind of work because their pieces are valued in many parts of the country and beyond.  They have been doing this work for over ten years and it has gone very well for them.

This loan is to buy clay, glazes, paintbrushes, molds, and other materials to make their products.  She has been in the communal bank for six years and likes it because of the help the bank gives her.

Her goal is to keep increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy clay, glazes, paintbrushes, molds, and other materials

loans.name: Abselmina

texts.en:
Abselmina is widowed with no children. Abselmina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Abselmina is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice plantation.

Abselmina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Abselmina hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Senani

texts.ru:
Senani uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
Senani yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fzuuli regione, posolok Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Senani rodilsya v 1956 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey.
texts.en: Senani has been involved in animal husbandry for nine years and breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity available for sale.  Senani is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bala Bakhmanli village of the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Senani was born in 1956.  He is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 45 years old, married to Mary and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this is his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

In future, James hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a hard-working business woman. She is 37 and married. She has been running a grocery business for the last three years to earn a living. Eunice employs one person to assist her in managing the business. Her potential customers are those passing by. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes and vegetables for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage the business with her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор мать троих детей, замужем. Она любит свою семью и старается  улучшить благосостояние. Она занимается откормом скота. От продажи скота имеет большие доходы. Она старается создать все условия для дома. Она хочет получить займ  для достройки веранды, штукатурки, проведения отопительной системы и ремонта двух комнат в размере 9400 сомони. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Zulkhumor is a mother of three children, she is married. She loves her family and tries to improve their well-being. She feeds cattle and has a big profit from selling the cattle. She tries to create good conditions for the home. Zulkhumor wants to get a loan in the amount of 9400 somoni to build a porch, put plaster, install heating equipment and repair two rooms. She hopes to get the loan and is thanking everyone in advance.

loans.use: to build a porch, put plaster, install heating equipment and repair two rooms

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem, 40, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Yem sells fertilizer, and her husband is a taxi driver. Yem is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase medicine to cure animals for the farmers in her village. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy medicine to cure animals for the farmers in her village.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: La señora Apolonia es Casada tiene tres hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella, cuenta con un negocio en el cual vende, frituras, galletas, dulces, productos enlatados, productos lácteos, frutas y verduras, artículos escolares, regalos y más ella tiene siete años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la casa donde ella vive con su familia. Apolonia es una buena esposa y buena madre que ha buscado la manera de organizarse para elaborar las tareas del hogar como lo son el cuidado de los hijos, lavar, planchar, limpiar la casa y cocinar y al mismo tiempo brindar un trato amable a sus clientes y teniendo siempre los productos que ellos necesitan,  la señora Apolonia requiere el apoyo para compra de mercancía para la temporada navideña como lo son Juguetes, Carbon, Refrescos, Platos y Vasos desechables, Servilletas y mas y agradece de antemano a cada uno de los inversionistas que le apoyen en la inversión a su negocio.
texts.en:
Apolonia is married, and has three children who still depend on her financially. She has a business where she sells fried snacks, cookies, candy, canned goods, dairy products, fruits and vegetables, school supplies, gifts, and more. 

She has been in this business for seven years, and it is located in the house where she lives with her family. Apolonia is a good wife and mother, who has looked for a way of arranging it so that she can do housework, such as looking after the children, washing, ironing, cleaning the house, and cooking, and at the same time give her customers friendly service, and always have the products they need.  

Apolonia needs the loan to buy merchandise for the Christmas season, such as toys, charcoal, soft drinks, disposable cups and plates, napkins, and more. She is grateful in advance to each of the lenders who support her investment in her business.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her business.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima was born in 1957 in Vazashen village, in the Tavush area. Now she and her family live in Ijevan city. Rima is married and has two sons. One of her sons is married and lives separately from his parents. Rima’s husband goes to Russia for seasonal work once a year.
Rima and her son who lives with parents have run their own trading business since 2000. In their shop they sell food, beverages and household goods. Rima’s business helps her to meet her family’s needs for the most part. 
In advance of New Year’s holiday, Rima intends to diversify her shop's assortment of goods, so she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large quantity of sweets, sugar, flour, butter, juice and household goods to resell. 
This is Rima’s third loan from Kiva partner Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sweets, sugar, flour, butter, juice and different household goods to resell.

loans.name: Jessica Milagros Group

texts.es:
22 mujeres de la ciudad de Itá se unieron con el propósito de buscar un mayor bienestar para sus familias. Estas mujeres son personas muy luchadoras y sacrificadas, quienes empiezan sus jornadas de trabajo a muy tempranas horas del día volviendo ya muy entrada la noche. Ellas se encuentran actualmente en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de las miembros es la señora Rosalba, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de helados. Este es un negocio que le trae muy buenas ganancias, en especial en los días de mucho calor. Ella comenta que mediante mucho esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar a cubrir los gastos de la familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de helados de todo los sabores, pues se acerca el calor y quiere poder cumplir con la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
22 women of the city of Itá came together with the goal of searching for better well-being for their families. These women are people who fight and sacrifice, who start their days very early and return home very late at night. They currently find themselves in the fourth cycle of the foundation's program for entrepreneurial women.

One of the members is Rosalba, who tells us that she sells ice cream. This business brings her a very good income, especially on very hot days. She says that through much hard work, she has been able to move her family forward and help to cover the family's expenses. 

She is asking for the loan to purchase ice cream of all flavors, since the hot weather is coming and she wants to be able to meet the demand.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream to sell later

loans.name: Rosa Cecilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, vive con su esposo y tres hijos en el suburbio de Guayaquil zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Debido a que se caso muy joven y su situación económica no era tan buena ella invirtió  sus ahorros en víveres de primera necesidad para tener su propia tienda. Comenzaron la tienda con algunos víveres y a pasar más tiempo con ayuda de su hijo ayer y esposo pudieron surtirla. En la actualidad tiene en su tienda con lácteos, frutas, granos, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h30. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener una tienda más grande para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old, she has a small general store, she lives with her husband and three children and they live in the suburb of Guayaquil, an area known for housing many small business owners. 

Since she married very young and her economic situation was not very good, Rosa invested her savings in basic necessities in order to open up her own store.  They began the store with some basic food items and over time with the help of her son and her husband they were able to stock the store.  Currently she has a general store with dairy products, fruit, grains, drinks etc.  She works from 6:30am to 8:30pm.

With the loan Rosa wants to buy rice, canned goods, and drinks for her store.  In the future she wants to finish building her house and to have a larger store in order to ensure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and canned goods

loans.name: Kivanga

texts.en:
Kivanga is 53 years old. He is married to Regina and they are blessed with six children. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

After being introduced by an existing KADET customer, he is applying for his first loan of with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000. He will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Ayedah

texts.en: Ayedah is a 37 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for blankets from Aqaba to sell in her area. In the future she wants to re-do a room in her home specifically for selling her products and she hopes to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for blankets to sell

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a motor vehicle repair business where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy spare parts and other tools for repairing vehicles. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other tools for repairing vehicles.

texts.es:
Marileny es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, de buen trato al cliente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘el Torno’; área rural caracterizada por agrupar a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de repartir esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21/35 grados centígrados.
Marileny es de tez morena, cabello negro lo usa corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie, la tercera de la izquierda, viste una solera azul y short azul). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de empanadas, venta de frutas, librería, fotocopiadora, venta de flores, comercio de ropa infantil, venta de jugos, venta de verduras y limpieza de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), majao encapao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros. Actividad que realiza 2 veces al día para la hora de almuerzo y para la hora de cena. “inicié mi actividad por la necesidad de cocinar para mis hijos, amplié mi negocio con un préstamo y necesito continuar ampliándolo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la buena aceptación por parte de los clientes que son continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante para obtener mejores ingresos y costear los gastos de sus hijos sin problemas, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de utensilios de cocina como; cubiertos, ollas, sartenes, y otros para continuar desarrollando su actividad en mejores condiciones. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marileny solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina para abrir un restaurante.

loans.use: para la compra de utensilios de cocina para abrir un restaurante.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Born in 1977 at Tchêkpo, Madam Ama G. was set at Tsévié for 10 years for her activities of bread selling. She is a single with a child she got while going to school at form 2. The child doesn’t even know his father as the later has left the town before the birth of the child and is never turned back. Before that situation and to show her dependence toward her parents, she has started to sell bread thank to a credit of $100 got and entirely repaid. What will allow her to rent a room that and develop her activities. To develop and increase her activities, Madam Ama G. requests a credit of $850 to buy and sell wheat flour for bread fabrication. This project that she could well manage and make profitable will help her to increase her incomes in order to improve her living condition and her children well being.

Née en 1977 à Tchékpo, Madame G. Ama s’est installée depuis plus de 10 ans à Tsévié pour ses activités de vente de pain. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant qu’elle avait eu sur les bancs d’école en classe de 5ème. L’enfant ne connaît même pas son père car ce dernier a quitté la ville avant même sa naissance et n’y est plus retourné. Face à cette situation et pour marquer son indépendance vis-à-vis de ses parents, elle commença par vendre du pain grâce à un crédit de $100 obtenu et entièrement remboursé. Ce qui lui a permis de louer une chambre et de développer ses activités. Pour diversifier et accroître ses activités, Madame G. Ama sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter et vendre de la farine de blé servant à la fabrication du pain. Ce projet qu’elle pourra bien gérer et rentabiliser lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et le bien-être de son enfant.

loans.use: to buy and sell wheat flour for bread fabrication

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Madame Julie is a single parent of two(2) children who walks to nearby towns and villages to buy vegetables and other foodstuffs to sell at the market. She requires a loan of $650 to expand her business and look after her children. She is familiar with Kraban Support Foundation's TEACH Lending program. She is also good at keeping records.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a young man who has a small mini-market in his house. One year ago, he used part of his house and built his new shop. Now he is applying to get $1200 from Al-Aman to buy goods for his shop. He lives with his old mother and his wife , who is expecting a child next month.

He wants to attract more customers to his shop, which is in one of the most popular areas in Kirkuk. He is confident to succeed in his work, increase his income, and enhance his life and that of his family.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Hi! My name is Sonia Maria E.. I have a small business where I sell clothes in the streets of my city called San Lorenzo. I've had my business for about one and a half year. I have been able to help my family pay for food expenses and medications. I'm requesting your assistance in helping me purchase more clothes to sell since I want to provide good customer service. I greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola, Me llamo Sonia Maria E., yo tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa en la calles de mi cuidad San Lorenzo. Este negocio lo tengo hace un año y medio. Con este negocio he podido ayudar mi familia para gastos de alimentacion y medicamentos. Ahora necesito si me puden ayudar a comprar mas ropa ya que tengo que dar un buen servicio a mis clientes. Le agradecere mucho su ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase shorts, shirts, jeans, hats, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Afiafiese

texts.en: Thirty-eight year old Afiafiese from Vailele has succeeded in offering the local school in her village her ice cake service, and satisfying her community's needs. She’s a mother of six children, four in school, and two young ones. She works hard 5 days a week from Monday to Friday on her ice cake business. She earns $20 a day, and this helps her sons go to school and also with her loan repayment. Her husband works at the National Bank and he is helping them with their family's needs. She plans to use her next loan to expand her business and also to improve their home.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials

loans.name: Victricia

texts.en:
Mrs. Victricia I., 62 years old, lives with her five children in the neighborhood of Pablo Sexto in the town of Santa Rosa Misiones, Paraguay. The family is dedicated to growing vegetables, which include onions, radishes, parsley, carrots, cassava and corn. Each of these products is sold by Victricia or one of her children. They sell them in the town center or in other towns around their home. By traveling outside their home city they are able to earn more money and sell at better prices. The money earned from the vegetables will go toward education, a cause that Victricia very much believes in.

She has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers in greater quantities, which will allow the family to increase their output. The additional crops will also ensure the economic prosperity of the family in years to come.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers in greater quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction of front brick wall

loans.name: Ocheng A (I) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Allen is 41 years old. She is a single mother of four children and six dependants. She has a vegetable business. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To stock more fruits and thus enlarge her business

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
Azam K. is 24 years old. He is not married yet, however, living with his parents he is the main bread-winner for them.

Azam has a minivan and provides transportation services for passengers within the city of Khujand. He has been in this business for 2 years. Initially, he rented the minivan, but over time he saved enough to buy his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main income for Azam’s family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

Azam needs to purchase spare parts and pay for the repair of the minivan. Therefore, he is requesting 400.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. This is the first loan for Azam and he would like to thank everyone for their trust and promises not to let anyone down.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and repair minivan

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
I have a general store in my house. I mind the store all day, and my son and I live off of its profits. I am a single mother and have always liked to work and get ahead in life. I have had my store for a year and a half now, and I thank God that everything has gone well. I intend to invest in the purchase of deli meats because my customers have requested them, but I have not been able to meet their demands due to lack of funds. I am requesting $500.00 USD to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una tienda de abarrotes en mi casa, la atiendo todo el día y de ahí vivimos mi hijo y yo, soy madre soltera y siempre me ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante, ya tengo 1 año y medio con mi tienda y gracias a dios me ha ido bien, tengo la intención de invertir en la compra de carnes frías ya que mis clientes me lo has solicitado pero yo no he podido por falta de dinero para la inversión Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in my business

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn R., age 43, is the mother of three children and works as farmer growing rice on her farmland. On average, she earns around $1 a day of profit. All of the children help their parents work.

Her husband, Mr. Moun Pha, 45 years old, is a worker. He is usually hired by villagers to harvest their rice and, normally, he makes about $4 a day in revenue.

This couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a small truck. They will rent this truck hire to the villagers to transport their rice.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck.

loans.name: Odengero Jua Kali Group

texts.en:
Lawrence M. is a young Kenyan father, aged 36, with three children. He also lives with the two orphaned children of his late brother, who perished a year ago.

Lawrence started his business four years ago after accumulating savings from an informal rotating savings fund that his group had. (This is commonly referred to as “merry go round.") His business is located in the municipality market. His clients are mostly people from the neighborhood who give him furniture orders. Lawrence uses the profits from his business to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the help of his loan, he'll be able to purchase timber in bulk to make more furniture for his regular clients and increase his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Lawrence would purchase timber in bulk with his portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Malin

texts.en:
Mrs. Malin K., 26, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Sek, 29, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2002 and have three children; one is in school and the other two stay at home.

Mrs. Malin has been a cleaner for over five years at a restaurant in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sopheap has been a security guard for over five years at a restaurant in Phnom Penh as well. Both of them travel to work on their old motorbike.  Now they need to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one.

So, Malin is requesting a loan of US$500 to add to her own money for purchasing a new motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Faalele

texts.en: Faalele F., 70, is married with 7 children. She has 5 years of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the villagers/public 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Faalele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. tThis will help her to be able to buy for her business needs.

loans.use: Purchase plastic cups, concentrated flavors, sugar

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Victor D..  I work as a taxi cab driver in the city of Danli, El Paraiso.  My car is in good condition aside from needing a new paint job and new tires (the ones in use currently are very worn).  I'm doing my best to give the best service to my clients.

I have been working at this job for 5 years now and it has provided me with a good income and with this income I have been able to support my family.

For this reason I am requesting help to be able to get maintenance for my car as it is my only source of income.

Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.


hola mi nombre es Victor D., me dedico al servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Danli, El Paraiso, tengo mi carro en muy buen estado, en estos momentos lo que necesita mi automovil es un pintado general y comprar llantas ya que las que tiene estan gastadas, esto lo estoy haciendo para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes.
tengo 5 años de dedicarme a esta actividad la cual me deja muy buenos ingresos y con estos ingresos salimos adelante con mi familia.
por tal razon estoy solicitando ayuda para poder darle mantenimiento a mi automovil que es mi unica fuente de ingresos,
gracias

loans.use: To purchase paint and tires.

loans.name: Mwanakombo's Tuwe Macho Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 32 years old. She is a widow with 2 children aged 12 and 9 years old. She is a charcoal and clothes seller. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Mwanakombo is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Latifa.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi K., 30, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the Ice cake and Pancake business. She sells to the villagers and the public seven days per week.

Naomi has had three previous loans with SPBD. She will use the money earned to purchase plastic cups, sack of sugar, koolaid, sack of flour and a gallon of cooking oil to improve her business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~83 USD). SPBD loans are Naomi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is helping her operating the business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic cups, sack of sugar, koolaid, sack of flour and a gallon of cooking oil

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Хакназарова Фотима проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет , замужем и   имеет четверых детей. Работает на рынке Дехкон. Имеет торговую точку , где торгует одеждой . Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima H. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She works at the Dehkon market where she sells clothing at a market stall. To expand her inventory Fotima would like to apply for this loan which she is planning to pay back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
M. Dilorom is 46 years old and is married. She uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education. 

Dilorom has a five years of experience preparing and selling dried apricots. She consistently makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, so her clients are always very happy with the service they receive. 

Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Dilorom requests 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the repayment term of 12 months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase dried apricots with the purpose to increase the range of her goods. With your help, this will be possible. Dilorom expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Reung

texts.en:
Reung L., 62, is a rice farmer in Samrong Village in Banteay Meanchey Province. She is married with four children; one of them is married and three are single. Her husband grows green beans for sale as vegetables to eat with porridge, Chinese noodles, and Khmer traditional food. His business has gone well and many customers come to buy green beans at his house.

L. and her husband work hard every day at their business to earn money to cover the family's expenses. Two of her children are studying toward their Bachelor's degree in Phnom Penh City, and one is employed as a guard for a private company. L. is always trying to provide the means for her children to graduate university.

Her children need a motorcycle and she lacks the money to buy it for them. Hence, she would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children who study in Phnom Penh to drive to school. (Her husband is pictured because she was not available at that time.)

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children

loans.name: Edmundo Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Edmundo Blass tiene la edad de 48 años habita en San Juan de la concepción, el  viudo tiene a su cargo un hijo varón de 18 años el cual le ayuda con el trabajo de agricultura, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida; desde hace veinte años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que esto a afectado la calidad de producción, el inicio por la necesidad de obtener recursos. Los planes hacia un futuro son mejor todas las condiciones a su finca. Don Edmundo solicita este préstamo para invertir en insumos agrícolas como: fertilizante, venenos  para poder vender bien su cosecha
texts.en:
