Mr Edmundo Blass is 48 years old and lives in San Juan de la Concepcíon. He is a widow and is responsible for his 18 year-old son, who helps him with his farming business. His plan is to improve the quality of life for him and his son. He has dedicated the last 20 years of his life to his farming business and the greatest difficulty for him has been the lack of funds, the need of more resources from the beginning, which as a result, has affected the quality of his produce. His plan for the future is to improve the conditions of his farm. Mr Edmundo requests this loan so that he can invest in agricultural supplies, such as fertiliser and pesticides, which will enable him to sell better quality crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obuy agricultural supplies to increase production and sell crops at a better price

loans.name: Mahmand

texts.en:
This is Mahmand, son of Hazrat Gull. He is 35-years-old, married and the father of nine children. He lives in Nangarhar province Jalalabad city. He is uneducated but is a good farmer who has his own land in his village where he is growing different kinds of vegetables.

Mahmand has four sons and five daughters. His eldest son is a painter working in Kabul, and his second eldest son is a student in the fifth grade in the public school. He helps his father in his spare time. They live in a large house in the village. Mahmand wishes to buy a motorcar, seeds and other necessities for his land.

He needs 40000(AFN) in an individual loan and therefore he contacted the lenders of AFSG and requested this money for 27 months. He has his own capital (50000AFN) and he wants to include it with this loan to buy a motorcar so he bring vegetables easily to the bazaar. He thanks all lenders, KIVA and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcar, seeds and other necessary things for his land

loans.name: Dilion

texts.en:
This is Dilion R., and she is 33 years old. She has lived in the Cantemir district for more than 15 years, where she spent her childhood among her friends and family. She learned many things about agriculture from her father when she was young.

Her main business and plan for the future is growing vegetables and seeds. Dilion decided to request a loan from MicroInvest to increase her working capital after inheriting a large plot of land from her parents. R. has a good credit history at Microinvest, who has all the confidence in this customer.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Oneyda De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Oneyda E. con mucha alegría se dedica a su actividad económica de venta de ropa y cosméticos vendidos ambulantemente en su municipio donde a diario se esfuerza para salir adelante.

Actualmente la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los cosméticos y la ropa ya que actualmente se le han agotado y para ello espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce of the city of León, Mrs. Oneyda E. is dedicated, with great joy, to her business of clothing and cosmetics which she sells on foot in her municipality. Every day she strives to get ahead. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to ask for a loan for the purchase of cosmetics and clothing because now she has run out. She is waiting for her loan to be granted, and through this she will succeed in her business ,which requires your support to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Konaté est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de crème et aussi utiliser une partie du prêt pour essayer le commerce de pâte d’arachide. Elle aimerait avec ses revenus assurer les charges familiales (nourriture, santé, etc..)
texts.en:
Mariama Konaté is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She wants to bolster her business selling cream and also to use part of her loan to try commerce in peanut butter. With her revenues, she would like to ensure coverage of family expenses (food, health, etc.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cream, ice, and peanut butter

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is 54 years old, married to Romeo B., a carpenter. They have six children, all married. She is a business-minded woman and aside for her snacks vending also has livestock like pigs, ducks, and chickens in her backyard.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos for livestock feed and capital for her snacks vending business. Her businesses help her add to the income of her husband and meet the financial needs of her family. She's thankful to Paglaum and Kiva partners for the assistance to her businesses.

loans.use: Livestock feed and capital for snack vending business

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq A. is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his two beloved children the best. He carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 10 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase three cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he is requesting US $1500. Mushviq thanks you very much for your help.

loans.use: purchase three more calves

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is 34 years old and married to Vivian, his business partner in their photo copier shop located along Bachelor Street in Dubinan East Santiago City just in front of the University of La Salette, where most of their customers are teachers and students. They have been engaged in this business for almost eight years.

Since technology is becoming more advanced, Gerry is requesting a loan of PHP 50, 000 to buy materials and an upgraded Xerox machine. This loan will enable his business to grow and become more stable for the future of their children. He is hoping that his request will be granted.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Bachelor St. Dubinan East,Santiago City, Isabela

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is the guiding principle in the life of Catherine U.. She is married to Antonio, who is a wood carver. They reside in the village of Allinguigan 3rd of Ilagan, Isabela with their two children. With their combined income, they have been able to pay for their family's living expenses and to send their children to school.

Catherine operates a variety store and a vending stall in their village. She is now requesting a second loan, this time in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), for additional capital for her business. Catherine plans to purchase stocks of groceries for her store and for her vending stall business. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her request, and she thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing inventory

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim

loans.use: purchase more home furniture

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en: F. Gairat has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and two children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Gairat provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Gairat sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. His wife (pictured) helps him with taking care of and feeding his animals. Currently Gairat needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of 3,000 Somoni. He thanks Kiva for the support that it presents to small entrepreneurs. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more young cattle to raise

loans.name: Inacio Enoque

texts.pt:
Inácio Enoque M. de 45 anos de idade nasceu em Manjacaze, provincial de Gaza (terra do natal do Dr. Mondlane, obreiro da Unidade nacional) tem 45 anos de idade e é pai de 3 filhos maiores de idade e não frenquentam escola. Estudou ate 5 classe tendo parado por perca de vaga para continuar com os estudos.

Saiu de Manjacaze no ano de 1979 para Maputo e teve muitas saídas para as províncias de Gaza e Sofala, sozinho, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Mais tarde regressou a maputo, onde vive com sua família, seu tio e mais 3 sobrinhos sob sua responsabilidade.

Trabalha para uma empresa de segurança (DELTA, Segurança) a mais de 12 anos desempenhando as funções de supervisor e com o salário mensal de 2.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de empréstimos.
 
Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos, também clientes da instituição, e aproximou tendo desembolsado e empréstimos de 5.000,00MT; 7.200,00MT e 9.000,00MT que aplicou na construção da sua casa que vem edificando em fases. todos créditos foram reembolsados sem problemas.

 Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construção para dar continuidade com sua obra e compromete se a pagar sem problemas, como condição para poder aceder a outros empréstimos com objectivo de terminar a casa e mobilar.
texts.en:
Inácio Enoque M. is 45 years old. He was born in Manjacaze, province of Gaza (home town of Dr. Eduardo Mondlane, who served as the president of the Mozambican Liberation Front from 1962 until his assassination in 1969). He’s the father of 3 children, who already finished school. He finished up to 5th grade, when he had to drop out because he lost his scholarship. He left Manjacaze in 1979 to move to Maputo and he frequently traveled to the provinces of Gaza and Sofala, alone, looking for better life conditions. Later on, he returned to Maputo, where he now lives with his family, his uncle and 3 nephews he also takes care of. He’s worked on a surveillance company (DELTA, Segurança) for more than 12 years working as a supervisor with a monthly salary of 2,500.00MT, which he uses to support his family and to repay his loans. He met Hluvuku-Adsema through this friends, also members of the group, and he has repaid several loans of around 5,00.00MT; 7,200.00MT and 9,000.00MT which he used to make home improvements, as he’s building his home in different stages. All his loans were repaid without a problem. With this current loan of 10,000.00MT he would like to purchase construction materials to continue with his work and he is committed to repay it without any problems, as a condition to access to other loans that will help him finish his house and buy furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Gloria es soltera, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Gloria vende medicina natural que vende en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 2 veces por semana, también vende a pedido de casa en casa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Gloria son aumentar su negocio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Community Bank”Despertar”. She is 38 years old, single and has 3 children.

Gloria sells natural medicines at different fairs in the region, where she travels 2 times per week. She also sells door to door. Gloria needs a loan of $1025 that will be invested in the purchase of natural medicines.

Gloria’s dreams are to grow her business, start a new business and that her children graduate from school.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Zakaria Muiruri

texts.en:
Muiruri is a single man aged 25 years. He owns a retail shop at Nderi shopping centre and his customers are from the same location. He started the business two years ago.

He noticed that he needed to restock his shop and thus he enquired around and joined KADET. With no previous history of borrowing from another MFI, he applied for his first loan which he repaid well and on time. This will be his second loan and he plans to use it to restock his retail shop.

His hopes to own a wholesale business in future.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: adding stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi T. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Tiavea. She is married and has six school-aged children. Naomi's main source of income is her cattle-raising business. She has been raising cattle for over 7 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Naomi joined SPBD to access their financial services with the goal of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. For her first SPBD loan, Naomi is requesting 1000 WST, which she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She intends to use the additional revenue generated from the business for growth and expansion.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Tsagaan

texts.en: D. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and the youngest of three children in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two oldest children attend university away from home and his 15 year old daughter attends a local high school. D. and his wife operate a retail flour business in their town. They began the business six months ago and since then have been earning enough money to greatly improve their quality of life. D. and his wife travel to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase flour in bulk, then travel back to their province and sell the flour for a profit. He would eventually like to have his own local flour market in the province so that he and his wife could sell a larger amount of it. D. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to help him purchase a large amount of flour from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of flour from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta N. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married with 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta resells fruits like bananas, as well as managing a video karaoke in their village. Julieta earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Julieta recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP, so she can purchase additional products to sell and grow her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel B. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Madel is married and has three small children. To make a living, Madel owns and operates a business selling hot cake snacks in the local community. Madel has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $50 month from these activities.

In 2009, Madel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Madel is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for food making. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated expand her business and for family needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for food making

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
El señor Lucas R. Dávila, es una señor de 49 años de edad emprendedor de un negocio de joyería el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 15 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Barrio Ayapal Managua, al oeste de la capital Managua. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de oro y piedras preciosas, que se vende mucho en esta época del año debido a las promociones de estudiantes.

El es casado, con 3 hijos a su cargo 2 de ellos en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio el trabajaba como obrero de construcción.

Lleva 9 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando su mercadería, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Lucas R. Dávila is a 49 year old entrepreneur with a jewelry business. He started with C$10,000.00, which he acquired through a loan 15 years ago. His business is located in the Ayapal Managua neighborhood to the west of the capitol, Managua. The loan he is asking for is for work capital for his business. He will buy gold and precious stones, which he sells a lot of during this time of year because of the promotion of students. He is married, and he is raising three children. Two of them are school age. He says that before he had this business he worked as a construction worker. He has had nine loans over five years with Ceprodel. He used them to invest in his business. It has been growing, and he has been diversifying his merchandise. This is thanks to the loans given through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold and precious stones

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica G. es casada y madre de familia su esposo el señor Héctor Alejandro la apoya ya que son una familia muy unida y emprendedora, el labora para una empresa de seguridad medica y ella tiene establecido un negocio de nombre “Fiesta Fácil” donde realiza adornos de mesa para fiestas infantiles y además vende regalos para diferentes ocasiones;Para el cual esta tramitando este crédito ya que con las fiestas desembridas que están cercas desea comprar mercancía por mayoreo y obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Verónica G. is married and a mother. Her husband, Héctor Alejandro, supports her work efforts. They are a very unified, enterprising family. He works for a medical security firm and she has a business called "Fiesta Fácil” where she makes table decorations for children's parties. She also sells gift items for various occasions. This loan will be used to stock up on merchandise at wholesale because the end-of-year party season is near and higher profits are possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gift items.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marvin Antonio G. M., tiene 43 años de edad es casado y sus esposa se dedica  a la venta de mariscos, él trabaja en el cultivo del café  y por esta razón solicito este préstamo para poder comprar fertilizantes y fungicidas que le brinden un mejor mantenimiento a la cosecha del café, esto le beneficiaría por que podría vender a un buen precio la cosecha  del café, logrando a largo plazo los recursos necesarios para poder comprar un tramo en el mercado y así su esposa pueda instalar una pequeña tienda de mariscos esto les traería una fuente de trabajo mas segura, en donde les cambiaria sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Marvin Antonio G. M. is 43 years of age. He is married and his wife is dedicated to the sale of shellfish. He works in the cultivation of coffee and for this reason requests this loan to be able to buy fertilizers and fungicides to offer better maintenance to the coffee crop. This would benefit him because he would be able to sell the coffee crop for a good price, achieving the necessary resources to be able to purchase a place in the market. In this way his wife could build a small store for shellfish which would bring them a more secure source of income, which would change their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fungicides to improve his coffee crop.

loans.name: Vicentia

texts.en: Vicentia is married and the mother of four children, who are all in school. This twenty-seven-year-old woman lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. Vicentia works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a tie-dye and batik production businesswoman. She makes the designs and supplies them to retailers, as well as taking orders. Vicentia also sells at a table in the local market square. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bales of mercerized cotton, dyes, wax, and other working materials.

loans.use: To buy cotton, dyes, wax and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en: Ajoke is gifted in business. She has poultry and a fishpond. She is so happy that her business is expanding. She needs more expansion and she knows that KIVA lenders can help. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more poultry and fingerlings to raise and sell. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. She is 42 years old. She is happy because her children and business are excelling. She is looking forward to making use of this loan effectively. She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO).  LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and fingerlings.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny S. R., tiene la edad de 34 años, está casada, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 11, 12 y 8 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yorleny tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Yorleny S. R. is 34 and married. She has three children, and they are her greatest priority. They are 11, 12, and 8 years old. The loan that she wants is to buy some calves and to buy their food. She wants to give the livestock adequate maintenance in order to get the greatest earnings possible when she sells them. She also wants to increase the number of animals she has and be able to keep them in better conditions. She has a suitable area for the care and maintenance of the livestock. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She is very happy with the ease of payments that they provide. Yorleny has several years of experience with livestock. In the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to keep growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Segundo Dolores

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus cinco hijos en el sector Cruce los Becos, una zona rural y agrícola del distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace diez años tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, en ella Segundo ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad. El nos comenta que su negocio nació ante la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional que le permitiera sacar adelante a su familia, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

El negocio es de utilidad para los vecinos de la zona, ya que el sector en donde vive queda alejado del pueblo y, aunque hay mobilidad, la economía de los pobladores no les permite hacer viajes todos los dias. Segundo desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar su servicio, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo propuesto.

Segundo es un hombre honorable y muy estimado en la zona donde vive, actualmente tiene el cargo de Teniente Gobernador de la zona, que es una autoridad que representa a sus vecinos ante las autoridades del distrito. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 44-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two of his five children in the Cruce los Becos sector, a rural and agricultural area of the Mórrope district in the province of Lambayeque, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been running a small general store from home for 10 years, selling basic need items. Segundo states that his business was born out of the need to obtain an extra income to help his family get ahead, as he also works in agriculture. However, he does not have a steady income from the latter.

This business is very useful to the people in the area because it is far away from the city, and although there is transportation, the townspeople do not have the means to make trips into the city every single day. Segundo would like to expand his business so that he can improve customer service, which is why he is requesting a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help him reach his goal.

Segundo is a very honorable and esteemed man in the area. He is currently the Lieutenant Governor in the area, which means that he is an official who represents his neighbors before all the authorities in the district. He has previously worked with our institute, and has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need items to expand business

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Soy Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 10 people who live in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. Mrs. Channy S. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They each will use the loan for a different purpose. She is a pig breeder and a white wine maker to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Channy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She is a widow who lives with three children, all of whom are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in crates and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu K., a 29 year-old woman from 33, Old Railway Line, Tengbeh Town. Isatu is married with 2 daughters. The eldest is in primary school, year 6, and the youngest is in nursery school, year 1. Her spouse works as an engineer for Afro international.


Isatu sells pharmaceuticals and has been in this business for 5 years. She joined LAPO, SL in 2008 and, as a member of a LAPO union, she has received 4 different loans. She expanded her business and bought more stock to sell.


Isatu is asking for a loan of 2,500,000 Leones to enable her open a new outlet in addition to the one she already has. It is her dream to have several outlets across Freetown.

loans.use: to open another pharmaceutical outlet

loans.name: Amparo Maritza

texts.es: El prestatario se dedica a la venta de bocaditos y buffets desde hace 15 años teniendo como ingreso semanal S/. 160.00 nuevos soles; su modalidad de trabajo es vender afuera de su vivienda y reparte de algunos bocaditos durante el dia.El prestatario tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad los caules le ayudan en el negocio. El destino del prestamo es para incremento de capital, para la compra de insumos de la venta de bocaditos y empezar otro negocio de venta de productos de bellezas (natura); el prestatario tiene como meta consolidarse en su negocio y poseer su propia pasteleria.
texts.en:
The borrower sells snacks and buffets. She has been doing this for 15 years, and she has a weekly income of 160.00 soles. The way she works is selling outside of her house, and she delivers some snacks during the day. The borrower has two children. They are grown, and they help her in the business. The loan is to increase capital in order to buy supplies for her snack sales. It is also to start another business selling Natura beauty products. Her goal is to grow in her business and to have her own cake shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to buy supplies

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. is a single woman taking care of six dependents. She buys palm fruits and processes them into oil for sale in large quantities to her customers. She attended a commercial school where she learned how to cook our local foods and foods of other countries like Togo. 

Ama uses the profits she makes from her sales to provide the needs of her dependents.  Ama’s main purpose for taking the loan is to extend her palm oil production and also produce palm kernel oil for sale. She hopes to establish a small factory that will produce palm oil and palm kernel oil and if possible produce soap for sale.

loans.use: extend her palm oil production and also produce palm kernel oil for sale

loans.name: Rwamunyari Kwetungura Grp-Ibanda Group

texts.en:
It is now fifteen years since A. Charles started his farming business in Rwamunyari Cell, Ibanda, in Western Uganda. With this as his only means of livelihood, he has managed to make ends meet although with some long seasonal income fluctuations and high labor-cost challenges.

With hard work, this married and happy-go-lucky father of two children has kept his business growing. In a week, he makes 30,000 Ugandan shillings out of selling mostly bananas. His business plan of action for the future is to be able to sell more bananas out of his farm to an increasingly expanding market.

With this loan, Charles plans to purchase manure and fertilizer for his plantation. 

Charles is the man standing on the right in the front row raising his hand. The rest of the ladies with their hands raised belong to the group committee.

loans.use: To purchase high value manure and fertilizers for his plantation so that it can regain its fertility

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy P. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store, selling vegetables and different kinds of products for household needs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $300 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Jorgelina Agüero, quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar otro comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “María Auxiliadora” se encuentra trabajando dentro del quinto ciclo, y todas están muy contentas con el programas Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Marcelina quien se a dedica la confección de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.
Actualmente la señora Marcelina quiere hacer unas mejoras en su vivienda como en colocación de puertas y ventanas, y para concretar este proyecto ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de  los materiales y el pago por mano de obra.
texts.en:
Señora Jorgelina Agüero initiated the formation of this committee, contacting her neighbours and friends to form another committee in the zone. The committee is called "María Auxiliadora" and is in its fifth loan cycle. All the members are very happy with the programs in Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras and the group is known in the neighbourhood for being very united, supportive and responsible. One of the members is Marcelinam, who works making clothing for women, gentlemen and children. Marcelina wants to make some improvements to her home, including installing doors and windows, and to finish this project she is seeking a loan to purchase materials and pay for labour.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase doors and windows

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel P. A., tiene 20 años.  Es soltero y vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo.

Jose es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de  arroz, maíz y cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños tener una economía básica para sustentar a la familia. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta estudiar para sacar adelante a la familia.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel P. A. is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. He does not have children.

Jose is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are a total of 23 members, most of whom make their living by farming. This is the second loan they have requested with Cooperativa San José.

Jose is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and cacao. He buys each month in the city of Ventanas in Fertiza and at the Peña commercial market. His products are sold at the same locations.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice, corn, and cacao. He views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams include having a basic economic foundation by which he can support his family. Among the challenges he faces are pests that impact his crops.

He enjoys studying so that his family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice, corn, and cacao

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda R. is a 37 year old single mother and a boutique proprietor in Kikambala Mombasa dealing with  women hand bags and cloths. She supports her two children and has been in the business for the past three years. This, being her second loan with KADET micro-finance, Matilda is looking forward to purchasing more stock of handbags and clothes for her business. She will use the anticipated profit to build her mother a house and to carry out repairs in her boutique.

In future she hopes to access more loans from KADET to boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of handbags and clothes.

loans.name: Jilina Antonio

texts.pt:
Jilina Antônio S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos, o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez somente 7ª classe, não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, faz a criação de frangos para abate ha mais de 5 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 9.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para reforçar o seu stock.

No futuro pretende solicitar um novo empréstimo para reforçar ainda mais o seu negócio de forma a responder a demanda da sua clientela.
texts.en:
Jilina Antônio S. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in the south of Mozambique. She is the mother of two children, the eldest of which attends school. She attended through 7th grade but did not continue because of her pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has never left Maputo, and has been raising chickens for more than 5 years. She doesn't have any employees and she has a monthly income of about 3,500MT to 4,000MT, which she applies to her household expenses and saves the rest to her bank account.

She has never taken out a loan from another bank. She got to know Hluvuku through her friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan for the amount of 9,000MT with which she plans to purchase more chicks, feed, and vitamins to reinforce her stock.

In the future, she hopes to seek a new loan to further reinforce her business and respond to the demand of her clients.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Placido

texts.es:
Placido de 34 años de edad vive en union libre con la Sra. Migdalia Burgo, en el Caserio La Tigra de la Comarca El Jicaro, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea.  

Esta solicitando su 1er crédito para la compra de dos vacas paridas, las cuales le permitiran obtener mayores ingresos por venta de leche, que es parte de su actividad agropecuaria.  Cuenta con su propia parcela de 45 mzs, las cuales presentan buenas condiciones para esta actividad agropecuaria, recibe ingresos adicionales por la venta de semovientes, en su comunidad es muy querido y se caracteriza por ser muy responsable.
texts.en:
Placido, age 34, lives with his common-law wife, Migdalia Burgo, in the La Tigra hamlet of the El Jicaro region, in the jurisdiction of Nueva Guinea. He is requesting his first loan for the purchase of two calving cows, which will allow him to obtain better income from milk sales, which is part of his agricultural activities. He has his own 45-manzana [78 acre] plot of land. His land is well-suited for this agricultural activity. He makes additional income from livestock sales. He is very beloved in his community and is known for being very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of cows

loans.name: Phlek

texts.en:
Mrs. Phlek K. currently weaves cloth for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 30 sets of cradles and mats before selling out. She also orders her products from her old and new clients and sells them to make additional income. 

Mrs. Phlek K. is married with two children who are attending public school, while her husband is working as a policeman. She would like to open a small business by selling a few grocery items, such as cooking ingredients, sweets and soft drinks, in front of her house. In order to start her new business, she needs more capital for buying inventory. So Mrs. Phlek K. is taking out her loan to purchase inventory for her new grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her grocery business

loans.name: Elsa Narcisa

texts.es:
Elsa Narcisa H. A. tiene 38 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 22 hasta 16 anos. 

Elsa es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura y cria chanchos. Su esposo trabaja en una hacienda de banano. Solicita el credito para comprar chanchitos. No sabe cuantos pero lo que se puede. Con el apoyo del préstamo podria seguir avanzando económicamente en la vida, poco a poco vendiendo los chanchos. Su sueno es que sus hijos sean felices y que Dios les cuiden. 

Le gusta jugar deportes.
texts.en:
Elsa Narcisa H. A. is 38 years old. She lives with her common-law husband in the canton of Chillanes, located in the Bolívar province. She has four children who range in age from 22 to 16 years old.

She is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos communal bank, located 20 minutes from the San José del Tambo parish. There are 15 group members in total, and the majority of them work growing cacao or have their own small businesses.

Elsa works in farming and in raising pigs and her husband works on a banana estate. She is requesting the loan to purchase pigs. She does not know how many, but she will buy what she can. With the support of the loan, she will be able to continue moving forward financially in life, little by little, selling her pigs. Her dream is for her children to be happy and for God to look after them.

She likes to play sports.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica E. D. G. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista y junto a tres hijos. Rosa posee una tortillería desD. hace 15 años, en el cual ha trabajado arduamente por el bienestar D. sus hijos, ya que Rosa es una madre  muy dedicada a su hogar y que cuenta con enormes deseos D. salir adelante. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, esto debido a que cuenta con muy buena clientela, y ella desea poder atender a más clientes, puesto que en muchas ocasiones por falta D. masa no ha podido atender a mas personas, es por ello que solicita el préstamo el cual le permita comprar más materia prima y así vender más y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa Angélica E. D. G. is 43 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad.  She lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and their three children.  Rosa has had a tortilleria (tortilla bakery) for 15 years in which she works very hard for the well-being of her children.  Rosa is a mother who is devoted to her family and who has an enormous desire to get ahead.  Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn to make her tortillas.  Rosa has a lot of very good customers and she would like to be able to serve even more since quite often she can't serve any more people as she doesn't have enough dough.  This is why she is requesting the loan as it will enable her to buy more supplies and thereby be able to sell more and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Aristides Vicente

texts.es:
Aristides de 23 años, tiene un negocio mixto que incluye centro de llamadas y cyber. Vive en una zona caracterizada como urbana porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada Suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Hace un años atrás el tuvo que vender su carro para tener su propio centro de llamadas y poder comprar algunas computadoras para ubicar un pequeño Cyber. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene un negocio mixto con servicios de llamadas e internet. El trabaja todos los días con ayuda de su tía. Las llamadas las cobrar a un mínimo de $ 0.05 el minuto, y el internet la hora $ 0.60.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras para su negocio y darle más comodidad a sus clientes al pedir los servicios de internet. En el futuro quiere comprar mas computadoras para hacer mas grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Aristides is 23 years old.  He has a mixed business which includes a public telephone business and an Internet café.  He lives in a district which is characterized as urban because the majority of its inhabitants are small merchants.  It is the suburb of Guayaquil.

A year ago he had to sell his car to obtain his own public telephone business and be able to buy some computers to set up a small Internet café.  Because of that good decision he now has a mixed business which provides customers with telephone calls and Internet access.  He works every day with the help of his aunt.  The calls cost a minimum of $0.05 a minute and the Internet access costs $0.60 an hour.

He would like to use this loan to buy computers for his business and to make it more comfortable for his customers who are requesting Internet access.  In the future, he would like to buy more computers to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with ten children aged between twenty-four and twelve. He engages in mixed farming producing maize, sugarcane, bananas and milk which are all sold locally.

He has applied for this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his animal trade.He hopes the loan will earn enough income to enable him to sell a variety of animals not just the cattle he has been selling. He really wants to uplift his family's standard of living through the income.

He also lacks enough capital to buy farm inputs like fertilizers.

loans.use: purchasing animals for resale

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun K. is a 54-year-old, widowed who she currently lives in the province of Battambang. Her husband passed away for many years ago from illness. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are not married, and they still live with her under the same roof. Khen Kheng currently generates an income of approximately $3 per day by selling vegetables in the local market. One of her children makes a living as a motor taxi driver in the community and he always helps her pick up vegetables and drives her to the market place before he starts his business. Sadly, the motorbike  has broken down. Aun K. would like to request a loan for her son to buy a used motorbike to placing the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to replace her son's broken one.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 52-year-old married woman from Saida and owner of  a lingerie shop (selling special women's underwear). Dalal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy special occasion designs that are requested from her clients during this season. Dalal’s shop is well known among her friends, relatives, neighbors and friends of friends. She is up to date with all the recent designs and keeps her clients up to date too. She is willing to open another branch soon and hopes to have the same success as with the present one. She helps her husband in their living and, at the same time, her husband is very proud of her.

loans.use: To buy requested special occasion designs

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 28-year-old married man.  He is the father of two children.  He has been painting furniture since 2005 and has 15 years of experience. Khodor was 13 years old when he first started working in this business.  Since childhood, he had help his parents earn their living.  That is why everyone can rely on him, from his neighbors' point of view. 

Khodor is a man with good manners, liked by most of his friends, neighbors and relatives. His clientele increases day after day, and he hopes to expand his business to manufacture house furniture, doors and kitchens.

This is the first time Khodor has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.  He plans to use the loan to buy the necessary tools for his business and get a new bedroom for his baby boy.

loans.use: To buy tools for business & bedroom for new baby

loans.name: Batgerel

texts.en: Batgerel, 35, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her older daughter and son attend a local school. Batgerel began her business by growing and then selling vegetables at a local market in 2003. In 2008, she and her husband started a taxi business that they operate in the winter time. Batgerel also makes deels, a Mongolian traditional handmade coat, and sells them to people who live in the countryside, far from the market. As a result of their hard work, the family bought a house for 8,000,000 MNT in 2010. Batgerel is a hardworking and active person who says, " I do several things at the same time because I like to keep myself busy. I am planning to operate my handmade clothing business." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more materials to make deels.

loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos Antonio E. R. de 30 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, el cual vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y con quienes reside en San Jacinto en el departamento de San Salvador. Con mucho esfuerzo hace 7 años que Marcos logro comprar un bus, el cual en la actualidad le permite contar con una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Él se dedica a hacer viajes para personas que se dirijen a la iglesia Elim, una de las iglesias más grandes del país, los viajes los realiza  todos los días de la semana, contando con clientes fijos. Marcos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar llantas nuevas, y así mismo para contar con el dinero necesario para hacerle todas las revisiones y arreglos necesarios, de manera que pueda contar con un bus en mejores condiciones, el cual le permita seguir ganando dinero y así mismo pueda brindar seguridad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marcos is 30 years old and a very responsible and hard-working man. He lives in San Jacinto, department of San Salvador, with his wife and two young children, who are in school. Seven years ago with a lot of hard work Marcos was able to purchase a bus, which today provides his family with a source of income. He makes a living transporting people to Elim church, one of the biggest churches in the country. He makes the trip every day of the week with a fixed clientele. Marcos is requesting the loan so he can purchase new tires and have the money to make all the necessary improvements and repairs so his bus will be in better condition. This will allow him to keep making money and providing a safe service to his customers.

loans.use: Make improvements and repairs to his bus

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is 35 and the mother of five kids who currently live with her in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for five years. She also relies on income from her husband who has a formal salary every month. Recently, this family is not comfortable with living in their house because it needs to be repaired so Chea S. has decided to ask for a loan to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To repair her broken house.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 24 years old and is married with two children aged two years and  and six months. He has been doing mixed farming for three years, producing and selling milk, maize and vegetables to the local market.   He earns additional income from his carpentry workshop.

Moses has requested this loan amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to fund the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow. He says he expects improvement on his milk production and better income for the family which will ensure better meals and clothing for his young family. He is focusing on expanding his farm in future and rearing more dairy cows.

Moses points to increased competition as the major challenge as it results in fluctuating prices. He would be happy if the loan products were diversified further.

loans.use: to purchase and ensure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth J. is 25 years old.  She is married to Isaac Kering, who is a business man.  They are blessed with two children aged 2 and 5 years old.  

Ruth does dairy farming.  She supplies milk to the hotels in the Itigo trading centre and to her neighbors. She has been in this business for 2 years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 6500.

Ruth has borrowed loan of Ksh 30,000 from KADET LTD.   This her first loan and she wishes to use the money to purchase a dairy cow.  The profits will be used to improve the welfare of her family and for savings.   Her dreams are to ensure that her family is financially stable and also to own a car.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam tiene un puesto de venta de maní azucarada que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar en mayor cantidad maní y azúcar, para ahorrar en costos y tratar de mejorar sus ingresos. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en alquiler en la zona de las Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Miriam es cliente antigua de IMPRO y esta es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Miriam has a stand where she sells sugared peanuts.  This is her source of income with which she supports her family.  She requires this loan to buy a larger quantity of peanuts and sugar so that she can save on costs and try to improve her profits.  Miriam is married, has two children, and lives in a rental house in Las Pasankeri neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  Miriam is a long-standing client of IMPRO and this is the third time that she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar for her sugared peanut business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 32 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like noddles, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Jenny has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jenny  aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Raquel; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jora que es un ingrediente que se usa para preparar la chicha (bebida a base de maíz), ella vende en el mercado de Anta desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the "AMANECER ANTEÑA” community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Raquel is 28 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling jora (a type of yellow corn), which is an ingredient used for preparing 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She makes her sales in Anta market, from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  Through this business, she would like to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business selling jora.

Raquel is requesting this loan to buy corn and jora wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and 'jora' (a type of yellow corn) wholesale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de graduación de sus hijos. 
Doña Antonia tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes este es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para darle lo mejor a su familia. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que desea que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesario para que tengan un futuro mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
Antonia is asking for a loan to pay for her children’s graduation expenses.

She has a grocery store that’s the family’s source of income and what she has to provide the best for her family.

She will use part of her profits from her business to repay the loan because she wants her children to have the necessary schooling so that they will have a better future in life.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a forty-five year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been dealing in dried fish for two and a half years.  His vision is to own a big fish stall, and to educate his children.  Julius needs fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with one child who is still too young for school.  He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated matatu (public service vehicle) business his potential customers are general passengers.  George faces a major challenge of rush hour timing in his business.  He dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the KES 60,000 loan he wants to renew his public service motor vehicle license and service his motor vehicle.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To renew his public service motor vehicle license and service his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and married with four school-aged children. Rosalinda is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (Php) a month.

Rosalinda is asking for a loan of Php 16,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm. Rosalinda grows rice, and has been doing this for 12 years.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes that her rice will grow better, and she wishes to have a good harvest to increase her income. She will use the profit in providing the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 51 years old and married with two children who are 15 and 20 years old. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has employed one person to assist her in her business. Esther has been in the business for five years and she has improved her business through Faulu Kenya. Esther hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 47 years old, married and has three children aged 21, 20, and 14 who are in school.  He has been rearing pigs for two years.  He was previously selling cosmetics to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business.  This has helped him to retain his business for two years.  He hopes to have more pigs in his farm in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy feed for pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Ameri

texts.es: Ameri, de 53 años es una mujer soltera y muy dedicada a su familia. Ella vive en casa de sus padres que son ancianos, ubicados en el caserío de Purhuaracra. Ella es una mujer sencilla, toda su vida la dedicó a apoyar a sus hermanos menores, cuidando a sus sobrinos a los que quiere mucho. Pero como buena mujer del campo ella se dedica a la agricultura. En sociedad con su hermana siembran diversos pastos naturales, como avena, alfalfa y alcacer, los que le sirven a ella para su negocio de compra y venta de alfalfa, que según su experiencia, es el pasto de mejor calidad y muy difícil de ser producido, ya que necesita muchos cuidados. Después de comprar diferentes sembríos de pasto, ella lleva a comercializar a la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas una vez al mes, además de ir ocasionalmente al caserío de Palcamayo. Consiente de sus necesidades económicas, ella también compra ovejas en cantidad; las que engorda y comercializa a un mayor precio, está actividad le brinda un dinero extra para salvarla de cualquier apuro. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores de purhuaracra” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Ameri de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de pastos naturales “alfalfa”, pues el precio de venta esta subiendo y desea abastecer su venta hasta diciembre.
texts.en: Fifty-three-year-old Ameri is a single woman who is very dedicated to her family.  She lives with her elderly parents in the neighborhood of Purhuararca.  She is a modest person who has dedicated her entire life to helping her younger siblings, taking care of her nieces and nephews whom she loves very much.  But, like a good country woman, she farms for a living.  Together with her sister, she grows various kinds of animal feed, such as oats, alfalfa, and barley, which help her with her business buying and selling alfalfa.  Her experience has shown that this is the best quality feed and the most difficult to produce, since it needs a lot of care.  After buying different sown fields of feed, she markets her produce in the town of San Pedro de Cajas once a month.  Occasionally, she will also market in the neighborhood of Palcamayo.  Because she is aware of her economic needs, she also buys large quantities of sheep, which she fattens and resells at a higher price.  This provides her with extra money to use in case of emergency.  She belongs to the Productores de Purhuararca Communal Bank and this is her fourth loan with MFP, where she hopes for your support in order to continue to pursue her goals.  She promises to make her payments on time.  If she were to receive your help, Ameri would invest the loan money in purchasing several kilos of alfalfa feed, since its sale price is rising and she wants to be supplied for sales through December.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of alfalfa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes through catalogs.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La señora Leticia cuenta con su negocio de artículos de segunda mano desde hace 4 años, ofreciendo herramientas para todo tipo de oficio. En el que ofrece martillos, pinzas, serruchos, sierras, llaves, cajas para guardar herramientas y más, este negocio es parte de la fuente de ingresos, pero a Leticia le gustaría invertir más, por tal motivo quiere comprar ropa de segunda mano de diferentes prendas para que sus ventas sean mayores a las que tiene hasta hoy. Leticia se vera beneficiada en su ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Leticia began her secondhand business four years ago, offering tools for all types of trades. She offers hammers, pliers, various kinds of saws, wrenches, tool boxes and more.

This business is part of her source of income, but Leticia would like to invest more with the idea of buying secondhand clothes to offer something different to sell, so that her income will be greater than it is at present. This will benefit her family income.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing in order to grow her business

loans.name: Mukai Group

texts.en:
Enesta is 59 years old and lives in Gweru. Her husband does not work and they have four children, all of whom have finished school. They care for three further dependents.
Enesta rears and sells chickens and has been doing so for 20 years. She has four employees. An irregular power supply can make it hard to keep the young chicks warm. She supplements her income by growing and selling vegetables.
Enesta will invest the money that she borrows by purchasing additional chicks and heating equipment. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and that she will be able to buy her own truck to supply a wide range of shops.

loans.use: to buy chicks and heating equipment.

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is in his early 40s, is married with four children who are still going to school. He has been running a general store for 6 years now. He works from 6 a.m to 9 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to increase his store inventory.
His dream is to one day be able to buy a pick-up for collecting his shop items.

He will share this loan with his loan group "New Africa" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina tiene 32 años, y es madre soltera de tres niños. Ernestina se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y tambien trabaja en una escuela preparando las meriendas para los estudiantes. Por su trabajo en la escuela Ernestina gana $100 al mes. El cultivo de maíz lo trabaja ella personalmente, y lo utiliza primordialmente para la alimentación de sus hijos. Ella aprendió el oficio de agricultura de su madre, quien tambien fue madre soltera.

Ernestina ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de insumos agricolas, como abono y pesticidas, para su cultivo. Con la ayuda del préstamo Ernestina podra proporcionar el alimento necesario a su familia.

Ernestina desea seguir trabajando fuertemente para darle a sus hijos las oportunidades que ella no tuvo, brindarles una educación para que ellos se puedan defender cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 32 and a single mother of three children.  She grows corn for a living and also works in a school preparing student lunches.  She earns $100 a month at the school.  She grows the corn all by herself and uses it mainly to feed her children.  She learned agriculture from her mother who was also a single mother.

Ernestina has requested a loan through the Fundación Campo to buy agriculture supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for her crop.  With the help of the loan Ernestina will be able to feed her family.

She wants to continue her hard work so she can give her children the opportunities she never had, and give them the education they need to earn a living when they are older.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn crop.

loans.name: Soaibu

texts.en:
Soaibu is 45 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has nine children, eight of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Soaibu has been working hard to manage his shop, where he sells sewing machines and makes and sells clothes. 

Soaibu is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to expand his business and buy more sewing machines. This will help him to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Soaibu hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Soaibu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Soaibu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette, age 33, owns and operates a beauty salon that provides manicures, pedicures, haircuts, and hair styling. She has had this business for 10 years. She and her husband have four children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000 in order to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor.

Janette is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Janette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her elder two children are school students and her youngest child goes to kindergarden. 
Narangerel started her business in 2009 by selling firewood and coal from home. She then built her own small shop to sell it. Now that winter is approaching, demand for her product is very high. Therefore she needs some financial support to meet her customers' demands. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business is the only income for the family and I have three children to support therefore I have to do everything I can to support them". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more wood.

loans.use: to buy more wood for resale.

loans.name: Alexandra Maricela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Alexandra, tiene 27 años, está separada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de seis años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con uno de los créditos que recibió empezó su negocio.

Ella para ganarse la vida y para  que a su hijo no le falte nada se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00, aprovecha que a esta hora su hijo está en la escuela, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil o a Portoviejo cada vez que necesita. Empezó su negocio con el crédito anterior y le está yendo  muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es que a su hijo no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos comunal bank meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural richness and handicrafts such as, for example, the panama straw hat, well known both within and outside of the country.

Here, we meet Sra. Alexandra, 27, who is separated and has a 6 year old son from that relationship. Her son is in school and she lives with her parents. She has gone through two loan cycles with the communal bank and enjoys the help they have provided. She started her business with an earlier loan she received.

In order to earn a living and to insure her son does not lack anything, Alexandra sells all kinds of clothing. She sells door to door and also from her house where her most well-known customers can come. She works every day from 8 until 11 and takes advantage of the time her son is in school. She offers credit to her clients and collects every eight days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil or Portoviejo whenever necessary. As noted, she started her business with the previous loan and it is doing very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing.

Her dream is that her son will have everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is happily married and has been blessed with two children. She is thankful because her clothing business is growing. Nowadays, she needs to buy inventory because it's Christmas season and her capital is not sufficient. So, Jamilah is requesting a loan of P50,000. Through the loan she could continually improve her business and earn bigger profits to provide for her family needs.

Jamilah has been involved in her clothing sales business for almost 12 years. She really wants to raise her standard of living and she is also aiming to educate her two children. So, she patiently manages her business in order to increase her income. Jamilah would be thankful if her requested loan were granted because it might enable her to obtain her main goal in life.

loans.use: to buy in clothing for her business

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en: Thavy, 38, is married and resides with her husband and five children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She is a skirt weaver. Her husband works for the military in Phnom Penh. All of her children are still in her care. Thavy is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more silk to weave skirts at home which she will sell. In the future, she would like to build a kitchen and support her children's studies until they each get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more silk to weave skirts for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 42 years old and widowed with two children aged 18 and 22. She sells groceries to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her grocery business in the near future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Telma Elvira

texts.es: Telma Elvira, reside con sus hijos en la zona occidental del país. Es una madre muy trabajadora y emprendedora, siempre con el deseo de entregarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Es responsable, honesta y humilde. Posee una panadería donde elabora pan dulce, pan francés entre otros. Con esfuerzo a llegado a posicionarse como una buena comerciante ya que los vecinos prefieren comprarle por su manera de atenderlos y los precios son accesibles. Telma desea ampliar su negocio es decir comprar más materia prima y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL  un prestamo para la compra de materiales como: azúcar, jaleas, levadura, maíz entre otros así ella podrá estar satisfecha con poder lograr su sueño de brindarle un buen futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: para la compra de materiales como: azúcar, jaleas, levadura, maíz entre otros .

loans.name: Keeyda Katherine

texts.es:
Keeyda es una mujer de 24 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Keyyda pudo estudiar la carrera de Fisioterapia y Rehabilitación, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
